loans.name: Kinaawa D(Iii) Group

texts.en:
Caroline is 26 years old. She has a retail shop. She sees a business opportunity; she would like to expand her shop to sell wholesale as well. She usually earns shs 60,000 (~$36 USD) in profits weekly. With the extra profits she earns, Caroline intends to start a poultry business. Dorothy has a hardware business. Margret wants to use the loan to purchase more clothes for sale. Joyce sells charcoal. Annet works in a hotel.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To raise capital to improve their businesses

loans.name: Usumacinta 1 Group

texts.es:
Maria is 36 years old, has three children, and her business is preparing various typical regional dishes. She has this business in her home, and she sells three times per week. With the loan she plans on expanding her business. Her income is used for her family’s expenses. She is part of the Usumacinta 1 Group, together with her colleagues: Bertha P. A. (sells food), Esther Guadalupe (sells perfumes and cosmetics), Concepcion R. D. (sells clothing), Maria Cruz R. P. and Maria Ofelia D. P. (seamstresses).

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

MARIA TIENE 36 AÑOS, TRES HIJOS, SE DEDICA A PREPARAR DISTINTOS PLATILLOS TIPICOS DE LA REGION. NEGOCIO QUE TIENE INSTALADO EN SU CASA, VENDE TRES VECES POR SEMANA, CON EL CREDITO PRETENDE AMPLIAR EL NEGOCIO, SUS GANANCIAS SON UTILIZADAS PARA LOS GASTOS FAMILIARES. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO USUMACINTA 1, JUNTO CON SUS COMPAÑERAS: BERTHA PÉREZ A. (VENTA D COMIDA), ESTHER GUADALUPE (VENTA DE PERFUMES Y COSMETICOS) CONCEPCION R. D. (VENTA DE ROPA), MARIA CRUZ R. PÉREZ Y MARIA OFELIA D. PÉREZ (COSTURERAS).

loans.use: Sell food.

loans.name: Adham

texts.en: Adham lives and works in Beirut. He is a car painter. This is the first time he has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. He needs $1000 to buy materials to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy material

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr:
Madame Jeanne P. is 38 years old and married. She operates a hair salon in Adèta, a city located about 150 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She styles hair, does braids, and washes the hair of many women in town. Her hair salon is very popular in this city. For this reason, she wants this loan to enlarge her beauty shop. With this first loan in particular, she wants to buy beauty products (hair extensions, weaves, wigs, liquid soap, etc….) in order to meet customer needs. She has tried her luck to improve her life.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Jeanne P. est âgée de 38 ans et mariée. Elle opère en salon de coiffure à Adèta, une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Elle coiffe, tresse et lave les cheveux de beaucoup de femmes dans la localité. Son salon de coiffure est très populaire dans cette ville. Pour cette raison, elle désire ce crédit pour agrandir son établissement de beauté. Spécialement avec ce premier crédit, elle veut acheter les produits de beauté (mèches, tissages, perruques, savons liquides etc.…) afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle a tenté sa chance pour améliorer sa vie.

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
Elisa started the business due to financial necessity since she did not have enough money to raise her children. Her husband does not make very much money as a welder because he is not on a fixed income. Elisa wanted her 2 children to continue with their studies, but it was difficult because she did not have enough money to buy neither school supplies, nor uniforms, nor shoes. It was then—10 years ago—that she started selling basic foodstuff such as beans, sugar, rice, bread, and milk. She soon set up her general store, and thanks to this business, her children have been able to study and get ahead in life.

She needs financial support, a loan of $350.00 USD that she will repay in 6 months, so that she can restock her shop by purchasing merchandise. With your help, Elisa will move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Elisa inició el negocio por necesidades economicas, ya que no se completaba para sacar a sus hijos adelante, porque su esposo gana poco y su sueldono es fijo, el trabaja como Soldador. Ella deseaba que sus 2 hijos siguieras estudiando, pero veia la situacion muy dificial porque no tenia para comprar los utiles escolares, unifromes ni zapatos. Fue entonces que comenzó su negocio hace 10 años vendiento productos de primera necesidad como frijol, azucar, arroz, pan y leche, hasta poder establecer una tienda de abarrotes, y garcias a esta sus hijos han podido estudiar y salir adelante.

Ella necesita apoyo economico, un prestamo por US $350 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir mas su abarroteria, comprar mercancia. Con tu ayuda Elisa saldra adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
Khursheed baji, wife of M. A., lives in Kasur, Pakistan. Khursheed is the mother of two children. Her children are enrolled in a local school near her home. Khursheed baji is a housewife. She is master of making decorative embroidery. She now considers this skill to be an occupation and has started making embroider dresses for customers on order.

Khursheed successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute of Pakistan. Now she needs material to fill her customers' orders. Therefore, she is applying for a loan to buy material so she can earn a good profit.

loans.use: To buy material for her embroidery business

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Despite her advanced age, Modesta continues to be as enterprising and diligent as ever. She enjoys the satisfaction of having provided education and financial stability for her two children, who are about to start college with high hopes and a sense of responsibility. Modesta and her husband Gregorio, a master mason, were able to build their small home. Modesta also raises chickens and cuyes (guinea pigs), and sells them in the town of Juliaca’s weekend market. Modesta also keeps a small stand outside her house porch, where she sells candy. She would like to purchase more candy to stock up her stand. Modesta is hoping for a favorable answer from your caring heart.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

Pese a su avanzada edad, doña Modesta, sigue con su espíritu emprendedor y diligente que siempre la caracterizó, gracias a ello, actualmente tiene la satisfacción de brindarle estabilidad económica y educación a sus 2 menores hijos, quienes dentro de poco tiempo concluirán sus estudios secundarios para emprender con mucha ilusión y responsabilidad sus estudios universitarios.Junto a su esposo Gregorio, quien trabaja como maestro albañil lograron construir su pequeña vivienda, lugar donde también cobija y alimenta a sus animalitos menores (gallinas y cuyes) y los vende cuando estos ya toman un peso y talla adecuada en la feria de la plaza dominical de la ciudad de Juliaca. Adicionalmente a esta labor Doña Modesta tiene un pequeño puesto de venta de golosinas en el frontis de su casa, negocio en el que pretende aumentar el stock de mercadería para ello espera recibir respuesta favorable de cada uno de vuestros corazones solidarios.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to stock up candy stand

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji is the wife of M. H. and lives in a city named Chichawatni, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. Her eldest son is in 10th standard. Her next eldest son is in 5th standard. Her younger son is in 4th class. Her daughter is in 7th standard. Nasreen baji is a very responsible woman; she knows her responsibilities so well. Her husband sells clothes and has been in this profession for the last 3 years. Nasreen baji is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to expand her husband's business.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Zareena baji wants a loan to buy cloth to resell. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle). Manzoran baji and Sakina baji each want a loan to buy grocery items (wheat, rice, sugar) for their grocery shops.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Nooran

texts.en:
Nooran baji is the wife of C. S. and lives in Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its sweetmeat and decorative embroidery. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 27 years. She is the mother of six children. Nooran baji's husband is a milk seller with twenty years of experience in the profession. Presently, they have six goats and four buffalos at their house for milking.

Nooran baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a second loan to buy another buffalo to expand their family milk business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo to expand their family milk business.

loans.name: Ndèye Coumba

texts.fr: Ndèye Coumba S., 50 ans, mariée avec 06 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de TP Tackou Ligueye depuis 6 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité de vente de prêt à porter (tenue homme et femme), de nappes et de drap de lit. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer ses conditions de vie. <b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Ndèye Coumba S., age 50, is married and has six children in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group of TP Tackou Ligueye for six years. She wants to bolster her business selling ready-to-wear clothing (for men and women), table cloths, and bedsheets. Her income enables her to improve her living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell ready-to-wear clothing, table cloths, and bedsheets

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is divorced and lives with her son and daughter-in-law. She owns a small booth at the central market in Simferopol and sells women’s clothes and warm jackets. She used to work as a salesperson at a store. However, she decided that it was time to start one of her own.

Tatyana has had this business for 2 years. She dreams about developing her business, hoping to become independent and be able to pay for her apartment. She has about 12,000 UAH of working capital in business, and her monthly profit is about 3,000 UAH. Along with this business she works part-time as a manager in a small store.

Tatyana would like to get a loan for 5,000 UAH to buy more goods for her business. She believes that additional income would help her develop her business to the point she would be able to pay her mortgage completely.

loans.use: To increase the assortment and inventory

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco tiene 59 años, está casado con Damiana, con la cual tuvo 7 hijos, viviendo ahora sólo con una, la menor, Catalina de 17 años. El se dedica a la atención de su pequeño restaurante, negocio con el cual sobrevive desde hace 30 años. Su establecimiento es muy concurrido, gracias a la gran sazón de su esposa Damiana y su hija Catalina, las cuales preparan gran variedad de platos para ofrecer a la clientela. Lo que más le gusta a Francisco es poder trabajar al lado de su familia y apoyarse los unos en los otros, él sabe que no estará siempre para cuidar a su hija, es por eso que quiere expandir su negocio y así poder heredarle el negocio. Francisco se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará utensilios de cocina, como ollas, tenedores, cucharas, etc., y también productos para cocinar más variedad de platos y hacer que su negocio sea mucho más concurrido.
texts.en:
Francisco is 59 years old and married to Damiana with whom he has 7 children. Only their youngest daughter, Catalina, who is 17 years old, still lives with them. Francisco has worked for the past 30 years running his own small restaurant. His restaurant stays very busy thanks to the great cooking of his wife Damiana and their daughter Catalina who prepare a large variety of dishes to offer their clientele. Francisco enjoys working side by side with his family where they can mutually support each other. He knows that he won't always be around to take care of his daughter which is why he would like to expand his business to eventually leave it to her as an inheritance. This is the first loan that Francisco has requested from Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money, he will purchase kitchen utensils like pots and pans, forks, spoons, etc. and products to increase the variety of dishes they offer so they can attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of kitchen utensils and ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Eid_E_Qurban Group

texts.en:
Parwyen is the group leader of the Eid-e-Qurban group. There are four members in this group. All of them would like to use the loan for his/her own business.

Seyweta and Latefa want to take out a loan for their tailoring business . Parwyen wants to use the loan for her husband and Salaha wants the loan for her bakery shop, which she has in her house. They all want to expand and progress in their businesses and earn more money to support their families. 
 
With this loan they can increase the size of their business and support their families. They are very happy to have this loan process in their country.

loans.use: To increase and strengthen their businesses

loans.name: Libertad Solina

texts.es:
LIBERTAD SOLINA V. D. V., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Solidarias” ubicado en el Jr. Pachitea N° 902 del Distrito D. Callería en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, tiene 63 años D. edad, 7 hijos mayores D. edad que trabajan con ella.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles vendía comida en el frontis delantero D. su casa por 08 años, gracias a Dios y a Manuela Ramos, poco a poco implementaba su bodeguita.

Con este préstamo D. S/.1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, compró 01 saco D. arroz, 01 saco D. azúcar, leche 02 cajas, 1 paquete D. detergente, 10 kh., D. fideos spaqguetti, 50 huevos, ambientación D. su local.

Muy agradecida D. Manuela Ramos por brindar el apoyo que necesitaba en su momento propicio
texts.en:
Libertad Solina V. D. V. belongs to the "Mujeres Solidarias" Communal Bank, located in the Callería District in the city of Pucallpa. She is 63 years old, and has 7 adult children who all work with her. The first loan she received for S/.300.00 Peruvian Soles she used to begin selling food in front of her house, which she has done for 8 years, and thanks to God and to Manuela Ramos (a Kiva Partner), little by little she was able to fill out her small store. With this loan of S/.1,500.00 Peruvian Soles, she will buy a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, 2 boxes of milk, a packet of detergent, 10 kg. of spaghetti noodles, 50 eggs, and use it to improve the atmosphere of her store. Libertad is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for offering this much-needed support.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, 2 boxes of milk, a packet of detergent, 10 kg. of spaghetti noodles, 50 eggs, and to improve the atmosphere of the store

loans.name: Mumtaz M. Niaz Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz Baji is a 38-year-old married lady and has been a citizen of a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan for the past 20 years. Her husband, M. N., runs a small hotel in the community where he sells Punjabi food. Pakistani people are fond of Punjabi food. Mumtaz Baji helps him by cooking the Punjabi foods (daal chawal, dahi bhalas and samosas). She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil and spices) to expand her husband’s food selling business.

She is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Allah Rakhi Baji and Rehana Kosar Baji each want a loan to buy a donkey cart for hauling. Ashran Baji and Shamim Akhtar Baji each want a loan to buy livestock (goats) to resell. Naseem Baji wants a loan to buy cold drinks for her cold corner.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for food business

loans.name: Yudaya Nankya Group

texts.en:
Yudaya N. is 49 years of age; she is a widow and mother of six. She rents a four-roomed house where she lives with her children. She does have access to piped water and electricity in her house. She also looks after four grandchildren who lost their father. She also looks after her elderly mother and auntie. She has two meals a day and her greatest expense is that of food for the family and rent for her house.

Yudaya N. owns a retail business in a shop she is renting and she works seven days a week. She receives about thirty customers a day and she sells on a retail basis. Yudaya N. also works as a cleaner in a nearby health centre. The challenge she has while doing this business is during rainy seasons, because that disrupts her business.

She has worked with MCDT for six years. She chose to work with MCDT because it was convenient for her. It is near her place of work and she also wanted capital to expand her business. She will use this loan to expand her stock and she also looks forward to expanding her business with subsequent loans.

Yudaya N. also looks forward to being able to pay school fees for her grandchildren till they complete their education.

loans.use: increase her stock

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Hasta hace siete años, Victoria solo dedicaba su tiempo a cuidar de su hogar y de sus cuatro hijos. No obstante, cuando sus hijos fueron creciendo ella se fue liberando también de algunas responsabilidades, por lo que decidió dedicarse tiempo para sí misma y entonces pensó en emprender un negocio propio.

Gracias a una promotora de una empresa de cosméticos Victoria se animó a vender productos de belleza por catálogo. Hoy ya tiene más de cinco años haciéndolo y le va muy bien. Por ello que más adelante le gustaría abrir una tienda-bazar en su casa para poder aumentar la mercadería y vender más productos.
texts.en:
Up until seven years ago, Victoria dedicated all of her time to taking care of her home and four children. However, as her children grew up she was relieved of some of her responsibilities and so decided to spend some of her time on herself and thought of setting up her own business. Thanks to a promoter from a cosmetics company, Victoria was inspired to sell beauty products from a catalogue. She has now been doing this for over five years and it is going very well. So that she might move forward, she would like to open a small shop in her house to be able to increase her merchandise and sell more products.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products for her business

loans.name: Samalie Nabukalu ‘S Group

texts.en:
Samalie is 31 years old, married and has three children between the ages of 10 months and 11 years. Her two older children go to school. She owns a five-room house where she lives with her family, and also takes care of additional family members--her mother and her late brother's two children. Samalie has access to electricity and piped water at home, and the family gets three meals a day. 

Another member of Samalie's loan group, Leticia, makes a living running a retail shop in a nearby suburb. She uses public transport to get to and from her store. Samalie gets about 20 customers a day and sells to all types of people. She works seven days a week and rents her business location. She has been in this line of work for 10 years, and made a living selling milk before that. This is her twentieth loan since joining MCDT ten years ago. Immaculate wants to use this loan to buy more things for her shop, and hopes to own a wholesale business some day.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell from her shop

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino, la señora Maribel Z. se ha desempeñado en su actividad de pulpería el cual ella posee en su localidad atendiendo todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana.

Ella  es una dama con un gran espíritu de superación y es por esta razón que ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de los productos comestibles como granos básicos y bebidas para así comercializarlos en su negocio y salir adelante.
texts.en:
In the city of Sandino, Ms. Maribel Z. works in her own shop, and attends to customers everyday beginning early in the morning. She is a lady with a grand spirit of improvement, and for this reason she came to Ceprodel to get a loan in order to buy foodstuffs - such as basic grains and drinks - so that she can sell them and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products

loans.name: Akouwa

texts.fr:
En 2003, cette femme a commencé le commerce de mèches et de tissages qu’elle vendait en détail, elle a une façon très attirante d’accueillir les gens qui viennent acheter chez elle ce qui lui permet de gagner tous les jours la confiance de nouvelles clientes. Présentement la demande de ses clients est élevée, raison pour laquelle elle veut augmenter son stock avec l’achat de 10 cartons de mèches et 10 cartons de tissages et 3 cartons de perruques.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
In 2003, this woman began doing commerce in hair extensions and weaves that she used to sell retail. She has a very winning way of welcoming people who buy from her, and this allows her to earn the trust of new customers every day. Presently, customer demand is high, which is why she wants to increase her inventory by buying ten boxes of hair extensions, ten boxes of weaves, and three boxes of wigs. She is married and the mother of two.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and weaves

loans.name: Antonio

texts.pt:
Name : Antonio M.
Internal Client ID : 18542
 Location; Boane
Primary Activity:  HABITACAO
 Loan Requested ; 10.000,00mt
Repayment Term: 16 
Loan Use; Compra de materiais de construcao
Disbursement Hluvuku; 01/06/09

Dêscription

Antonio M., natural de Manhica (distrito a 120 km de Boane), jovem de 33 anos de idade, casado, e é estudante e freqüenta 3˚- ano na Universidade Pedagógica na cidade de Maputo. Vive somente com a sua jovem família, esposa e 3 filhos menores de 9 anos, o mais velho frenquenta escola e esta na segunda classe.
Chegou ao distrito de boane na companhia dos seus progenitores no segundo mês de vida.

Para alem de estar a estudar, trabalho como professor na escola publica de boane porque também tem a formação media como professor. O seu rendimento mensal é de 5.500,00MT com o qual suporta as despesas escolares e de alimentação da família e vive em casa própria.

Nunca teve empréstimo com nenhum banco e este é o seu primeiro com a hluvuku – KIVA, no valor de 10.000,00MT para compra de materiais de construção da sua casa que vem construindo em fases. Teve conhecimento da existência da hluvuku através dos seus amigos e colegas de escola. Depois da formação tenciona levantar mais empréstimos para finalizar a sua moradia e desenvolver outros planos de negócio para aumentar a renda familiar.
texts.en:
Name : Antonio M. Internal Client ID : 18542 Location; Boane Primary Activity: HABITACAO Loan Requested ; 10.000,00mt Repayment Term: 16 Loan Use; Compra de materiais de construcao Disbursement Hluvuku; 01/06/09 Antonio M., 33, married, is a student in his third year at the Pedagogical University of Maputo, Mozambique. Born in the district of Manhica, he currently lives with his wife and three kids in Boane (where he has himself lived since he was 2 months old). His oldest son, in 2nd grade, is 9 years old. Antonio supports his family as an elementary public school teacher, with a monthly salary of 5500,00 MT. He owns the house they live in, which is still under construction. He decided to apply for a loan after hearing about Kvuluku from friends and classmates (he has never had a loan from any other institution). Antonio will use his first loan, in the amount of 10000,00 MT, to buy construction material to keep working on his house. After he graduates from college, he hopes to take out other loans to invest on finishing the house and maybe starting a business to improve his income.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction material

loans.name: Nancy Elena

texts.es:
La señora Nancy Elena es socia del Banco Comunal Cochapamba en la comunidad de San Miguel Alto, ubicada aproximadamente media hora fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca en el sur de Ecuador. Tiene 43 años, y está casada con 4 hijos. Su hija mayor ya está casada con familia propia, y sus otros hijos todavía viven con ella; tienen 21, 12 y 4 años. Su esposo está en Brooklyn, Estados Unidos, trabajando de albañil. Se fue hace 5 años, cuando ella recién se había quedado embarazada con su hijita menor. Esa etapa fue muy difícil para Nancy, pero es una señora muy fuerte y resistió. 

Sra. Nancy tiene un negocio de crianza de cuyes. Lleva un año criando cuyes, y ahora tiene unos 70. Los vende para asados y ocasiones especiales como primeras comuniones, grados, y otras fiestas comunales. Suele venderlos por época; por ejemplo, ahora está vendiendo bastantes para fiestas de grado. También tiene algunas ovejas. Sra. Nancy antes tenía una tienda en la ciudad de Cuenca, pero después de que nació su hijita decidió quedarse en la casa para estar más cerca de su familia. 
La señora está pidiendo un préstamo de $550 para la compra de alimentos para sus cuyes; específicamente comprará llano. Su meta para el futuro es poner un negocio fuera de su casa ya cuando vuelve su esposo del extranjero. Él espera volver dentro de dos o tres años.
texts.en:
Nancy Elena is a member of the “Cochapamba” communal bank in the community of San Miguel Alto, which is located approximately a half-hour outside of the city of Cuenca, in the south of Ecuador. She is 43 years old, is married, and has 4 children. Her oldest daughter is already married and has her own family. Nancy’s other children still live with her. They are 21, 12, and 4 years old. Her husband is in the United States, in Brooklyn, working as a mason. He left 5 years ago, when she had just gotten pregnant with her youngest daughter. This was a very difficult time for Nancy, but she is a very strong woman and she pulled through. Nancy has a business raising guinea pigs. She has been raising guinea pigs for a year, and now she has about 70 of them. She sells them for barbeques and special occasions such as first communions, graduations, and other communal parties. She also has some sheep. Nancy used to have a store in Cuenca, but after she had her daughter, she decided to stay at home to be closer to her family. Nancy is requesting a loan of $550 to buy feed for her guinea pigs; specifically, she will buy forage. Her goal for the future is start a business outside of her home when her husband returns from the United States. He hopes to come back within two or three years.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy buy feed for guinea pigs

loans.name: Esther Group

texts.en: Rebecca is 33 years old, married and has two children. She makes a living as a seamstress, and is the leader of a trust bank group known as ‘Esther’. She is at center in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are traders, food vendors and/or farmers, and they all work hard to provide for their families. They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from nearby communities and sell them in the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members of this group have been in business for a long time and have amassed a great deal of experience. They are seeking a loan to procure more goods and expand their businesses. Their overriding goal is to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell to their customers

loans.name: Hadala Group

texts.en: Hadala is the group leader of the Hadala group. There are 4 members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan to progress their business and make it larger. So they are requesting a group loan of 40,000 Afghani. Hadala wants to take a loan for her husband who has a general store. G. Jan wants to take a loan for the business of a bakery. Zara wants to take a loan for the business of tailoring. Bibi Asafa wants to take a loan for her husband who is a taxi driver. They are very thankful to AFS and Kiva lenders who support them.

loans.use: To progress her business

loans.name: Tayepsu Group

texts.en:
These are the members of the Tayepsu Group. They are small-scale businessmen based in the town of Waterloo. They have been in business for many years now but their businesses have been growing at a very slow pace. With the opening of a new branch in Waterloo of SMT, in partnership with Kiva partner Shine on Sierra Leone, they are seeking a loan in order to improve their businesses. With LE 500,000 each, they will be able to expand their businesses in order to make larger profits and consequently improve their standard of living.

Foday K. (in the middle of the group photo and in the small photo on the left) is the leader of this group. Foday is twenty-eight years of age. He was born in Waterloo, is married to a nurse and they have two children. One of their children is in class four and the other in class one. As you can see from the small photo, Foday sells bags, wall clocks, radios, cassette recorders, and mobile phone accessories. He has been in this business for ten years.

loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan O. nació en la ciudad de Horqueta departamento de Concepción el 25/09/1.973,actualmente tiene 35 años de edad, vive acompañado con la señora   Josefina Barúa quien  actualmente cuenta con 48 años de edad y con su única hija a escasos metros del centro de la ciudad de Itauguá.
 Juan  posee en su domicilio una carpintería hace más de 9 años, contando con maquinarias propias con los cuales fabrica sillas, mesas y otros muebles de madera, también realiza reparaciones y colocado de puertas y ventanas en la ciudad de Itaugua y alrededores.
Además de carpintero también realiza todo tipo de trabajos de plomería, electricidad y construcción como ser colocado o cambio de canillas, instalación de ducha eléctrica, reparación y colocado de cisternas y construcciones en general, actividades que realiza hace más de 7 años. 
El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de una maquina circular y cierta cantidad de madera, ya que la máquina la consiguió a buen precio y tiene pedido de cierta cantidad de muebles.
El señor Juan como proyecto a corto plazo desea comprarse una camioneta la cual lo ayudará a transporta sus muebles, ya que actualmente esta pagando un monto elevado de dinero en fletes.

loans.use: Compra de una maquina cepilladora y madera.

loans.name: Barikisu

texts.en: Barikisu is 45, married and blessed with six children. In her restaurant, she prepares and sells local foods like "fufu" and "banku” and has been in business for the last five years. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, and eaten with all kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is eaten with hot peppers or soup. She says that the prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs a loan to enable her to meet her production expenditures. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantains, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. With income from her business, she has provided for one of her children to graduate from high school. It is her desire to give her children hope and a better future. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantains, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood.

loans.name: Kaku

texts.en:
Kaku C. is currently in the business of selling charcoal out of her home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Kaku is 37 years old and is married to a husband who is a police man. She has 5 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a charcoal store.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ye Bi Ma Group

texts.en:
Alice is married and the mother of six children. She is 43 years-old and a trader in clothing materials. She trades in lace materials, textiles and clothing. Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations. She also sells cooking utensils. For lack of adequate working capital, she buys little stock and sells in the community market. She believes the loan will enable her to grow her business to the expected level. With the loan, she plans to purchase bulk cooking utensils, lace materials and textiles. She hopes to use part of her profit to expand her store.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called "Ye bi ma" which means to give support. She is the one standing in the middle in the group photograph. The members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan. The group is grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase bulk supplies.

loans.name: Roque

texts.en:
Roque A. L. B. is 35 years old and is married to Santa Ledezma. They live in their own home in a little town called Trinidad, on the outskirts of Encarnacion. Roque and Santa have been vendors for a long time. They operate their shop from their house, where Santa also runs a hairdressing salon. By running their own businesses, Roque and Santa have been able to save enough money and make a good profit for their family. 
They will use their loan of 1,500,000 Gs to buy merchandise and materials for hairdressing.

loans.use: Merchandise for resale and materials for hairdressing

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
Tania es una mujer perseverante que vive en el distrito de Yarinacocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 36 años, es madre de tres hijos menores de edad, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que es soldador y se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches, que funciona en su casa.
Tania forma parte D. Banco Comunal “D. Futuro” desde hace un año. 
El primer préstamo que recibó fue de 300.00 nuevos soles, que invirtió en insumos para preparar comidas. 
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1200.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados en la compra de sillas, carpa y mesas para ampliar su negocio. La meta de Tania es tener una fuente de soda.
texts.en:
Tania is a persevering woman who lives in the Yarinacocha district of the Ucayali region. She is a 36-year-old mother of three minor children. She relies on the support of her husband, who is a welder, and she works in the business of selling food at night out of her own home. Tania has been part of the "D. Futuro" Communal Bank for a year. She invested her first loan of 300.00 nuevos soles in materials for food preparation. Now she needs a loan of 1200.00 nuevos soles, which will be used to buy chairs, a tent and tables to grow her business. Tania's goal is to have a soda fountain.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use her loan to buy chairs, a tent and tables to grow her business.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Mrs. Oun K. is a villager in Doem Pour village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to pay for the rice farming. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, rice seed, pesticides, and gasoline to pump water to support the rice field. Her husband, Mr. Hang Meng, is a laborer. Mrs. Oun K. is 46-years-old and the mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, rice seed, pesticides, and gasoline to pump water to support the rice field.

loans.name: Zorigthuu

texts.en:
Zorigthuu is 33 years old and lives with his wife and 2-year-old infant in Harhorin, the ancient capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent.

With the help of his wife, who is a cook in his town, Zorigthuu operates a small cafe and grocery booth that he started in early 2009. He previously managed a cellphone trading business which didn't give him much profit. However, in his prior jobs he gained much business knowledge and experience which enabled him to start his cafe.

Zorigthuu’s business has progressed very quickly in its first year of operation and he is already planning to build his own workplace soon. He is requesting an 800,000 tugrug loan to purchase food ingredients, candies and raisins for his grocery booth.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients, candies and raisins

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy is 38 years of age and married with three children between the ages of 4 and 10 years. All her children go to school. She lives in a rented two-roomed house, where she stays.with five people. She has three meals a day. She takes care of additional family members. Her three greatest expenses in a month are paying electricity bills, school fees for children and rent for her residence and business premises. 

Cissy has a stall in Nalukolongo selling second-hand clothes and, besides this clothing business, she is a teacher by profession. She mainly sells on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She serves about 20 customers a day. She has done this business for six years now. Her main challenge is that there are many stalls that sell second-hand clothes. She has been with MCDT, a Kiva partner, for six years and is servicing her 12th loan, working with the same group mates for four years now. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second-hand clothing.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Prum

texts.en:
Prum S., age 53, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo province, Cambodia. She has four children, one of whom studies at a local primary school. Since 1979 she has made Cambodian rice noodles, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband helps his wife in the noodle business and is a farmer as well. He is able to earn $6 per day to help cover family expenses.

Prum and her husband’s standard of living has improved since they went into business, so they have decided to expand them. S. is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase pigs to raise for sale and noodle presses to produce more noodles. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of World Relief.

About CREDIT:

CREDIT MFI (Cambodia Rural Economic Development Initiative for Transformation Microfinance Institution) is an independent, faith-based Cambodian organization. It aims to empower economically-active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To expand her rice noodle production and buy pigs.

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es:
el sr. Jose Maria P. R. tiene 44 años de edad, vive en la colonia 3 de Mayo de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa. Jose se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, su puesto esta ubicado en el mercado los Dolores, tiene mas de 8 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, anteriormente tenia su local en plaza los Dolores pero le salio la oportunidad de conseguir un local en el mercado y esto es mucho mejor para el, ya que en este lugar las ventas son muy buenas. cuesta mucho conseguir un puesto en este mercado. 
Jose tiene un trabajador el cual le ayuda en el negocio.
Jose es casado y tiene 3 hijos, los cuales estan cursando sus estudios.
las ganancias que Jose obtenga las necesita para cubrir con todos los gastos de su hogar y de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose Maria P. R., 44, lives in Tegucigalpa's 3 de Mayo neighborhood. Jose sells fruits and vegetables in a stand located in Dolores market. He has been in this line of work for over 8 years. He used to have his fruit stand in the Los Dolores square but the opportunity arose to get a stand inside the market and this is much better for him because sales here are very good; acquiring a stand inside the market is very difficult. Jose has an employee that helps him with the business. Jose is married and has three children, who are students. Jose will use any profits from his busienss to meet household and family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Juana del Carmen R. López es profesora de secundaria, es el segundo crédito con nosotros excelente cliente el dinero lo solicita para ajustar la compra de un carro. Tiene dos hijos ya mayores están casados, tiene tres nietos, vive sola con su marido, tiene 15 años de ser profesora del Instituto San Rafael del Sur. Dice que se siente muy bien trabajar con nosotros que el crédito anterior lo invirtió en mejoras de su casa y ahora es otro lo invertirá en la compra de un vehículo para movilizarse de su casa al colegio.
texts.en:
Juana del Carmen R. López is a high school teacher. This is her second loan with us, and she is an excellent client. She is requesting the money to arrange to buy a car. She has two grown children who are married, and she has three grandchildren. She lives alone with her husband. She has been a teacher with the Instituto San Rafael del Sur for 15 years. She says that she feels really good working with us. She used the previous loan to make improvements on her house. She will now use this loan to buy a vehicle to go from her house to school.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a vehicle

loans.name: Mykola

texts.en: Mykola is married with one child. He and his wife Lesya have a business selling bicycles. Mykola loves this business because he himself loves to ride. (Their son who is three already has his own small bicycle.) Mykola would like to borrow 6,000 UAH to increase his bicycle inventory. His dream is to start a bicycle club in their small town to introduce more people to a healthy and fun activity.

loans.use: to increase his bicicyle inventory

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora  Francisca González es madre soltera de 3 hijos todos mayores de edad; ella posee un modesto local de venta de comida en el mercado de San Lorenzo  desde hace 20 años , sale todas  las mañanas bien temprano de su domicilio para preparar desayuno, media mañana y almuerzo.
Francisca  tiene una buena clientela  formada quienes recurren en forma permanente al local para adquirir los productos elaborados por la señora Francisca y por ello necesita de este crédito para ampliar su local.  
Con este trabajo mantiene  su hogar  y pudo sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Francisca González is a single mother of three children who are all adults. For 20 years, she has had a modest locale where she sells food in the San Lorenzo market. She leaves her home very early every morning to prepare breakfast, mid morning meal, and lunch. Francisca has good clientele made up of people who always go to the locale to acquire the products prepared by Francisca. That is why she needs this loan to make her locale bigger. With this job, she supports her home and she has been able to get her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay the labor and material costs for construction

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos es una madre de familia de 60 años de edad que vive junto a su último hijo de 17 años en el caserío Pomape, una zona rural dedicada básicamente a labores agrícolas que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Monsefú, conocido a nivel nacional por sus festividades turístico – religiosas, situado a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde muy joven a labores de ganadería, ella cría vacas y aprovecha la leche que producen para venderla a un acopiador de la zona que provee de este producto a una empresa procesadora de lácteos, esta actividad es la unica fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta por lo que trata de esforzarse para mantener el negocio. Para optimizar su producción ella suele alimentar a sus animales con pastos naturales que adquiere a los agricultores del lugar.

Santos desea mejorar la calidad de la leche que producen sus vacas para así poder adquirir mas ingresos, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de alimento balanceado y asi lograr su objetivo.

Santos es una mujer responsable y tranquila, en la comunidad donde vive sus vecinos le consideran una persona de confianza y que siempre trata de ayudar a los que la necesitan. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y poder adquirir mas vacas.
texts.en:
At 60 years of age, Santos has been the mother of children, and lives with her youngest son, 17 years old, in the Pomape housing section, in a rural area that is basically agricultural. It is located in the Monsefu district, nationally known for its tourist and religious festivities, and located twenty minutes from Chiclayo. Since she was young, she has worked in livestock, she raises cows and sells their milk to a local middleman, who provides the product to a dairy processing plant. This is her sole source of income, and thus she puts forth efforts to maintain the business. To optimize her production, she usually feeds her animals with natural grasses, which she gets from local farmers. Santos would like to improve the quality of milk her cows produce, to increase her earnings. For this reason she now needs to request this first loan from Edpyme Alternativa, 700 new soles, which she would use to buy balanced feed and thus achieve her goal. Santos is a calm, responsible woman. In her community, her neighbors view her as someone they can trust, who always tries to help those who need it. Her greatest wish is to continue to grow as a business woman and buy more cows.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy balanced feed to improve milk cow production

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda C. is a 65 year-old generous and thoughtful woman. She is concerned not only about her only child but about her adopted children and neighbors as well. Her son Nelson is a hired laborer and is earning just a small amount of money; he can’t even support himself and his mother. Due to this, Yolanda wanted to have her own way to earn money and augment the income of her son to support them and her adopted children. She joined ASHI in 2008 and has been receiving loans since then. Via these loans she has been able to finance the farming of vegetables in her backyard with the help of her son. These vegetables, once harvested, are sold in the market and to the people in their village. 

Proceeds of Yolanda’s vegetables farming business may be small, but her family is enjoying its ability to support their basic needs. Through the loans she will avail via her membership in ASHI, Yolanda is optimistic that someday her business will grow, allowing her to support the improvement of her family members' lives and the lives of others who may need their assistance.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides for vegetable farming.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 32-year old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband and three small children. She has owned her own women's clothing and lingerie store for the past ten years, to help her husband with the family expenses. She is requesting $1,000 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Constantita

texts.en:
Constantita C. is from the village of Comon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 49 and married with four adult children. To make a living, Constantita buys and sells scrap metals, junk appliances, used bottles and empty plastic containers from neighboring villages and sells it to the junk shops in the local community. Constantita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Constantita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used additional working capital. Constantita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more scrap items to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Constantita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more scraps items to sell

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora A. is 48 and married with 4 children.  She owns a business planting and harvesting taro for sale.  Nora has 3 years of experience in this business.  Nora needs a loan of WST$2000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 120 talas or US $50 per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2008, Nora  joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.  SPBD's loans are Nora's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen would like a loan to buy women's, men's and children's wear for his boutique, which he has run for one year now. Stephen is a 32-year-old married man. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He owns a house in which he lives in. His dream is to become financially stable and have an educated family. He started as a hawker and managed to raise enough capital to start the boutique.

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell in his boutique.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a single lady with one child. She operates Natures Secrets salon. She has been engaged in the business for ten years. She is a member of Shirley's group in Faulu Kenya where she accesses loans through group guarantee. She also saves her money on a weekly basis with the group.  

She has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to add to her stock of beauty products. She hopes to have a well established business and introduce new products. Josephine says that she is a hardworking lady.

loans.use: To add to her stock of beauty products

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has been practising mixed farming for the last 10 years in Nyamira, Western Kenya. Her farm produces maize, beans, tea, milk and bananas which she sells to the local market. She depends on the income from her farming activities to provide for her family's basic needs.

Mary is 38 years old. She is married and has been blessed with 6 children who are between the ages of 3½ and 20. All but one of the children attend school. Mary has requested this loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that the extra income from this loan will assist her in paying her children's school fees and improving her family's living standards. Mary's biggest challenges have been too much rain which spoils the crops and pesticides which affect the productivity of the crops.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Mainique”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Mainique, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria; ella tiene 22 años de edad y es divorciada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  trabajo de venta de jora de maíz (se usa para preparar la chicha) y también se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas como zanahorias, tomates y lechugas y después lo vende en el mercado modelo de Urubamba en forma ambulatoria, la socia quiere tener un puesto en el mercado para vender las hortalizas. La socia solicita el préstamo para tener capital de trabajo y poder comprar fertilizante y abonos para cultivar las hortalizas.

 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Maria, 22, is divorced and has two children. She alternates her daily activities with the sale of ‘jora de maíz’ (used to prepare chicha, a drink made from fermented corn). She also farms vegetables like carrots, tomatoes and lettuces which she then sells in Urubamba’s Modelo Market in an ambulatory way. She wants to have a stand in the market to sell her vegetables. She is asking for funds to have working capital and be able to buy fertilizers and manure for her vegetable crops. She is a member of the “Mainique” communal bank located in Mainique district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. She avails herself of this platform to express her gratitude to all those who share her dream and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To have working capital to buy manure and fertilizers for her vegetables.

loans.name: Ghulam Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Ghulam Fatima lives in the mid-sized city of Vehari, in Pakistan. Vehari is known for its agricultural industry. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for the past 10 years. She is 35 years old and married to S. A., who is 36 years of age and runs a grocery shop in the market. Ghulam Fatima has given birth to two sons and two daughters. Her eldest son works with his father in the grocery shop while her other two children are getting their education in 8th and 5th standards. Her youngest daughter is only 5 years old and has not yet started to attend school. 

Ghulam Fatima herself is a caring lady who prefers to spend her time at home managing the household chores and taking care of her family. She is an uneducated lady but wants to give her school-going children a good education so they never face the problems which she faces in her life and to make their lives better for the future. 

Ghulam Fatima has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy groceries for his grocery shop. She hopes that this investment will change her husband’s business condition from good to better and his household income will be increased. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and plans to work with Asasah on a long-term basis.

In the photo, group member Bashiran is displaying a shawl from her shawl-selling business.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery shop

loans.name: Laurita

texts.en:
Laurita T. is from the village of Mulos, Tampilisan, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 58 years old. Laurita is married and has 10 school-aged children. To make a living, Laurita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale. Laurita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Laurita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Laurita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Laurita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Laurita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita N. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Tinago, Brgy. Anahaw, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: fish vending and pig fattening. Her husband Eliseo N., who is 63 years old, is retired and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have eight children who are between 13 to 32 years old. Jovita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past twenty loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jovita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 16,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 8,000 PHP, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 21st loan, she is borrowing 16,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy more fresh fish to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and home repairs. Jovita N. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the operations of her fish selling business

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda R. is from the village of Tinaclaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Merlinda is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Merlinda owns and operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Merlinda has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Merlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC, and is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This loan will be Merlinda's 18th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure.

loans.name: Cilia Angela

texts.es:
Cilia de 36 años, es madre soltera con dos hijos de 11 y 3 años  tiene una pequeña papelería donde vende también ropa. Vive con sus hijos en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos.  

Comenzó hace 8 años atrás con un pequeño capital para tener su propia papelería y poder mantener a sus hijos ya que es madre soltera. Compro cuadernos, plumas, papelería y los comenzó a vender en un local. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 20h00pm en su papelería. Vende los juguetes a $ 5.00 en adelante, cuadernos a $ 0.80 c/u. También vende ropa para las clientes que les gusta la ropa económica. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, papelería, ropa. En el futuro quiere tener más espacio en la papelería para esta más cómoda.
texts.en:
Cilia, 36, is a single mother of two children who are 11 and 3 years old.  She has a small stationery shop where she also sells clothes.  She lives with her children in a canton called Playas one of Ecuador’s tourist destinations known for its vast variety of seafood.

She started out 8 years ago with a small amount of capital in order to have her own stationery shop to support her children since she’s a single mother.  She bought notebooks, pens and paper goods to start selling in her locale.  She is open for business from 7am until 8pm.  She sells the toys for $5.00 and up, notebooks for $0.80 a piece and also sells clothes to customers who like economical clothes.

She will use the loan to buy notebooks, paper goods and clothes.  In the future she’d like to have more space in the stationery shop in order to be more comfortable.

loans.use: For paper goods and clothes.

loans.name: Maria Carmen

texts.es:
María de 46 años, hace 13 años atrás comenzó con su negocio de venta de comidas en un puesto en la calle por motivación de su esposo ya que le encantaba la comida que ella preparaba en la casa. Con esfuerzo ubico su negocio de venta de comidas en un puesto en la calle y lo llama “El arbolito”. Trabaja con su esposo desde las 12h00 preparando la comida y repartiéndola hasta las 15h00 de lunes a viernes y los fines de semana trabajan en las noches. 

Cada almuerzo los vende a $ 1.60 esto incluye sopa, plato fuete, jugo. Los fines de semana  venden arroz con menestra con carne, pollo, chancho a $ 2.00 cada plato. Trabaja con ayuda de un empleado y su esposo que reparte la comida mientras que ella arma los platos. Vive con su esposo y dos hijos  en una zona urbana llamada suburbio lugar caracterizado porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, aceite, bebidas, carnes para hacer más platos. En el futuro quiere que sus hijos terminen sus estudios con éxito y ampliar el lugar.
texts.en:
María is 46 years old.  Thirteen years ago she started her business selling meals.  She was motivated by her husband since he loved the meals that she prepared at home.  Through hard work, she established her business selling meals from a street kiosk and called it “El arbolito” (Little Tree).  She works with her husband from 12.00pm to 3.00pm, preparing food and delivering it, from Monday to Friday.  On weekends they work evenings.

She sells each lunch for $1.60.  This includes soup, main meal and juice.  On weekends she sells rice with mixed vegetables and meat, chicken, pork, at $2.00 a dish.  She works with the help of an employee and her husband who delivers the meals while she makes them.  She lives with her husband and two children in an urban area.  The area is noted for the fact that most of its residents are informal salespeople.

María would like to use her loan to buy rice, oil, drinks and meat so that she can make more meals.  In the future, she would like her children to successfully complete their studies and to expand the premises.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil and drinks

loans.name: Djafar

texts.ru:
Djafar K. 52 qoda. On jenat  i imeyet 3 detey odin iz nix uchitsya v universitete a dvoya uchatsya v kolledje. Djafar i yeqo lubimaya semya jivut v Absheron regione uje 7 let. 

Djafar uje 8 let zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji odejdi , etomu biznessu yeqo nauchil starshiy brat. Seychas on nujdayestya v 2000 AZN chtobi sdelat polki v maqazine i kupit tovar dlya pereprodaji.
texts.en: Djafar K., 52, is married with three children. One of them is a university student and the other two are at college. Djafar and his dear family have been living in the Absheron region for seven years. Djafar's elder brother helped him start his business of selling clothes. Djafar is applying for a loan that would allow him to build shelves and buy goods for increasing turnover.

loans.use: to build shelves in the shop and purchase goods for resale

loans.name: Sibongokuhle Group

texts.en:
Angeline is 42 years old and is standing on the right side of the photo above, lifting up her hand. She is married with three children between 2 and 13 years old. 

She runs a plowing business from her home and has been in this business for six years. She also earns income from the government's child support grant and takes care of seven relatives.

She says that the main challenge to her business is that she has no vehicle for selling her products. 

She has requested this loan through WDB AND Kiva to hire a plowing vehicle. In five years time, she would like to see herself living in a  better home. She also appreciates WDB and KIVA for helping her.

loans.use: To hire a plowing vehicle

loans.name: Sop Serigne Babacar Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP SERIGNE BABACAR est créé le 15 décembre 2008. Il est composé de 15 femmes du même quartier et qui ont des liens d'amitié et de parenté. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KEUR SERIGNE BARRA

Madame MAME LAT F. M. debout à l'extrême droite de la photo, les bras croisés est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 32 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un garçon de 02 ans. 

Elle fait du commerce. Elle achète des tissus, des chaussures et d'autres articles destinés à la vente. Elle est très expérimentée dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir menée depuis plusieurs années

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer ses activités et d'accroitre ses bénéfices

Son objectif est de renforcer son activité et son niveau d'épargne
texts.en:
The solidarity group SOP SERIGNE BABACAR was created on December 15, 2008.  It is comprised of fifteen women from the same area who are tied by friendship and kinship. The group is part of the Banc Villageois of Keur Serigne Barra.  

Ms. MAME LAT F. M., standing on the far right in the photo with her arms crossed, is the group’s leader .   She is 32 years old, married, and the mother of two boys. She works in commerce.  She buys fabrics, shoes, and other goods for resale purposes.  She is highly experienced in this business domain for having worked at it for several years.  

Her new loan will enable her to bolster her business and to increase her profits.  Her goal is to improve her work and her savings.

loans.use: Buying shoes, fabrics, and a variety of goods

loans.name: Las Animas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre las  animas, esta ubicado en el municipio de Tecoanapa guerrero, los integrantes del grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre por que así se llama la comunidad donde viven y la mayoría de los integrantes pertenecen a esta comunidad, es por eso que decidieron ponerle así , esta historia es acerca de la señora Maribel C. L., ya que ella es la representante de este grupo, cuenta con 38 años de edad, esta casada y tienen 4 hijos Alejandra, Eduardo, estefan y luceli, de los cuales  los cuatro estudian, la mayor esta cursando el primer año de prepa, el otro esta en segundo año de secundaria y dos mas están en cuarto y sexto año de primaria, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo.

Doña Maribel decidió iniciar con este negocio por que tenia la necesidad de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, y sacar a sus hijos adelante, ya que no tenia la solvencia económica suficiente para conseguir darles una mejor educación a sus hijos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, el crédito que recibió lo invirtió en la compra de mas mercancía y catálogos como son: labiales, rubores, sombras, delineadores y mascaras, para continuar con las ventas de su negocio.

Dice que su negocio le esta beneficiando bastante ya que de las ganancias obtenidas esta sacando para pagar los estudios de sus hijos y mejorar su calidad de vida, también ahora esta mejorando su solvencia económica, tanto que esta ahorrando para comprarse una estufa, ya que la que tiene esta muy vieja. 

La señora Maribel desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para poder hacerlo crecer mucho mas, ya que quiere construir un local un poco mas grande, para ampliar su negocio, puesto que quiere poner su tienda de productos de belleza, para así tener mas variedad de productos e incrementar y mejorar sus ingresos, para así poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios, para que pueda seguir estudiando y tengan una muy buena carrera profesional, y puedan tener un mejor futuro.

Dice que todos sus compañeros, son personas responsables y pagadoras puesto que todas se conocen ya que son de la misma comunidad puesto que también son muy amigos así que no tienen ningún problema entre ellos, y hasta ahora nadie ha fallado con los pagos del crédito, ya que son muy responsables, puntuales y trabajadores.

Ella esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios de kiva y con FRAC, ya que gracias a ellos esta saliendo adelante y ha podido tener su propio negocio, para así seguir apoyando a su familia para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Las personas que integran el grupo de las animas y las actividades en las que invirtieron su crédito son las siguientes:
María victoria
texts.en:
The name of this group is Las Animas. The members live in the municipality of Tecoanapa Guerrero and decided on this name for the group because it is the name of the community where the majority of the members live.

Señora Maribel C. L. is the representative of the group and this is her story. She is 38 years old, married, and has four children: Alejandra, Eduardo, Estefan, and Luceli. They all attend school; the eldest is in first year college, the second in second year of high school, the last two are in the fourth and sixth year of primary school. Maribel’s job is selling cosmetics from a catalog.

She decided to start this business because she needed to provide a better standard of living for herself and her family and to help her children get ahead. As she could not afford to educate her children well nor assist her husband with household expenses, she took on a loan to buy catalogs and more merchandise such as lipstick, blush, eyeshadow, eyeliner, and mascara to start the business.

She says that the business has helped her a lot and she now can pay for her children’s studies and improve their quality of life. The money she earns has improved the family’s financial situation and she is now saving to buy a stove since the one that she has is very old.

Sra. Maribel wishes to invest more money in her business so that it can expand much more. For that reason she wants to build a bigger store from which to sell her beauty products. She will be able to have a greater variety and thus increase sales and income. Then she can continue helping her children through school so they can get good jobs and have a better future.

Maribel says that all the members of the group are responsible people who pay back their loans. They all know each other since they’re from the same community and they are all friends so there are no problems between them. Up to now no one has failed to make their repayments as they are responsible, punctual and hardworking.


The members of the Las Animas group and the business in which they will invest their loan:
María Victoria Angel B.-selling sandals 
Rafaela G. H.-fruit seller
Gregoria B. N.-selling chickens 
Maribel C. L.-selling cosmetics 
Petra S. C.-selling fish
 María de Jesús G. N.-selling snacks
 Gregoria Salome A. J.- selling snacks
 Evangelista C. C.-fruit seller
 Marena B. A.-selling cosmetics
 Leonarda R. G.-fruit seller 
María C. M.-fruit seller 
María Félix C. R.-fishmonger

loans.use: to buy more beauty products for her business

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 23 years old, married and has two children. In 2005, Abbass opened his own carpentry shop to improve his family's standard of living. He is well known in his area and has an excellent reputation. 

Abbass is requesting a $3000 loan to buy a new Italian machine for his business. He is planning to develop his work and skills so he can expand in the future.

loans.use: Buy a new Italian machine

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.es:
La señora Madeleine es socia del banco comunal La Lupuna, del Distrito de calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo, su esposo es empleado público. Ella es profesora de profesión, pero no lo ejerce porque no hay trabajo.
Lleva trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años y se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza  por catálogo, para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa hasta poder conseguir una plaza en algún colegio.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/.1,300.00 nuevos soles comprará: 4 colonias para hombres, 1 crema de afeitar, 1 bloqueador, 2 lápiz labiales, 1 cuarteto de sombras, 1 champú, 1 tinte para cabello, 1 rimer, 1 lápiz delineador de cejas, 1 talco para cara, 1 colonia para bebe, 1 crema lipo reductora, 1 colonia para mujer, 1 crema para las manos.
Las ganancias no son muchas pero le alcanza para poder pagar su cuenta en el banco comunal. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por la oportunidad.
texts.en:
Madeleine is a member of the La Lupuna community bank of the distrito of Calleria, departament of Ucayali. He is 34 years old, married and has one son. Her husband is a public employee. She is a teacher by profession, but she does not teach because there is no work. 

She has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for 2 years. She sells beauty products via catalogue to help her husband with the household expenses until she can find a position at a high school. 

With the new loan of S/.1,300.00 nuevos soles she will buy: 4 men's colognes, 1 shaving cream, 1 sunblock, 2 lipsticks, 1 eyeshadow quartet, 1 shampoo,  1 hair dye, 1 mascara, 1 eyebrow pencil, 1 face powder, 1 baby cologne, 1 reducing cream, 1 women's cologne, 1 hand cream.   

The earnings are small but enough to be able to pay for her account in the community bank. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the opportunity.

loans.use: She will buy: 4 men's colognes, 1 shaving cream, 1 sunblock, 2 lipsticks, 1 eyeshadow quartet, 1 shampoo, 1 hair dye, 1 mascara,1 eyebrow pencil, 1 facepowder, 1 baby cologne, 1 reducing cream,  1 women's cologne,1 hand cream.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is married with six children aged between twenty-six and eight. She has been in mixed farming for ten years in her hometown of Kitale in Western Kenya, producing maize, beans and milk which she sells locally. She engages the services of one farmhand in her farm. She earns additional income from her clothing retail business.

Everlyne has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She is optimistic she will be able to pay for her children's education from the dairy income as well as improve their overall standard of living.

Everlyne  laments that poor prices caused by unstable markets are a great threat to farming businesses.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kerens Sjl Group

texts.es:
Yolanda Elizabeth es integrante de L. Alcancía Comunal "KERENS SJL", llamada asi porque las socias saben que "KEREN" significa "MUJER GUERRERA", L. alcancía esta formanda por personas que trabajan día a día para llevar el sosten a sus hogares, todos ellos se conocen desde muy pequeños ya que viven en el mismo barrio.
este grupo elL. es muy activa y enérgica, su negocio consiste en L. venta ambulatoria de mochilas, loncheras, ropa, etc, los productos que vende segun sea temporada varian, tambien vende productos cosmeticos, elL. nos comenta que "siempre tiene algo que hacer, no puede estar un momento sentada".
Yolanda Elizabeth tiene 31 años y es madre soltera, vive con su padre y sus hijos, con su esfuerzo ha podido conseguir lo que tiene y darle el tiempo suficiente a sus hijos, llevarlos al colegio, cocinarles, etc, con el prestamo desea adquirir utiles escolares pues su deseo es poner una libreria en su casa, y ver a sus hijos terminando sus carreras, sueño que elL. misma no duda en lograr ya que pone mucho esfuerzo en todo lo que hace
texts.en:
