The Kerens SJL Community Bank got its name because the members know that "Keren" means "fighting woman." The community bank is formed of people who work day by day to support their households. All of them have known each other since they were very small since because they live in the same neighborhood.

Yolanda Elizabeth is part of this group. She is very active and energetic. Her business consists of traveling sales of backpacks, lunch boxes, clothes, etc. The products she sells vary according to the season. She also sells cosmetics. She tells us that she "always has something to do; she can't sit down for one moment."

Yolanda Elizabeth is 31 years old and is a single mother. She lives with her father and her children. Through hard work she has been able to provide what they need and give her children enough time and attention. She takes them to school, cooks for them, etc. With the loan, she would like to purchase school supplies since she wants to have a bookstore in her home and to see her children finish school. This is a dream that she does not doubt she will achieve because she puts so much effort into everything she does.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies

loans.name: Ndeye Bineta

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye Bineta S. est  une femme qui vit dans la localité de Dalifort. Elle pratique l’activité de commerce  plus précisément  la vente de produits cosmétiques. Elle a choisi cette activité pour gagner sa vie. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de produits destinés à renforcer son stock de marchandises. Son objectif est de diversifier ses produits et satisfaire sa clientèle. Le financement lui permettra d’accroitre ses profits, de subvenir à ses propres besoins et aussi de soutenir sa famille.
texts.en: Mrs. Ndeye Bineta S. is a woman who lives in the town of Dalifort. She trades in cosmetics and began this business in order to earn a living. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs in order to buy products and increase her stock. Her objective is to diversify her range of products and satisfy her customers. The loan will allow her to increase her profits, provide for her own needs and support her family.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en: Chanthy B. is single and lives with her widowed mother on an Island on Mekong River 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  She is a weaver. In addition, she also buys additional cotton and finished silk fabrics from other weavers in her village and transports them to sell in other provinces. She is requesting a loan of $1,000, which she will use to purchase more cotton and silk fabrics to sell..

loans.use: To purchase cotton and silk fabrics to sell

loans.name: Fely

texts.en: At the age of 41, Fely is determined to work hard to supplement their daily expenditures. She is married to a farmer and they are blessed with three children. She decided to take a loan from Kiva lenders and ASKI MFI of PHP 25,000 to purchase additional farm inputs. She earned PHP 18,000 at the last cropping and she has owned and managed her farm for almost two years. Her profits will be used for her family's daily needs. She hopes that Kiva and ASKI MFI will continue to give her financial assistance to gain more income.

loans.use: To purchase additional farm inputs

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is 26 years old and is married to Fredrick, who also contributes to the family income.  She has been farming for a period of about six years and earns an income of about KES 20,000 a month.

This is Doreen' first loan from KADET LTD.  She was introduced to KADET by a staff member.  She wants to use this loan to buy fertilizer and pestcides for her farm. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her farm as well as her salon, a secondary business.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “YAHUAR MAQUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 34 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de cabina de internet y de juegos de play station, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 11:00 p.m, ella por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de cabina de internet y de juegos de play station. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar la cabina de internet para hacer arreglar las computadoras y comprar repuestos. 

                                                        
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Yahuar Maqui" community bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.

The member is 34 years old and lives with a partner and has two children. The member alternates her daily activities with an Internet cafe and Playstation games business. She works from 8AM until 11PM. Through this business,  she gets her children ahead. The member wishes to expand and improve the Internet cafe and Playstation game business. The member is requesting the loan so she can fix computers and buy spare parts at the Internet cafe.

The member is happy about the loan and promises to make the payments on time.

loans.use: to start an internet cabin to fix computers and buy spare parts.

loans.name: Santa Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Santa Rosa es casada, tiene 58 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 6 hijos los cuales no estudian, ella se dedica a la elaboración de costeras a diferentes prendas ya que inicio este trabajo desde que era joven, y hasta el momento lleva 25 años de experiencia en este trabajo, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica la tejeduría de telas típicas.

Decide solicitar un préstamo para poder comprar materiales para la elaboración de costuras,  y así poder mejorar sus ingresos. Va a comprar telas,  e hilos de diferentes tipos y colores. Espera seguir manteniendo este trabajo por toda su vida.
texts.en:
Señora Santa Rosa is married and 58 years old.  She had no opportunity to study at school, and she has 6 children who do not go to school.  She works doing embroidery on different garments and has been doing this work since she was young; so far she has 25 years of experience in this work.  She counts on the support of her husband who works weaving traditional fabrics.

She decided to request a loan to be able to buy materials for embroidery, and thus to be able to improve their income.  She is going to buy fabrics and yarns of different types and colors.  She hopes to continue this work for the rest of her life.

loans.use: to buy fabric and yarn.

loans.name: Too

texts.en:
Too is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya, where he has been farming for 10 years now. He sells his milk to a local dairy plant. He earns additional income from his small-scale farming of tea and poultry farming. 

Too has made a loan request for 50,000 Kenyan shillings in order to purchase a dairy cow. The extra proceeds from this loan will enable him to improve his family's livelihood and expand his farming activities. His biggest challenge has been lack of a stable market for milk which makes it hard to budget financially. He plans to construct a dairy unit and acquire at least four dairy cows in the next five years. 

Too is age 29 and married with a one year old child.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ketty

texts.es: Ketty vive en su tierra natal en compañía de su esposo  y sus 2 hijos en su propia casa. Desde que era niña aprendió el valor del trabajo, cuidando animales y siempre ayudando a sus padres en las tareas del campo. Cuando formó su hogar, opto por otro trabajo adicional a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales, pues no le era muy  rentable. Es así que tiene su carpintería, además la experiencia en este rubro que posee su esposo la ayuda mucho para emprender este negocio. Ya tiene 7 años realizando esta actividad, diseñando bellos trabajos en madera como muebles para el hogar. Ahora necesita implementar su taller con más instrumentos para que sus acabados sean de mejor calidad. Son 12 veces en las cuales ha solicitado un crédito con MFP, es testigo de todos los acontecimientos de su grupo solidario y la que siempre esta dispuesta a compartir sus experiencias positivas ante sus demás compañeros. En esta ocasión el dinero que solicita, le servirá para comprarse más madera y aumentar así su producción.
texts.en:
Ketty lives in the place of her birth with her husband and two children in her own house.  Since childhood she learned the value of work caring for animals and always helping her parents with the chores in the fields.   When she formed her own home, she opted for work in addition to agriculture and raising livestock because it wasn’t very profitable.  This is how she ended up with a carpentry shop.  Her husband’s experience in this line of work has been very helpful for her to launch this business.  She’s been in it now for 7 years designing beautiful wood items of home furniture.  She now needs to equip her shop with more tools so that her work will be higher quality.

It’s been 12 times that she’s asked for MFP loans.  She’s been a witness to all her communal group’s accomplishments and she is always willing to share her positive experiences with the other members.  On this occasion, she’ll use the requested money to buy more lumber and increase production.

loans.use: to buy more lumber.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel has been a rice farmer for the past eight years. He is married with four children and learned rice farming from training within his cooperative.

He will use his Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding against birds, and then in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. 

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To cover labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Beti

texts.es:
La Señora Beti está casada, ella se dedica a la compra de materiales reciclables, los cuales los transforma y los vende como productos terminados. A modo de ejemplo de estos productos, son veladores de hierro, adornos de botellas de plástico, bolsos de plásticos, entre otros. Su negocio está ubicado en Ciudad del Este, en un lugar muy estratégico.
Teniendo en cuenta los aspectos en cuanto a mejorar el nivel de vida a través del reciclaje y el adecuado precio de sus productos, tienen un buen ingreso a través de sus ventas. Comenta que está muy orgullosa de lo que hace puesto que es un trabajo digno y honesto. Dice que todo lo que hace es por darle a su familia un mejor estilo de vida y para que ellos no tengan  que atravesar por los mismos inconvenientes que ella. Se define como persona muy responsable con sus compromisos y con ansias de progreso.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra y reventa de artículos reciclables, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le brinda.
texts.en:
Mrs Beti is married. She buys recyclable materials, transforms them, and sells them as finished products. For example, she makes iron tables, decorations from plastic bottles, plastic purses, and other items. Her business is located in Ciudad del Este. 
Taking into account the aspects of increasing living quality through recycling and the good price of her products, she makes a good income from her sales. She tells us that she is very proud of what she does as it is a dignified and honest work. She says that everything she does is to give her family a better lifestyle, and so that they don't have to experience the same problems that she has had. She describes herself as a very responsible person who has obligations and a desire to make progress.
She is requesting this loan for the purchase and re-sale of recyclable items. This will be a great help for her. She thanks the Fundacion for the opportunity with which they are providing her.

loans.use: to purchase and resell recyclable articles

loans.name: Yamileth Del Socorro

texts.es:
Yamileth, originaria de la ciudad de Granada, de 32 años de edad, tiene tres hijos, ella es comerciante  dueña de una pulpería. Inicio su pulpería con las ganancias que obtuvo de su anterior trabajo  cuando tenía 28 años de edad, ya que quería independizarse y no trabajarle a nadie en particular así que tomo la decisión de poner su propio negocio. Anteriormente se dedico a la venta de pescado en le mercado que negocio que todavía tiene y son otros ingresos con los que se ayuda a sostener a sus familia. 
Ella quiere invertir el préstamo para comprar productos, como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, huevo, leche, carnes, productos de limpieza  para surtir su pulpería. Esto le facilitara tener mejor mercadería que ofrecer a sus clientes, podrá mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos. Su metas es salir adelante con su negocio para hacerlo estable y seguro, tener que ofrecerla a sus hijos para darles un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Yamileth is from the city of Granada.  She is 32 years old and has three children.  She owns a grocery store.  Yamileth started her grocery store business with the profits that she made from her previous job.  When she was 28 years old she wanted to start working for herself so that she didn't have to work for somebody else.  She took the decision to set up her own business.  She used to sell fish in the market.  This is a business that she still has and it provides her with additional income which helps her to support her family.

Yamileth would like to invest her loan in buying products such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, eggs, milk, meat and cleaning products with which to stock her grocery store.  This will enable her to have better merchandise to offer her customers and she will be able to improve her sales and income.  Her goals are to get ahead in her business in order to make it stable and secure and to have something to offer her children so that she can provide them with a better future.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, eggs, milk, meat and cleaning products, to stock her grocery store

loans.name: El Ciruelito Group

texts.es:
La señora  Carmela cuenta con 46 años de edad  es casada tiene 6 hijos tres depende de ella, los cuales estudian, rubí estudia la normal, Isabel el bachillerato y el más chico estudia la primaria,  Su esposo se llama Joaquín el cual se dedica al campo.
Ella se dedica al comercio el cual tiene un pequeño negocio de frutas y verduras el cual ha sabido mantener con la ayuda del préstamo ella invirtio su prestamo en la compra de verduras como son: chile, jitomate, cebolla, etc. espera grandes beneficios ya que tiene como meta hacer crecer su negocio.
La señora Carmela pertenece al grupo el ciruelito que está integrado por 10 miembros, se llama el ciruelito por que en la comunidad donde viven hay muchos arbolitos de ciruelas, todos los integrantes tiene diferente actividades. 
La Sra. Mariana se dedica al comercio se dedica en la venta de sobrecamas y sabanas y mandiles, ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de sobrecamas y material para hacer los mandiles.
La Sra. Lina iveth se dedica al comercio ella vende plátanos de diferente tipo como son: macho, dominico, manzano, patriota. Ella invirtió su préstamo en compra su plátano.
La Sra. Isabel se dedica al comercio de perfumes vende perfumes de diferentes marcas, ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de mas perfumes nuevas aromas, cremas, y cosméticos.
La Sra. Evelia se dedica al comercio de verduras ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de verduras como son: jitomate, chile, cebolla, zanahoria, lechuga, etc.
La Sra. Prajedis se dedica al comercio ella vende frijol lo compra y lo revende ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de mas frijol negro y peruano.
La Sra. Elia se dedica al comercio de verduras, ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de mas verduras como son: chile, papa, jitomate, cebolla, lechuga, calabaza, etc.
La Sra. enoemi se dedica al comercio de verduras ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de verduras como son: chile, papa, jitomate, cebolla, lechuga, calabaza, frijol, etc.
La Sra. Joaquina se dedica al comercio productos de abarrotes, ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de los productos como son: aceite, huevo, galleta, sopa, chile, azúcar, etc.
La Sra. Ma. Elvis se dedica al comercio de frutas, ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de frutas como son: manzana, plátano, uva, naranja, peras, etc.
texts.en:
Señora Carmela is 46 years old.  She is married and has six children, three of whom are still financially dependent and in school.  Rubí is studying in regular school, Isabel is studying for her baccalaureate, and the youngest is in primary school.  Her husband's name is Joaquín, and he works in the fields.

Carmela works in retail; she has a small business selling fruits and vegetables, which she has been able to keep going with the help of the loan.  She invested the loan in buying vegetables such as chili peppers, tomatoes, onions, etc.  She hopes for great benefits from this, and has the goal of growing her business.

Señora Carmela belongs to the "El Ciruelito" group, ("The Little Plum Tree"), which is made up of ten members.  They are called "El Ciruelito" because there are many plum trees in the community where they live.  All the members work in different activities.

Señora Mariana works in retail selling bedspreads, sheets, and aprons.  She invested her loan in the purchase of bedspreads and material for making aprons.

Señora Lina Iveth works in retail selling different types of plantains, such as macho, dominico, manzano and patriota varieties.  She invested her loan in the purchase of plantains.

Señora Isabel works retailing perfumes.  She sells different brands of perfumes, and invested her loan in the purchase of of more perfumes with new fragrances, creams, and cosmetics.

Señora Evelia works selling vegetables.  She invested her loan in the purchase of vegetables such as tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, carrots, lettuce, etc.

Señora Prajedis works in retail selling beans, which she buys and resells.  She invested her loan in the purchase of more black beans and peruvian beans.

Señora Elia works selling vegetables, she invested her loan in the purchase of more vegetables, such as chili peppers, potatoes, tomatoes, onions, lettuce, pumpkins, etc.

Señora Enoemi works selling vegetables.  She invested her loan in the purchase of vegetables such as chili peppers, potatoes, tomatoes, onions, lettuce, pumpkins, beans, etc.

Señora Joaquina works selling groceries.  She invested her loan in the purchase of products such as oil, eggs, cookies, soup, chili peppers, sugar, etc.

Señora Ma Elvis works selling fruit.  She invested her loan in the purchase of fruit such as apples, plantains, grapes, oranges, pears, etc.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables such as chili peppers, tomatoes, onions, etc.

loans.name: Gereltuya

texts.en:
Gereltuya is a 40-year-old married mother of a 15-year-old son. She lives in her sister’s house with her son and cousin’s family. She is a pharmacist and loves her profession. Besides running a small pharmacy, she sells eyeglasses. 
Gereltuya is a very responsible person and her dream is to have her own home. Her husband works in Korea and her son attends a high school. During the last few years, the pharmacy business has not been growing much in the Mongolian market. Therefore she is planning to improve her eyeglasses business. The loan Gereltuya is taking will be used to purchase more eyeglasses to increase her stock.

loans.use: To purchase more eyeglasses to increase her stock.

loans.name: Otara

texts.en:
Otara is 39 years of age and married with six children. She owns and operates a business planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Otara has 2 years of experience in this business. She needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated at WST 400 or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Otara joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Otara's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Nyamsuren

texts.en: Nyamsuren is 52 years old and lives with her daughter in a ger (a mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her daughter is a college student. Since 2001, Nyamsuren has had a contract with the public transportation service; she uses her own van. Now that the van is getting old, it needs some serious maintenance. She is a strong and hardworking woman. Nyamsuren says, "Now that my daughter joined a college, I need to work hard in order to support her". She is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to buy spare parts to repair her van.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Gedion

texts.en:
Gedion is a forty-seven-year-old married man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in agro-chemicals for five years. He acquired the initial capital from farming. His hardships are customers not paying on time and unseasonable weather. His personal goal is educating his children and his business goal is expanding his business to new markets.

Gedion needs the loan facility to buy agro-chemicals for sale.

loans.use: to buy agro-chemicals for sale.

loans.name: Cheronoh

texts.en:
Cheronoh, a farmer in Litein South Rift, Kenya is 29 and married with 3 children, with the first born already in school. She has 6 years experience in active farming and currently produces milk and tea which she sell locally. Her family relies on completely on farming for their upkeep.

Cheronoh has made a loan request through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo of 40,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. She says the cow will provide milk for the family and more income for other basic needs. She notes that farmers' access to finances is her major challenge and advocates for loan services to be broadened.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher a 28-year-old man who lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He owns a retail shop in town and sells plastics like cups, plates, and basins among other things. He is faced with challenges such as limited capital for expanding his business, few customers and a persistent increase of prices in the market due to inflation. His goal is for him to have a well-built permanent house and to expand his business into new markets. Christopher wants a loan to buy plastic cups, plates, basins, jericans and jugs for sell.

loans.use: to purchase plastic cups, plates, basins, jericans and jugs for selling.

loans.name: Maximilla

texts.en:
Maximilla is a 47-year-old lady, married to Jeremias, a 61-year-old farmer. Maximilla and Jeremias are blessed with three children: Yedida, 27, Endri, 25, (the two of them are married) and the youngest is Alfredo, 22,  who has graduated from Senior High School. 

Maximilla owns a kiosk business and Meatball Stall – called “Baso”. She initiated these businesses one year ago. Since running these businesses Maximilla can help her husband in covering their family’s living expenses. 

Maximilla and family are living in a rural place, so she was thinking to restock and add some new products as demanded by the customers. Therefore, Maximilla is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 5,000,000 from TLM. She would like to spend the loan on petrol, kerosene, snacks, instant noodles, sugar, coffee, etc. She is hoping that TLM is willing to assist her with the loan.

loans.use: to purchase petrol, kerosene, snacks, instant noodles, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Zinat

texts.ru: Зинат 44 года, вдова, имеет пятерых детей, младшая из которых школьница. В 2003 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Зинат начала свой бизнес в животноводстве со стартовой суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорству и настойчивости, на сегодняшний день,  ее хозяйство насчитывает 4 коровы, 8 овец, 8 коз и  приносит около 7,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. Доходы от такой деятельности позволили Зинат оплатить обучение своих детей и провести небольшой ремонт дома.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зинат обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. В будущем, Зинат хочет увеличить хозяйство и расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en: Zinat is 44 years old, a widow with 5 children, the youngest of which is a schoolgirl. In 2003, while looking for income source for her family, Zinat started her own business in raising livestock with the initial investment of 10,000 KGS. Because of her perseverance and persistence, she currently owns 4 cows, 8 sheep, 8 goats and is earning around 7,000 KGS per month from the sale of dairy and meat products. The income from this business allowed Zinat to pay for her children's education and do small repairs in her house. In order to further develop her business, Zinat came to "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan of 55,000 KGS to purchase sheep.  In the future Zinat wants to increase her property and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 38-years-old and lives in the town of Namutuba in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has 6 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Amina has been working hard to manage her restaurant, where she sells food. 

To help expand her business, Amina has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy food for resale, and will help Amina to generate greater profits and improve her family’s standard of living. Amina hopes that in the future she will be able to complete her house. 

Amina is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Amina who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy food for resale.

loans.name: Soliadrias De Tuyukua Group

texts.es:
20 mujeres de la ciudad de Caacupé se han unido con las ganas de salir adelante y de esa forma poder ayudar a sus familias. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y sacrificadas que ven en el programa de la fundación paraguaya una gran oportunidad que les permitirá salir adelante.
La presidenta, la señora Juana vive con su marido, ella se dedica a la artesania en ñanduti (tejido típico de Paraguay). Elabora Polleras de danza por cantidad y luego las vende. Tambien se dedica al forrado de zandalias con detalles en ñanduti. Ella junto con sus compañeras realizan constantes actividades y de ese modo fomentar la integración entre las compañeras y tratar de adelantar sus cuotas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos, colores, agujas y demás insumos necesarios para tejer ñanduti y de esa forma poder seguir produciendo.
texts.en:
Twenty women from the city of Caacupé have joined together. They have the desire to succeed so that they can help their families. These women are hard workers and self-sacrificing individuals who view this program with Fundación Paraguaya as a great opportunity that will help them press forward.

The president, Sra. Juana, lives with her husband. She is an artisan who works with “ñanduti” (a traditional lace produced in Paraguay). Juana produces dance skirts that are of great quality and then sells them. She also decorates sandals with details made of “ñanduti”. Juana and her fellow group members engage in constant activities in order to strengthen their friendship and accomplish their goals.

Juana is requesting a loan to buy thread, dyes, needles, and other necessary supplies for making “ñanduti”. This will help her continue production.

loans.use: to buy thread, dyes, needles, and other necessary supplies.

loans.name: Ibrahim M.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT to request a loan of 16,600,000 SLL for the entire group to meet their most pressing financial challenges. At the end of each month, they can repay using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Ibrahim is the featured leader of this team. He is a native of Makeni city. Ibrahim is 52 years old. He is married to a trader and the couple has 5 children who are attending primary, secondary, and tertiary institutions. Ibrahim has been a school teacher for 23 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy home building materials like iron, corrugated sheets, sand, nails, cements, etc. for the construction of a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy home building materials like iron, corrugated, sheets, sand, nails, cement, etc. for the construction of a house for his family

loans.name: Rosas De Florida Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE FLORIDA” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Valeria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, reciclaje de plástico, venta de comida, fundido de metales, venta de enaguas, venta de golosinas, servicio de lavandería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Valeria es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de reciclaje de plásticos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años, al observar que este material desechable podría ser vendido.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de botellas de plástico) que adquirirá de las recicladoras por menor que le entregan en su tienda de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en las empresas de reciclaje. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de crédito, salud y capacitación que le ofrece la institución.

En la fotografía no se encuentra una de las socias porque se encontraba en consulta médica.
texts.en:
The "Rosas De Florida" communal bank will start its third cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Adela regional office. It has eight members and is headed by a board of directors, of which Valeria is the president. The members of the organization engage in a variety of businesses, which include a neighborhood store, plastic recycling, selling foods, metal casting, selling skirts, selling sweets, and laundry service.

The loan they will take out will benefit small micro-enterprises, including Valeria. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years, after joining through the invitation of the institution's representative who visited her home. Currently she has a plastic recycling business and reveals that she learned this business several years ago upon discovering that this disposable material could be sold.

The loan they will take out is for increasing capital by purchasing plastic bottles, which she will acquire retail from recyclers that deliver to her store in Ciudad de El Alto and subsequently ....  recycling businesses. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family, as she's married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes what the institution offers in terms of loans, health, and training.

One of the group members is not pictured because she was at a medical appointment.

loans.use: To purchase plastic bottles.

loans.name: Nonvignon Group

texts.fr: NONVIGNON est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Jeannette (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 29 ans. Jeannette est mariée à un cordonnier du nom de Bertin. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Jeannette et son mari. Pour cette raison, Jeannette vend des condiments et du maïs , ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Jeannette s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Jeannette sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe NONVIGNON, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des condiments et du maïs.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en: “When smallholder women farmers are given access to funds they are very hard working on their farms,” says Norah(in a red jumper), a 27-year-old farmer who has two children and lives in the village of Mwimbi in the Nkubu area of Kenya. For the past year, Norah has been actively involved in mixed farming. Nkubu is one of the places with conditions that favor horticulture farming: good climate, soils, transport system, and market. Norah has always wanted to diversify and start horticultural farming, but the biggest challenge she has been facing is lack of funds. She is therefore requesting a loan to buy seeds and start horticultural farming. Through Juhudi Kilimo, a micro-finance organization that supports young and enterprising farmers she has received training on horticulture farming. With your loan Norah intends to buy good quality vegetable seeds, flowers and potatoes. Proximity to an airstrip will allow her to transport the produce faster to an international market, hence enabling her to make more money. This loan will improve Norah’s living conditions and secure the future of her children.

loans.use: To buy seeds and start horticulture farming

loans.name: Ulsina

texts.en:
Ulsina works hard to support her family. Ulsina is married with two children and has a buy and sell jewelries business in the Philippines.

Ulsina requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more jewelries to sell to her customers.

Ulsina has been in this business for 9 years now, and also earns additional income from fishing.

In the future, Ulsina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more jewelries to sell to her customers

loans.name: Sandra Isabel

texts.en:
My name is Sandra M. and I run a billiards room where I also sell food, primarily to my billiards customers. I sell food such as enchiladas, tortillas with quesillo, baleadas(traditional Honduran taco), bread with beans, burritos with meats, sodas, etc. I have had my business for five years and it produces enough income to maintain my family. My goal is to increase sales and with the additional earnings, I will remodel the store (which doubles as my home)and to continue to maintain my family and to give a good education to my children.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Mi nombre es Sandra M. me dedico a administrar mi billar tambien vendo comida en el mismo local para mis clientes del billar como ser enchiladas, tortillas con quesillo, baleadas, pan con frijoles, burritas de carne, refrescos etc. tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el mantenimiento de mi famila y mi meta es incrementar mis ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi necogio (casa de habitacion) mantener a mi familia y darles estudio a mis hijos.

loans.use: To purchase: powders, chalk, plaster, brushes, wood polisher, sodas, chicken, beans, butter, oil, salt, tortillas, cheese, quesillo (traditional South American cheese),vegetables, water, ice.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Maa Comfort sells charcoal. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She needs a loan of $750.00 from Kiva to enable her move on in business. She is hardworking and capable of paying back.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Protected

texts.en:
Mr Nawzad 45 years old with a small shop in the Kirkuk market to sell home supplies. He has five children, all of them in school. He works hard to allow then to continue their studes and a get good diploma. His activity and hard work encouraged him to apply for the loan from AL-Aman. The amount that he wants is $1200 and the purpose is to purchase more goods to sale to his customers.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase more goods

loans.name: Rovshen

texts.en: Rovshem N. is 42-year-old man who lives with his two children in the southern part of Azerbaijan Imshli region. He has been running his business since 2003. He has one cow, which brings him income from milk and yogurt. The milk products are in high demand all across Azerbaijan and Rovshem is planning on expanding his business and purchase two additional cows. The estimated cost for one cow is 700-800 USD. Therefore, he is applying for a loan of 1200 USD and has saved 200 USD from his income to pay for these.

loans.use: To purchase two cows in order to  expand his business

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is quite an amazing woman. She is 46 years old and has five children - with one at the university and two who will also attend shortly.

She earns a living by running a small tailoring business. She has two foot-run machines at her house, and one that she uses on the street where she can be close to the day's traffic. Everyone bids her a 'hello' as they pass her sewing station. She is well-known in the community and makes school uniforms for all the children using colorful scraps of material.

Edith's first loan was in 1997 for $30.00 USD. She plans to use her new loan to buy more material and to pay the school fees for her children. Her dream is to one day have a retail shop and to continue her tailoring. She is a joy.

(If you would like to learn more check out the Kiva Fellows Blog: The women of Rubaga)

loans.use: To buy more material to make school uniforms.

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
Fanta is 43 years old and married with 7 children. Her husband is a driver and earns a meager income. Fanta has to supplement the income, otherwise the family would not be able to cope with expenses. She said most of the income is spent on school fees and supplies.

Fanta is one of the beneficiaries of the skills development programs in Sierra Leone where she learned the trade. She produces dyed material and sells it in Freetown. With her previous loans from SMT, she was able to produce 14 suits a week and 6 bed sheets. She is very much concerned about her children’s education and therefore would like to increase her production. She is requesting a $300 loan for this purpose.

loans.use: Increase her productivity by purchasing needed raw materials.

loans.name: Jolly's Group

texts.en:
Jolly is the chairperson of the Nyakabare B Tutungukte Lending Group in the countryside outside of Ntungamo. The region around Ntungamo is knowns for its stunning beauty. The drive to the lending group is on a rutted road going through dense groves of matooke, coffee and lush green hills. The lending group meets in one of the homes of the owners. From this hilltop you can see neighboring Tanzania. Meeting at night, there is no electricity and the only light is from paraffin lanterns, lighting the homes of villagers across the valley. The sky is ablaze with stars.

Jolly and her husband have six children and own a wholesale business in which they sack beans, peas and millet in 50kg to 100kg sacks. In this area of Uganda, most people are subsistence farmers. Any extra food grown is sacked and sent to markets. In most retail stores you will see 4-6 of these sacks in front of the counter. Jolly and her husband have been in business for 10 years and have been members of their lending group for the past four years. They plan to use her loan to modernize their farm.

loans.use: Jolly plans to use her loan to buy modernize her farm.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 28 years old. He is married and has two children studying in school. After his father died in a terrorist attack, his sister came to live with him in his rented house.

He has a home supplies shop. He applied to borrow $1200 to purchase new home supplies and new goods. He also wants to paint the shop and renovate it. He wants to develop his business and expand his project to increase his income and save for a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new home supplies

loans.name: Plutarco

texts.es:
Mr. Pautarco M., since he was very young, has dedicated himself to the raising of livestock in the municipality of Villanueva in the department of Chinandega, Nicaragua. He is a single father with the necessity of supporting his three children who no longer need his help to complete their studies. His wife helps with the housework and in sending the children to school.

Mr. Plutarco is faced with the need is to purchase calves. In order to then commercialize the derivative products, the raised animals are sold to farmers who resupply the small farmers with calves. To acquire the animals, Mr. Plutarco comes to Ceprodel to obtain the necessary credit to purchase it and in this way continue to maintain his dear home.

Translated from Spanish by Andrew Tsavaris, Princeton University Language Project volunteer.

El señor Pautarco M. desde muy niño se ha dedicado a la crianza de ganado en el municiapio de Villanueva del departamento de Chinandega en Nicaragua. Es padre soltero y con la necesidad de mantener a sus tres hijos que hoy mas que nunca necesitan del apoyo de su padre para realizar sus estudios. Su esposa lo apoya en los quehaceres del hogar y en enviar a los niños al colegio.

La necesidad que atraviesa el señor Plutarco es la compra de terneros para luego comercializar sus productos derivados, estos son vendidos por otros ganaderos que se dedican a suplir estos terneros a pequeños ganaderos. Para adquirir este animal, el señor Plutarco acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con créditos que le permitan obtener el ingreso necesario para la compra y así continuar manteniendo su querido hogar.

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica K. has been a trader in Elmina village for 6 years. She is married to a farmer and has 5 children to support.  She is requesting $525 to buy additional bowls, and pots and pans. She walks through the residential villages and local markets with her materials and sells to a wide variety of people. Veronica is also a member of a lending group called “Nyame Ye Kase Traders”, which consists of 14 borrowers in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy additional bowls and pots and pans.

loans.name: Ivania Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ivania L. is an enterprising young woman, who at 30 years of age is married and has a husband dedicated to litigating in the courts, though they do not have children. Despite the fact that her husband helps her economically, for four years she has had an eatery, a business that she was able to set up thanks to their savings.

She offers breakfast, lunch and dinner. She requests a loan to buy basic grains and meat in the market because her place is full each time with more customers and she wants to prepare to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Una joven emprendedora es la señora Ivania López, quien a sus 30 años es casada y su esposo se dedica a litigar en los juzgados, aun no tienen hijos. A pesar que su esposo le ayuda económicamente ella desde hace 4 años tiene una comidería, negocio que pudo montar gracias a sus ahorros. Ofrece desayunos, almuerzos y cenas. Solicita un crédito para comprar en el mercado granos básicos y carne ya que su puesto de venta ahora se le llena cada vez mas de clientela y quiere prepararse en aumentar sus ventas.

loans.use: Buy basic grains and meat for preparing meals

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi Q., 35 years old, is a fifth-year member of TYM FUND (Kiva Partner in Vietnam). She has a husband and two children who are still going to school. She used her first loan in breeding pigs successfully, and she continues to use her next loans in this project. Besides, she also has a small stall to sell other daily products; it helps with her repayments. Her income is about 150 USD per month. This time she applies for a loan of 450USD to breed pigs and poultry.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Quyên, 35 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 5 của Quỹ Tình thương. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 2 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Sau năm đầu vay vốn chăn nuôi lợn thành công, các vòng vốn sau chị tiếp tục đầu tư vào dự án này. Bên cạnh đó chị Quyên còn buôn bán hàng khô để có tiền trả tuần. Hiện nay thu nhập hàng tháng của chị Quyên khoảng 150USD. Vòng vốn này chị làm đơn xin vay 450USD về chăn nuôi lợn, gà.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Sanovbar

texts.ru:
Sanovbar B. lives in the town of Vahdat with her husband and three children. She has a middle-school, technical training as a nurse, but she does not work. She sells fruits and vegetables at the Vahdat market. She wants to take out a loan to increase the amount of products she sells. This will help her earn more money and improve the living conditions for her children. She will repay the loan in twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva volunteer.

Бурихонова Санобар проживает в городе Вахдат. Живет с мужем и тремя детьми. Имеет средне-специальное образование. По специальности медсестра, Но не работает. Торгует на рынке Вахдата , фруктами и овощами. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Это даст возможность больше заработать и улучшить условия жизни для своих детей. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase amount of products sold.

loans.name: Valle Verde Group

texts.en:
The community of Rocchacc is located in the district of Anco, province of Churcampa, which is in the department of Huancavelica. Rocchacc is approximately 2100 meters (6890 ft) above sea level, a town economically based on agriculture of fruits and vegetables and in some cases the raising of livestock. The population has a medium level of commercial activity because Rocchacc is a passing point between Ayacucho and Huancayo.

The client Josefina M. T. is going to work with a loan of 200 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($70 USD) and according to her testimony she states, "I have a small store where I sell groceries and other small things such as sweets; I do not have animals yet to graze, for now I only have my business and my fruit farm for chirimoya (native fruit) that I sell in the Larcay fair. In a few years I would like to leave Rocchacc and buy a house in Huancayo where business is good. Furthermore, I hope that my children study to become professionals after they are done with high school. In FINCA Perú I am going to save for my children´s future and for their education and also to develop my small store in the short-term. Now that I have joined FINCA Perú I am going to learn how to save, receive training, and the organization's values of working with more courage and responsibility."

The client Carmen T. V. is going to work with a loan of 200 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($70 USD) and says the following: "I have a guinea pig and fruit farm and some cattle to sell when I need to. My dream is that my children study and are able to become professionals in the future. I am going to save for their education. Now that I have rejoined FINCA Perú I am going to save more because I have previously belonged to a village bank and I really like the training that the organization gave me. Furthermore I am going to work with more responsibility and save with more confidence because for the first time I have participated in an institution where they have returned my savings without any problems."

loans.use: Grow fruits and vegetables; raise livestock

loans.name: Aruwa

texts.en:
Aruwa is 32 years old, married, and has 5 children between the ages of 2 and 14. She has been selling clothes since 2005. Every day, she begins work at 9AM and ends at 9PM. She earns a monthly profit of around $40 from her sales.

In the past, Aruwa has successfully completed two loans from BRAC Tanzania, using them to expand her business. She is now requesting a loan in order to further expand her inventory and stock of clothing.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Jeejan

texts.en:
Jeejan baji is the wife of C. D. and lives in Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its sweetmeat and decorative embroidery. She has been living in this city for the last 30 years. She is the mother of six sons. Jeejan baji's husband is a milk seller by profession and has been in the business for the last ten years. He is a good-natured and kind-hearted man. Jeejan baji is a housewife and helps her husband in getting milk from their buffalos.

Jeejan baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a second loan to buy another buffalo to expand their family milk business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo to expand their family milk business.

loans.name: Maria De Los Ángeles

texts.es: Con un pequeño monto que le prestó ADIM esta joven mujer instaló su taller de costura en la casa de sus padres.  Maria aprendió a coser desde niña, por ser de familia humilde y pobre no tenia maquina, logrando comprarla con un crédito que adim le facilitó en grupo solidario y el que pagó con mucha responsabilidad. Maria considera que su mayor logro como mujer fue haber empezado su propio negocio ya que considera  una de las cosas mas importantes que le han pasado, puesto que cuenta con mucha clientela que esta ubicada en el mercado de Masaya, está segura que poco a poco va a poder avanzar con los créditos de adim y con montos mayores. Vive con dos hijas que le ayudan en la elaboración de los trajes, aspira a comprar una maquina industrial para dar mejor acabado a su producto y ampliar su taller es una meta que está segura de alcanzar con trabajo duro, disciplina, voluntad y ahorro.
texts.en:
With a small loan from ADIM this young woman set up a sewing workshop in her parents’ house. Maria learned to sew as a young girl but, because her family was humble and poor, she did not have a sewing machine. Through her solidarity group with ADIM, she was able to get a loan to buy a machine, and she repaid the loan very responsibly. Maria feels her greatest achievement as a woman is having started her own business. She considers it to be one of the most important things that has happened because she has a large clientele for her business which is located in the market of Masaya. She is sure that, little by little, she will be able to advance with loans in larger amounts from ADIM. Maria lives with her two daughters who help her with the production of clothing. She hopes to purchase an industrial machine with which she will be able to give a better finish to her product. Her goal of expanding her workshop is one she is sure to achieve with hard work, discipline, determination, and saving.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the Poder ("Power") Communal Bank. She is married and lives with her husband; the couple has three children. Three times per week, Bertha travels to various regional markets, where she buys a variety of grains which she brings to Ayaucucho to sell in a market of basic goods. On days she doesn't travel to markets, Bertha works taking care of babies. Her husband is a painter and needs to buy the necessary equipment to outfit his workshop. 

Bertha needs a loan of 1600 soles to buy wheat and corn. She dreams of having a different, more stable business, like a restaurant, and of building her own home. 

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Berta es socia del Banco Comunal Poder.
Berta es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, Berta viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región 3 veces a la semana, donde compra cereales variados, productos que transporta a la ciudad de Ayacucho y vende en el mercado de abastos. Además Berta trabaja los días que no viaja a las ferias cuidando bebes. Su esposo es pintor y necesita implementar su taller con maquinarias necesarias.
Berta necesita un préstamo de 1600 dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, maíz.
Berta sueña con tener otro negocio estable como restaurante y construir su casa.

loans.use: Buy wheat and corn

loans.name: Marina Deysi

texts.es:
La señora Marina Deysi tiene 57 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Nueva Esperanza II y vive en la calle San Pablo 535 sector Jerusalén, distrito La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Terminó primaria y ya no continuó estudiando porque no contaba con apoyo económico, pero como es una mujer emprendedora es autodidacta, lee mucho. Al conversar con ella se descubre su formación como mujer y como líder que en algún momento fue en su comunidad. Se unió a su pareja a los 27 años y tienen 5 hijos, uno falleció con neumonía cuando era un bebé. Actualmente depende de la pareja un hijo que aún es estudiante.
Marina se dedica al cultivo y venta de plantas, flores, humus, tierra de jardín, etc. Lo realiza en un puesto del mercado de su sector y en forma ambulante en un triciclo.
Con el primer crédito que fue de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas lo invirtió en la compra de nueva variedad de plantas.
Con este crédito de  S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de humus y variedad de flores.
Marina sueña con ser mayorista en la venta de flores, tener un gran jardín donde pueda cosechar y exportar.
texts.en:
Ms. Marina Deysi is 57 years old and lives on 535 San Pablo Street, Jerusalén sector, district of La Esperanza, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Perú. She is a member of the Nueva Esperanza II (New Hope II) microfinance institute.

She completed elementary school, but was unable to continue with her studies because she did not have financial support. However, because she is an enterprising, self-taught woman, she reads a lot. Upon conversing with her, one can observe her upbringing as a woman and as a community leader, as she once was. She got together with her partner 27 years ago, and they have 5 children, one of whom died of pneumonia during infancy. They currently have one dependent, school age son.

Marina cultivates and sells plants, flowers, compost, potting soil, etc. She sells her products both in a stand at her local market, and as a street vendor on an urban delivery tricycle.

She invested her first 300.00 PEN loan, which was repaid in 4 monthly installments, in purchasing a new variety of plants.

She will invest this 300.00 PEN loan, which will also be repaid in 4 monthly installments, in purchasing compost and a variety of flowers.

Marina dreams of becoming a flower wholesaler and having a large nursery in which she can grow and export plants.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost and flowers

loans.name: Carla Mariela

texts.es:
La Señora Carla Mariela Ríos C. tiene la edad de 31 años, sus estado civil es acompañada, esta Señora tiene 1 niña de la edad de 14 años y cursa recientemente el 3 años de secundaria, su compañero de vida labora como chofer, sus sueños son de establecer un mejor lugar para ofertar sus comidas ya que así obtendría mas afluencia de clientes, sus propósitos son que su negocio se mantenga activo para que este le siga proporcionando ingresos, sus deseos son de sacar adelante a su hija para darle un buen porvenir de estudios a su hija ya que en sus deseos esta que su hija sea una profesional para el día de mañana.


Su actividad económica es la venta de desayunos y almuerzo: huevos enteros, tacos, gallo pinto, bistec, arroz, frijoles y maduro, la ubicación de su negocio es en el mercado Santos Barcenas, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 8 años, su negocio inicio por cuenta propia y decide realizar la venta de comida en el mercado y comienza instalando una vitrina cocinando cosas sencillas como huevo y gallo pinto y al ver que tuvo la repuesta de los clientes decide invertir mas en su negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita invertir en la compra de arroz, gaseosa y carne para ofrecer una variedad de comidas.
texts.en:
Carla Mariela Ríos C. is 31 years old. She has a partner and a 14 years old daughter that is attending her 3 year in secondary school. Her partner works a driver. Her dream is to open a better place to server her food, so she can make a better impression on her customers. She would like to keep her business active so she can continue making a good income. She also wants to provide a good education for her daughter so she can become a professional in the future. She sells breakfast and lunch packs: boiled eggs, tacos, beans and rice, steak, and others. Her business is located at the Santos Barcenas market. She’s owned this business for 8 years. She decided to start this business on her own installing a small counter at the market where she used to cook simple meals such as eggs and beans and rice, but as the business stated to grow she decided to invest more money on it. Financing will be used for work capital as she needs to invest the money to purchase rice, sodas and offer a larger variety of food.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce T. is a 36-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of three kids. Joyce says all her kids are in school. Joyce resides at a complex with her family. Joyce is from the greater Accra of Ghana but she is now in Kumasi because of her husband who works as an army officer in Kumasi. Her husband, she said, is very supportive in taking care of the kids.

Joyce is a food vendor who sells "kenkey" in her neighborhood. "Kenkey" is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy "kenkey" as breakfast, lunch, and supper. In addition, she also sells raw food like plantains and cassava at the army quarters where she lives.

Joyce wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, plantains, cassava, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. She hopes to earn more income to raise her children, especially for paying for their education. Joyce belongs to a village bank called ‘Believers in Christ’. She also hopes to receive GHS 700 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more to help her husband in taking care of the children's educational needs.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane A. O. recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya.

As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will visit members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care. 

Jane is 40 years old, married, and has five children. Four of her children are currently attending school. Her family lives in the Nyalenda district of Kisumu.

In 1990, Jane started a business selling mandazi (similar to doughnuts), chapatti (a soft flat bread), and vegetables. The business is located in Nyalenda. Initially, the business did not require a large amount of capital and the products sold quickly. Jane has applied for a loan of $150 USD in order to buy products to make mandazi and chapatti in bulk.

loans.use: To purchase baking ingredients

loans.name: Mukeshimana

texts.en:
Greetings from Kigali, Rwanda! D. Mukeshimana is seeking her tenth loan from Vision Finance Company, Kiva's partner. For 10 years, D. has been selling different spare parts in the capital city of Kigali. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. and employs two people to help her with her shop.

She is requesting a loan of 500,000 Rwandan Francs to help her buy more stock. With the increased profits that result from her loan, D. hopes to pay school fees for her children and reinvest in her business. She is married, has two children and cares for three orphans. Their ages are 9, 10, 12, 13, and 15.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del comité la contacto fue la Irmina Espínola  quien vive en la zona del Barrio San Miguel D. C.D.E. Ella es amiga D. la señora Zulma V. quien contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en el barrio. 

El comité se denomina “Kuña Guapa”, está constituido  por 17  señoras muy activas y solidarias, todas D. la misma zona.

Ellas tienen actividades diferentes como ser venta D.: ropa, cosméticos, remedio yuyo, bebidas  etc., y otras que emprenderán una nueva labor y cuentan con un  ingreso fijo.

Las señoras retiran un crédito D. Gs 500.000 a Gs 1.000.000 c/u  El crédito destinaran a la compra D. mercaderías para y artículos D. primera necesidad para su posterior venta.

Zulma V. D. Fernandez 	Librería 
Andrea Céspedes 	Venta D. Ropa 
María Dávalos	Venta D. Ropa 
Nélida P. 	Venta D. Comida 
Elodia G. 	Modista 
Mercedes R. 	Modista 
Juana S. 	Venta D. Ropa 
Aeropagita Beltrán 	Venta D. Cosméticos
Lilian M. 	Venta D. Bebidas
María Adriana G.  	Manicurista 
Isabel Beltrán 	Venta D. Ropa 
Dionisia C. 	Venta D. Remedio Yuyo 
Victorina C. 	Venta D. Producto D. Limpieza 
Celidonia E. 	Despensa 
Arcadia D. B. 	Venta D. Bebidas 
Elodia D. A. 	Venta D. Ropas Usada 
Isabel B. 	Venta D. Bebidas
texts.en:
For the formation of the committee, the contact was Irmina Espínola who lives in Barrio San Miguel D. C.D.E. She is friends with Zulma V. who contacted her neighbors and friends to form the neighborhood committee. The committee is called “Kuña Guapa” and is maD. up of 17 active and unified women, all from the same area. They have different jobs such as selling clothing, cosmetics,Yuyo remedies, beverages, etc. and others who will undertake new jobs and count on fixed incomes. The women withdrew a loan of Gs 500.000 to Gs 1,000,000 c/u. The loan is destined for the purchase of merchandise and essential items for resale. Zulma V. D. Fernandez Bookstore Andrea Céspedes Clothing Sales María Dávalos Clothing Sales Nélida P. Food Sales Elodia G. Tailor Mercedes R. Tailor Juana S. Clothing Sales Aeropagita Beltrán Cosmetic Sales Lilian M. Beverage Sales María Adriana G. Manicurist Isabel Beltrán Clothing Sales Dionisia C. Yuyo Remedy Sales Victorina C. Sales of Cleaning Products Celidonia E. General Grocery Sales Arcadia D. B. Beverage Sales Elodia D. A. Used Clothing Sales Isabel B. Beverage Sales

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics, beverages, clothing, groceries, cleaning products, fabric, items for a bookstore, essential items, etc.

loans.name: Serifat

texts.en: Serifat is 56 years old and she is a widow with 3 children. She sells cosmetics to make a living. She is an active LAPO client. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more cosmetics to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Henry

texts.es:
Henry  vive, en el callejón 8,  de la zona Villa Esperanza de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive junto a su esposa en la casa de sus padres,
 
Trabaja juntamente con su esposa  en el comercio minorista, de manera ambulante,  de Discos Compactos. DVD y otros  en las diferentes ferias zonales de la ciudad.
 
 El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de mercadería y así diversificar su oferta. 
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Henry lives on 8th Street in the Villa Esperanza zone in the city of El Alto. He lives with his wife in his parents' house. Both he and his wife hawk CDs, DVDs and other items at farmers' markets around the city. This loan will be used to purchase additional merchandise and diversify their product selection. This is his first loan with Impro. Impro conducted an evaluation of his business and approved his request for credit.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana es socia del Banco Comunal Huascahura.
Maximiliana es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Maximiliana viaja semanalmente a la selva ayacuchana en donde vende cereales en los diferentes pueblos y de la selva compra frutas que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Maximiliana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de haba, maíz, papa.
Los sueños de Maximiliana son salir adelante, tener un mototaxi para alquilar y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is a member of the Huascahura Community Bank. She is 35, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Maximiliana travels weekly to the Ayacuchana jungle to sell grains in the different villages. She buys fruit in the jungle and sells it at the wholesale food market in the city of Ayacucho. Maximiliana needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy beans, corn, and potatoes. Maximiliana’s dreams are to get ahead, have a "mototaxi" (a motorcycle with a covered seated area attached to carry passengers) to rent, and that her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beans, corn, and potatoes

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge Alberto Q. y su esposa han planificado bien su familia en el tiempo que tiene de matrimonio solo tiene una hija. El pensar de Jorge es que quiere dejarles un buen patrimonio para que vivan bien y cómodamente. El ha tenido prestamos de aquí por lo que ha pagado bien y es como ha empezado su proyecto de extender su casa el ahora esta por terminar una recamara la cual es para su única hija.
El señor Q. ya tiene 5 años de repartidor de refresco en un compañía muy conocida y su esposa trabaja de obrera en una maquiladora y todo este esfuerzo es para darle un mejor calida de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge Alberto Q. and his wife have planned their family well. They have had only one child. Jorge’s hope is to leave a good heritage to his family, so they will live well and comfortably. He has had loans that been repaid and this is how he started his home remodel project. He is about to finish a bedroom for his only daughter. Mr. Q. has worked for the last 5 years as a delivery truck driver for a very well known soda company. His wife works in a “maquiladora” assembly plant. All their efforts are to get a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction material

loans.name: Rc Primary School, Binkolo Group

texts.en:
These are staff members of the RC Primary School, Binkolo. RC Primary School is located in Binkolo village about six miles from Makeni City. The school was built by Plan International, a non-governmental organization in 1980 but now run by the Catholic Mission in Binkolo village. The school has a total of fourteen dedicated staff on their payroll and 514 pupils. Others from neighboring schools or feeder schools near Binkolo village have joined RC Primary School Binkolo to apply for this loan making the total number of applicants seventeen.

SMT/Kiva gives loans to teachers and other professional workers in Sierra Leone in order to invest in something meaningful. Salaries are usually too small for these people, making it very difficult to do anything big with it. But with a loan, they will be able to buy a piece of land or house-building materials. Some will pay school fees either for themselves to pursue further studies or for their children. Some will use the loan to buy pieces of furniture like a bed or chairs. And others will invest in a business or add to their wives’ businesses. Each month, their school’s bursar will deduct their repayment out of their monthly salaries and repay SMT/Kiva.

David L. K. (second row right) is the headmaster at the school. David L. K. was born in Mankoreh village about nine miles from Makeni City. He is age 62 and married with 12 children. One of his children is in university, five in senior secondary schools, four in junior secondary school and two in primary schools. David has been a headmaster of this school since 1984.  David will use his loan to complete the house he is currently building. He will buy bags of cement, sand, gallons of paints, and hard boards. Asked what impact this loan will create in his life, Mr. K. told me that he felt somehow alleviated, and economically uplifted. “At least”, he continued, “I will be able to leave a legacy for my family by building them a house”.

loans.use: Buy construction materials to complete house

loans.name: Faithful Group

texts.en:
These are Zainab J., Hawa S., Adama J., and Mohamed S.. They call their group 'Faithful'. They are entrepreneurs based in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. This will be the first loan these people are accessing from SMT/Kiva. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 for each to help them develop their business.

Zainab J. (right) is the leader of this group. Zainab was born in Makeni; she is twenty years of age. She is married to a driver and they have two children. One is in class two and the other is still suckling. Zainab sells palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) and has been in the business for over five years now. With this loan, she will be able at last to get forty gallons of palm oil from a Luma village called Foredugu.

loans.use: Invest In her business

loans.name: Marry

texts.en:
Marry started her own cafe business selling food three years ago. She is a 37-year-old woman, married and the mother of three children. Her children are 9, 7 and 1 years old. She works four hours a day and earns a monthly profit of 30,000 Tanzanian shillings. Marry is a member of the Zingatia borrower group. 

This is Marry's second loan from BRAC Tanzania. She requested 350,000 in order to buy more commodities like rice and sugar for her business. With the profit she gains from the use of this loan, Marry hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and wheat

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en: Najwa is a 33-year-old married woman and mother of two young children. She has been working as a home-based tailor since 2002 in collaboration with her husband to provide better life conditions for the family. Today, Najwa is requesting to borrow $800 to buy a new sewing machine to be able to satisfy the needs of her clientele.

loans.use: Buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more goods

loans.name: Gladys De Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora Gladys B. Macías es una de las socias del Banco Comunal 3 de Mayo, se reúnen cada quince días en la localidad de Picoaza una parroquia perteneciente a la ciudad de Portoviejo en la Provincia de Manabí.

Gladys es casada desde hace 22 años tiene 2 niñas, ella se dedica a la venta de comida rápida  como  hamburguesa, hot dog, chuzos, papas, colas, y aguas, junto a su esposo  atienden el local  desde las 7pm hasta las 2am de lunes a domingo.  EL local es alquilado por el momento.

Con el préstamo que está solicitando a la fundación lo  invertirá en una refrigeradora para dar mejor atención  a sus clientes que sobrepasan  los cuarenta, se encuentra feliz por la demanda en sus ventas y  le hace seguir creciendo y mejorando cada día mas

Su sueño es poder tener su propio local y seguir incrementando su negocio.
texts.en:
Gladys B. Macías is a member of the 3 de Mayo Communal Bank. They meet every 15 days in Picoaza, a parish belonging to the city of Portoviejo in the Manabí province. Gladys has been married for 22 years, and she has two daughters. She sells fast food like hamburgers, hot dogs, “chuzos” (chicken skewers), potatoes, colas, and water. She and her husband tend the business from 7 p.m. until 2 a.m. from Monday to Sunday. At the moment, they rent their location. She will use the loan she is asking for to buy a refrigerator in order to give her customers better service. She has over forty customers. She is happy about the demand for her food. It makes her continue to grow and improve more every day.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a refrigerator for her fast food business

loans.name: Amalia Yaneth

texts.es: Amalia es soltera, no tiene hijos, tiene 32 años y vive en la casa de su hermana, quien es su garante. Ella es docente en un instituto y universidad privada además de contar con un automóvil que se dedica al transporte de pasajeros y que le genera renta diaria. Tiene 4 años de experiencia en la docencia. La competencia es regular ya que es requerida por los servicios que presta en el medio. El crédito lo invirtió para la compra de electrodomésticos (televisor y microondas). Cuenta con 4 créditos en la institución con buen comportamiento de pagos y no tiene deudas en otras instituciones.

loans.use: COMPRA DE ELECTRODOMESTICOS

loans.name: God Gives Group

texts.en:
Eyea F. is the leader of the five member group God Gives.  She is 29 years old and a single mother of two children ages two and 10.  The oldest is in third grade.  She is illiterate due to poverty.  Eyea and her children live in Ziggida Town in Lofa county, northern Liberia.

Eyea buys dry fish wholesale and sells retail on a table to residents.  She has been in business for two year and hopes to move to a bigger table.  Eyea serves her customers with respect so they continue buying from her.

Eyea takes her business very seriously because it is her only means of income for her and her kids.  She is facing financial difficulties because her business is small.  When she uses funds to pay for school fees it bring her sales down.  But with hard work she is maintaining her business.

She needs this loan to purchase more dry fish to sell.  Eyae dreams of giving her children a better education and moving to the capital city, Monrovia.

loans.use: Purchase more dryfish wholesale to sell.

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: Fati is a 37 year-old married mother of six children who are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Kade is a commercial town. However, the majority of the inhabitants farm as a hobby or as a major occupation alongside other trading activities. Fati is a food vendor. She prepares and sells a local dish called tuo – zaafi, TZ for short. It is served hot with soup. She sells in the morning in her community. Fati buys the goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for eleven years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize.

loans.name: Olga Maritsa

texts.es:
Olga tiene 49 años de edad, es casada y madre de cinco hijos. Vive junto a su esposo y dos de sus nietos en el sector Real Saucipe, ubicado en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace un año empezó a trabajar junto a una hermana en un pequeño negocio de venta de comida y bebida. Ella es la resposable de la venta de bebidas mientras que su hermana se encarga de la preparación de los platos que ofrecen a sus clientes. Ellas atienden todos los dias y este negocio la ayuda a mantenerse activa y a apoyar en el mantenimiento de su familia.

Su esposo trabaja actualmente como guardián en una empresa de la zona y los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para seguir manteniendo la familia por lo que Olga desea seguir adelante con su negocio de bebidas. Ella se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un préstao de 800 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más bebidas para ampliar sus ventas.

Olga sueña con poner una tiendita en su casa con la cual seguir trabajando y manteniendo a los suyos. Ella es una mujer activa, responsable y muy trabajadora. En la fotografía aparece ayudando a su hermana en la preparación de la comida que posteriormente ofrecerán en venta.
texts.en:
Olga is 49 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She lives with her husband and two of their grandchildren in the Real Saucipe sector, located in the Paiján district, Ascope province, in the La Libertad region, located three hours away from Chiclayo City. A year ago, she and her sister started to work on a small business selling food and drink. She is responsbile for the drink sales while her sister prepares the food that they offer their clients. They work every day and this business helps keep her active and helps her help with her family's maintenance. Right now, her husband works as a security guard and a business in the same zone, but his income is not sufficient to cover all the family's expenses, which is why Olga wants to develop her drinks business. She is soliciting her first Edpyme Alternativa loan of 800 soles, which she plans to use to purchase additional drinks to improve her sales.
