Olga dreams of establishing a small store out of her house, so she can continue working and supporting her loved ones. She is an active, responsible, and hard-working woman. In the picture above, she is helping her sister cook the food that they will later offer for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of drinks to grow her business.

loans.name: Maria Neidi

texts.es:
La señora MARIA NEIDI A. M. tiene 42 años, es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 1 depende de ella, vive en el distrito de EL PORVENIR, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad – Perú y cuenta con estudios hasta 5to. de primaria.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal LIDERESAS EN ACCION y se dedica a  la venta de cerveza en su domicilio. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró cajas de cervezas al por mayor.
Con su próximo crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles comprarà cajas de cerveza y gaseosas al por mayor para el abastecimiento de su negocio por fiestas de fin de año. 
Ella sueña con tener una tienda de comestibles en su domicilio y asì generar mayores ingresos en su familia.
texts.en:
MARIA NEIDI A. M., 42, lives with her life partner in the EL PORVENIR district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She finished 5th grade and has 3 children, one of whom is still dependent on her. She is a member of the LIDERESAS EN ACCION communal bank and she sells beer and soft-drinks from her house. Her first, 300 new sol, loan was used to buy cases of beer at wholesale. With her next, 800 new sol, loan she will buy cases of beer and soft-drinks at wholesale to stock her shop for the end-of-year festivities. She hopes to have a grocery store in her home so that she can produce better income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer and soft-drinks at wholesale.

loans.name: Mrs. Chann Sina Ung Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The picture includes the twelve people who make up this village bank loan. They all live in Pou village in Takeo province. Mrs. Chann Sina U. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is 43 years old and the mother of five children who attend the local school.

She is a seller. She is requesting a loan to help establish a small restaurant, and she would use the loan to buy tables, chairs, iron pots, plates, spoons, meats, vegetables, soft drinks, coffee, and other food items. Her husband, Mr. Pheak Sophorn, is a policeman.

loans.use: to establish a small restaurant.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 40 years old and is married with four children. She is an Igbo by tribe but she lives and works in Benin City with her family.

Sandra sells drinks at wholesale and retail prices and hopes to save enough money to expand her business in the future. She needs a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Sandra is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is 55 years of age and widowed with six children between the ages of 14 and 28. Three of her children go to school. She lives in a rented two-roomed house, where she stays.with four people. She has three meals a day. She takes care of additional family members. Her three greatest expenses in a month are paying utility bills, school fees for her children and rent for her residence and business premises. 

Winnie has  a retail shop in Mulago near Mulago hospital and sells all categories of merchandise, ranging from children’s clothing to sugar, soap, salt and roasted maize. Besides this retail business, she is also nurse in the Mulago hospital. She mainly sells on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She serves about 30 customers a day. She has done this business for six years now. Her main challenges are that there are many retail shops selling the same merchandise and seasonality. She has been with MCDT for 13 years, servicing her 24th loan and working with the same group mates for four years. 

She wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise, like bags of sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap. She is aspiring to see her business grow bigger and to start selling on a wholesale basis only.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise like soap, salt and bags of sugar

loans.name: Mariel

texts.en:
To get married to the father of her two children (four and three years old) and her partner, Roel, is the wish of 22-year-old Mariel C.. Just like other women, she dreams of wearing a gown and marching down the aisle of the church with their two children walking ahead of them, bearing their wedding ring and veil. However, because of the small and sporadic income generated by her husband, who is a laborer, it will take time for Mariel’s dream wedding to happen. Thinking about it always in addition to her dream of sending her children to school and supporting them until they graduate from college pushes Mariel to come up with other options for earning money in her own way. Therefore, she thought of selling food in a bus terminal, since people traveling and passing through their town wait long hours before taking off in the vehicle. Most often, they are very hungry for meals upon being dropped off at the station. With that, she is requesting a loan which she will use to purchase ingredients, utensils, and the rented space she will occupy.

With Mariel’s planned business, she hopes to sustain it until it grows big. Its proceeds would bring her to her dreams for herself and her family.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients, utensils, and the rental space to start her food selling business

loans.name: Mae Grace

texts.en:
Mae Grace S., 24 years old, is a goat herder. She also owns a 1½- hectare rice field. She has hired someone to prepare the soil for her and she closely monitors the growth of her rice plants.  The income really help helps her buy the basic needs for their home.

She would like to apply for a loan of PHP 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to grow her harvest and to construct a barn as well.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and construct a goat barn

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es una madre de familia de 30 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos en el sector la Hollería, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad de agenciarse de un ingreso adicional con el cual ayudar a sostener los ingresos familiares hizo que empezara a dedicarse a la crianza y venta de animales menores y a la venta de chicha de jora (bebida típica de la región). Estas actividades son de mucha ayuda a la economía de su familia ya que su esposo trabaja como obrero agrícola y los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para sostener la economía del hogar.

Nancy cría aves de corral y cerdos para luego comercializarlos con los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Eventualmente también vende los animales a sus vecinos. Por otro lado también prepara chicha de jora y la vende a sus vecinos, especialmente en festividades y compromisos.

Ella desea mejorar la calidad de los animales que está criando para que estos tengan mejor calidad y que sean adquiridos a buen precio. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado para lograr su objetivo.

Nancy es una mujer responsable y emprendedora, su mayor anhelo es ofrecerle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y una educación que les asegure un porvenir exitoso.
texts.en:
Nancy is a 30 year-old mother who lives with her husband and three children in the Hollería area, a rural neighborhood in the Mórrope district of the Lambayeque province, located 45 minutes from Chiclayo. The need to help support her family led her to start raising and selling small farm animals, and selling chicha de jora (a typical Peruvian beverage.) These activities contribute to the economic resources of her family, since her husband works as a farmhand and the income he earns is not sufficient to cover all of the household expenses. Nancy raises barnyard fowl and pigs and later sells them to the traders who always visit the area where she lives. Occasionally she also sells the animals to her neighbors. She also prepares the chicha de jora and sells it to her neighbors, especially during festivals and other occasions. She wants to improve the quality of the animals that she is raising so that they will become more valuable in the market. To do this she has seen the necessity of requesting a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa for 600 Peruvian soles that she will use to buy nutritious animal feed to achieve her objective. Nancy is a very hardworking and responsible woman. Her main desire is to offer her children a better quality of life and an education that will assure them a successful future.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy nutritious feed to improve her business of raising and selling animals

location.town: Caserío La Holleria - C. P. M. El Romero - Morrope

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence A. O. is a forty-eight-year-old woman married to Mr. Samuel Jowi, who has a motorcycle transport business. They have four children aged between 18 and 10. They live in Katito, an upcoming town in Western Kenya. To make a living, Florence makes and sells doughnuts (locally known as mandazi) at Katito shopping center. The doughnut is a popular breakfast snack taken with tea. Her day starts early due to the high demand for the snack in the morning. Her target market includes people going to work and school-going children who are early risers. 

Florence is taking out a third loan from KADET Ltd having fully serviced a previous loan without difficulties. She intends to buy baking flour and cooking oil. Her business is growing because the mandazi are preferred over bread. This is confirmed by the great number of customers, mostly women, flocking to her stall to buy hot snacks for breakfast. The preparation of the doughnuts has become Florence's largest source of income and she hopes to use her profits to pay her children's school fees. She feels that this is the best thing she can offer them as a parent.

loans.use: To buy baking flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Cañaberal Group

texts.es:
El comité Cañaveral nace hace cerca de 6 meses, mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encuentra trabajando también en la zona. 
Varias señoras se unieron y decidieron formar un nuevo comité en el barrio están de manera exitosa hasta el momento.
Ellas  además de trabajar de forma independiente, tienen un fondo común que lograron mediante el trabajo conjunto entre las integrantes.
Una de ellas es la señora María quien se dedica a la venta de accesorios fabricados con hilos de crochet; como sobrecamas y manteles para mesas, todos fabricados por ella.
Solicita el préstamos para algunos gastos familiares y para la compra de materiales de trabajo como hilos de varios tipos.
texts.en:
The Cañaveral committee was created about six months ago due to the efforts of another committee that works in the area. Several women met and decided to form a new committee in their neighborhood and are have had success since starting. As well as working independently, they have a common fund which they have funded through working together. One of them is Maria who works selling crochet products like bedspreads and tablecloths which she hand stitches. They are applying for the loan to cover family expenses and the purchase of work materials, namely various kinds of thread.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool thread, other threads, and family expenses

loans.name: Run

texts.en: Mrs. Run T., 31, lives in the rural area of Battambang Province. She earns a living as a farmer by planting rice and vegetable crops. Her husband helps to alleviate her hard labor in her business. The couple has been married for many years but they don’t have any children yet. Recently, Run T. has been lacking some farm supplies for her business. Therefore, she is applying for a loan of $300 USD to purchase crop seeds and lots of sacks of fertilizer for her field.

loans.use: To purchase crop seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Farhad Group

texts.en: Waisuldin is the leader of Farhad group. He lives in district three of Jalalabad city. He is 18 years-old and unmarried. He is a hard working man and after graduating from high school he became responsible for his family. He has a carpentry shop. Waisuldin wants a loan to buy wood and other essential equipment for his shop in order to enlarge his business capacity. He hopes that if his business increases that he will be able to continue his higher education at one of the private universities in Jalalabad city. He is grateful for AFS and Kiva Lender’s for their positive process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy wood and equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 21-year old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and younger sibling, who still attends school. When he was still in school he started working as a tutor for pocket money; after he graduated he took it more seriously and he currently gives private lessons from his parents' house.  He is requesting a loan of  $800 to purchase a new computer in order to become more efficient.

loans.use: to purchase a new computer

loans.name: Kayi

texts.en: Mrs. Kayi E. works in her home town of Lomé. She sells cloth and fabrics. She is 44 years old and widowed with three children, thus it is necessary that she continue this work and grow her profits in order to provide for her family. She’s been selling fabrics for 20 years, yet this is her first loan from WAGES. She has requested 400,000 CFA in order to purchase more fabric to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more fabric to sell

loans.name: Ipiniu

texts.en:
Ipiniu L. is 3 and married with three children aged from 4 to 13. She owns a business venture providing general clothing services to local community members. She has many years of experience in this business.
Ipiniu needs a loan of WST1500 to purchase additional fabrics and materials. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or approximately USD 233 per week) to improve and expand her business.

In 2009, Ipiniu joined SPBD and this is her 2nd loan. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.


About SPBD:
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join  SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates about SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is married to a businessman with whom she has  two children; both of them are at school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members.  She owns a stall in Nalukolongo market selling second-hand clothes and buys bales of clothes from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for many years.  

Florence  sells to all categories of people both retail and wholesale.   Florence  is aspiring of seeing her business grow big and educating her children up to university level. Her business challenges  include thieves and transportation costs. She works six days a week and depends on this job for her living. 

Florence joined MCDT because she wanted to boost her business by getting additional capital.  She resides in and owns a two-roomed house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees, food, and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 22-year-old single man from Tripoli, Lebanon. He has owned a barber shop since 2006 and has eight years of experience.

This is Mohamad’s first time requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to do some useful decorations to his shop. In addition, he will change all the shop’s furniture to attract new clients and retain old clients’ attention. He plans to buy a new couch, tables, hairdryers, a haircutting machine, a wax machine, catalogues and paint the walls.

Mohamad likes his work a lot. He believes that a person must work hard on improving his workspace in order to succeed and insure business continuity.

loans.use: To make some useful decorations to his shop in addition to replacing all the shop’s furniture

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 26 years old and he is still single.  Vincent is commonly known for selling a variety of goods in his shop and this is his fifth successful year in his business.  The business hours are from 6 am to 8 pm every day.

Vincent, after realizing how much foodstuffs are being purchased, he decided he would like to start selling them.  To this end, he needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, he will hopefully increase his profits, which in turn will allow him to keep expanding his business for better financial stability.  In addition to that, he will start saving for his future.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of foodstuffs

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “José Carlos Mariátegui”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Eloy; el tiene 28 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 1 hijo, el socio trabaja como mototaxista (hace servicio de taxi pero en moto),el socio trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m el quiere sacar adelante a su hijos por medio de este empleo, el socio quiere comprar un carro. El socio solicita el préstamo para  arreglar la moto y comprar repuestos. 

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido
texts.en:
Eloy 28, is single and has son. He works as a mototaxi (three-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo) driver from 5am until 8pm. He wants to be able to support his children through this work. He wants to buy a car. He is asking for funds to repair the motorcycle and buy replacement parts. He is a member of the “José Carlos Mariátegui” communal bank located in Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. He avails himself of this platform to express his gratitude to all those who share his dream and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: Ramon Alcides

texts.es:
Ramón de 26 años de edad, es empleado y reside en San Rafael Oriente del departamento de San Miguel donde vive con sus padres y hermanos, él es soltero y no tiene hijos, su trabajo es en una institución crediticia y él se encarga de realizar cobros a los clientes, Ramón desea mejorar su vivienda ya que le faltan algunas cosas para estar completa y así que su familia cuente con una mejor casa más segura.
Él Solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción como arena, cemento y pagar albañil, este préstamo ayudara a realizar la mejora en la vivienda y que en temporada de invierno no les afecte a sus familiares.
Su proyección es mejorar su casa, tenerla en buenas condiciones para que su familia este protegida y segura.
texts.en:
Ramón is 26 years old, employed, and resides in San Rafael Oriente in the Department of San Miguel with his parents and siblings. He is single and does not have children. He works at a credit institution where he is in charge of collecting payments from the customers.

Ramón wants to improve his home, but he lacks a few things needed to complete the job so that his family can have a house that is more secure. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy construction materials, such as sand and cement, and to pay for a mason. This loan will help improve his home in time for the winter season so that the rest of his family will be protected. His plan is to improve his house until his family has good conditions that will keep them safe and secure.

loans.use: Pay for materials & labor necessary for home improvements

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Ekua Nana

texts.en: Ekua Nana E. is married and has five dependents. She has been through junior high school. Ekua Nana sells maize at Abura. Her husband is a mason. Eku uses her income to pay tuition fees as a way of helping her husband. Ekua will use the loan to purchase more maize to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua Nana plans to save to provide a meaningful education to her children.

loans.use: purchase more maize to sell

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long Y., 54, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Y. sells food, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is an officer for the commune hall, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Y. has to spend USD 100 on food and USD 25 on other necessary expenses every month.  Y. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to finish repairing her house. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. Y.'s husband appears in the photograph at CREDIT's office because Y. is not available.

loans.use: To finish repairing the house

loans.name: Poch

texts.en:
The woman shown in the picture is Poch S., 51, a fisherwoman. She and her husband need to spend eight hours a day to fish, in and around the Tunle Sap River. 

The couple is blessed with nine children: six are single and the three are married and live in their own house. This couple catches around 10 kilos of fish per day and sells them in bulk to their customers who are retail sellers in the market.  

In addition to fishing, Poch S.’s husband also uses his boat to ferry people across the river for an additional fee to support his family. 

Currently, his boat is broken down from usage.  Poch S. will use her loan for her husband to mend the broken boat.

loans.use: To repair broken fishing boat

loans.name: Jose Benito

texts.es: José Benito tiene 42 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de ganado. Hace más de 12 años que tiene este negocio. La apertura de su actividad fue por compro dos terneros, ya que lograron observar que es una negocio muy rentable es un hombre muy trabajador y ha demostrado a su esposa y dos hijos que siempre está buscando la forma de sacarlos adelante. el motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como baca, terneros entre otros y de esta forma mejorar el inventario y las ganancias.
texts.en: José Benito is 42 years old. His business activity consists of purchasing and selling livestock, which he has done for more than 12 years. The opening of his business started because he bought 2 calves, and realised that this was a very profitable business. José is a very hard-working man and has demonstrated to his wife and 2 children that he is always looking for a way to improve their circumstances. The motive for this loan is to purchase primary materials such as cows and calves, among others, and in this way improve his inventory and earnings.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
Don José Carlos, tiene 51 años de edad, reside en Jocoaitique departamento de Morazán, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 17 y 20 años de edad, se dedica a la talabartería, este negocio trata de la elaboración de productos de cuero en este caso el elabora vainas para machetes ya que estos machetes son muy utilizados en la gente del campo; él aprendió desde pequeño porque su padre se dedicaba a este negocio, lo cual lo aprendió muy bien y hoy representa su fuente de ingreso para el sostenimiento del hogar.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de Cuero ya que este se le disminuye rápidamente  por lo que su intención es fortalecer el inventario y elaborar las vainas para comercializarlas.
Con esta ayuda espera incrementar su producción, que sus ventas aumenten y seguir creciendo con el negocio para contar con ingresos que solventen las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
Mr. José Carlos is 51 years old, lives in Jocoaitique in the department of Morazan with his wife and two children of 17 and 20 years old. He has a leather working business which is dedicated to the production of leather goods, in this case he makes sheaths for machetes as machetes are used a lot by the people from the countryside. He learned very young because his father worked in this business, and he learned it very well. Today it represents his source of income for the support of the household.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of leather as it diminishes rapidly, and for which his intention is to reinforce his inventory and make sheaths and market them. With this help he hopes to increase his production and his sales, and to continue expanding the business to be able to count on the income to provide for the household necessities.

loans.use: Purchase of leather

loans.name: Rahat Satybaldieva's Group

texts.en:
Rahat S. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Kerben, a small town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Rahat is 27 and married to a builder. She has a daughter and a son, both of preschool age (under 7).
Rahat is engaged in cattle breeding. She resells cattle after fattening and has been in this business for four years. With this loan, Rahat wants to purchase cattle for breeding.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Carlos Nahun

texts.es: Carlos Nahun S. tiene 22 años de edad, es casado, tiene un pequeño hijo de dos años de edad, y reside en la comunidad de Buena Vista en el municipio de Patuca, Olancho. Carlos se dedica a cultivar cafe. Iniciò con capital propio ya que tenìa una mula y la vendiò para comprar las semillas de cafe.
texts.en: Carlos Nahun S. is 22 years old.  He is married and has a 2 year-old son.  He lives in the community of Buena Vista, in the town of Patuca, Olancho.  Carlos grows coffee.  He started his business with his own capital since he had a mule which he sold to buy coffee seeds.

loans.use: To buy manure and pay laborers

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Pictured here is Marie K., a small-scale businesswoman in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. Born in Makeni city about 56 years ago, Marie is married to a trader and the couple has one child. 
 
Marie sells drinks and DVD players. She has been a businesswoman for seven years now. With a loan of 5,000,000 Sierra Leone leones, she will expand her business by buying more drinks and DVD players to add to her current ones.

loans.use: Buy more drinks and DVD players to add to her current ones

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth M. is from the village of Lagonglong, Misamis Oriental. She is 51 years old. Elizabeth is separated from her spouse and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns & operates a business buying and selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell, like milkfish and sardines. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Elizabeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Safar

texts.en:
Safar is a farmer. He lives with his family, including his wife and two little kids. His wife helps him care for their land. In the past, they have had problems in harvesting. They had to sell their crop in advance and see reduced earnings. By this time, Safar has gained a lot of experience in his business and now his crop is one of the most in-demand at the market. Safar now faces a small problem because his field is infertile, which makes it difficult to grow his crop. To solve this problem, he has decided to request a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers to support the field and make his crop more productive.   
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene, tiene 34 años de edad, tiene un hijo, ella nació en la ciudad de Urubamba y vive en la ciudad de Urubamba. 

Irene se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía. Ya son 20 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  Irene en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para materiales como por ejemplo lana.  

Irene pertenece al banco comunal “Mainique” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Irene, age 34, has one child.  She was born in the city of Urubamba and lives in the city of Urubamba. 

Irene is dedicated to making crafts. She has been dedicated to this business for 20 years and it goes very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.  Irene, in this instance, requires the loan for materials such as wool.  

Irene belongs the the “Mainique” communal bank of the Arariwa Association and she is thankful for the opportunity offered to her thru this medium and she also promises to comply with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy materials as for example wool.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Ruth Aracely

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua. la  señora Ruth L. se dedica  arduamente a laborar en su profesión de inginiera civil dedicándose a esta labor desde hace cinco años, es casada y con un hijo al que tiene que suplirle sus necesidades.

Una de las necesidades que Aracely atraviesa hoy en día es que debe mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda debido a que ha estado en malas condiciones. Por este motivo ha tomado la sabia decisión de iniciar la obra de mejora. Está solicitando un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como: piedra, cemento, hierro y arena, Para realizar la mejora de  la vivienda realizando  el cambio de una pared de su casa de habitación la cual se encuentra en mal estado. Por medio de esta obra brindará mejores condiciones de vida a su hijo que tanto lo requiere.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Mrs. Ruth Aracely Lopez R. works hard as a civil engineer. She has been doing this for 5 years. She is married with one son for whom she has to provide good conditions and necessities.  

Mrs. Aracely finds herself needing to improve the condition of her home, since it is in disrepair.  For this reason she has decided to begin making the improvements. She is asking for a loan to buy construction materials like stone, cement, iron and sand.  The improvements will include changing a wall in the home which is in bad shape.

By doing this work she will improve living conditions for her son.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her home.

loans.name: Mileydi Nohemy

texts.es:
Mileydi, reside en Delicias de Concepción departamento de Morazán, tiene 19 años de edad, vive con su esposo y un hijo de cinco meses de edad, ella se dedica a la Jarcia, que es la elaboración de hamacas, este negocio tiene un año de existir y lo aprendió de su suegra.
Ella necesita comprar materiales para la confección de las hamacas, por lo que solicita un préstamo para la compra de Hilo de seda de diferentes colores, este es el material principal y único más necesario para la elaboración.
Tiene como sueño, alcanzar a compra una casa donde pueda vivir con su esposo y su hijo, también sostener el negocio y velar por el futuro de su familia.
texts.en: Mileydi lives in Delicias de Concepción, a region of Morazán.  She is 19 years old and lives with her husband and their 5 month old son.  She works making hammocks.  She has had this business for one year and she learned it from her mother-in-law.  She needs to buy materials to make hammocks, and is asking for a loan to buy silk thread in different colors.  This is the main supply she needs and it is necessary for making hammocks.  Her dream is to be able to buy a house where she can live with her husband and their son, also to sustain her businesss and prepare for her family's future.

loans.use: buy silk thread in different colors

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en: Married and a mother of four children, Diosdada strives to provide a living for her family primarily through her small "cantina" and the vending of dried local fish in a small town in the Philippines.  She has successfully borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF in the past and is looking to assume a new loan of PHP11,000 for the purchase of ingredients and supplies for her cantina.  Diosdada aims to grow her business for the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en: Abraham is 55 years old and married with four school-aged children. He is a farmer working in the Philippines who earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month. Abraham is asking for a loan of PHP 45,000 to buy hog feed and other supplies. He has been doing this business for 23 years. Abraham wishes to maintain his business to provide his children needs in school and the basic necessities of his family.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and other supplies

loans.name: Giovanni Francisco

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, el señor Giovanni Francisco se caracteriza por ser un buen trabajador debido a que ha sabido llevar el bienestar de su hogar y ha logrado darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia. Aél se le conoce por ser una persona excelente y con buenos valores morales como persona.

En esta oficina de Ceprodel se presentó el señor Giovanni Francisco a solicitar crédito para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, el objetivo de este crédito lo necesita para la compra de materiales de construcción como bloques, arena, cemento, piedrín, hierro esto será utilizado para hacer un garaje y así darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, señor Giovanni Francisco is known for being a good worker because he has known how to improve  the well-being of his household and give his family a better quality of life.  He is also known for being an excellent person who has good moral values.

Señor Giovanni Francisco came into this Ceprodel office to request a loan to improve the condition of his dwelling.  The purpose of this loan is to purchase construction materials like blocks, sand, cement, gravel and iron.  These items will be used to build a garage to give his family a quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to make improvements to his dwelling.

loans.name: Crhistian Felipe

texts.es: Vocación y perseverancia son las palabras que describen a Christian quien desde muy joven supo que lo suyo sería tener un salón de belleza, fue entonces cuando estaba en colegio cuando aprovechaba su tiempo libre para aprender este oficio al lado de un amigo que tenía una barbería y quien le enseñó las diferentes técnicas. Hoy a sus 21 años de edad y con la ilusión de mejorar su calidad de vida y ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su familia, este joven espera reabrir su negocio, el cual se vio obligado a cerrar debido a los problemas de violencia que enfrentó su barrio, para ello Crhistian necesita de un préstamo para comprar máquinas de motilar, cuchillas, peinillas y algunos insumos como gomina y otros productos necesarios para su labor.
texts.en:
Vocation and perseverance are the words that describe Christian.  From a very young age, he knew that he would own a beauty salon.  When he was in high school, he made the most of his spare time to learn this trade alongside a friend who owned a barber's shop and taught him the different techniques.

Christian is now 21 and, with the hope of improving his quality of life and being able to offer his family a better future, this young man hopes to re-open his business which he had to close down owing to problems of violence in his neighborhood.  Christian needs a loan so that he can buy haircutting tools, razors, combs and some supplies such as hair gel and other products that he needs for his work.

loans.use: to buy tools and supplies to re-open his business

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
María, administra una tienda, vive con su familia que la forman sus dos hijos, ella es madre soltera, sus hijos trabajan  y le ayudan económicamente para el gasto del hogar, ella inicio el negocio en su propia casa, esto debido a la necesidad de tener ingresos para sus necesidades, su horario de venta es de 7:00am a 7:00pm.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para el negocio, comprando aceite, condimentos, arroz, frijoles y pastas, esta compra le permitirá crecer en el inventario, satisfaciendo las necesidades de los clientes.
Su propósito es tener un negocio surtido de mercadería, atender la demanda de los clientes, para generar mayores ventas para cancelar las cuotas de este préstamo.
texts.en:
María owns a store and lives with her two children.  She is a single mother, and her children work and help with the household expenses.  She started her business in her home because she needed an income to meet her needs.  Her store is open from 7:00am until 7:00pm.

She is asking for this loan to purchase merchandise for the store, such as oil, condiments, rice, beans, and pasta.  These purchases will allow her to grow her inventory and satisfy her customers needs.  

Her goal is to have a well-stocked store, meet her customers needs so that she can generate more sales to cancel out the payments for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like oil, condiments, rice, beans, and pasta.

loans.name: Akpar

texts.en:
Akpar is 49 years old. He is married and has three children. 

He sells cattle for a living. As a rule, Akpar purchases small cattle in the central market, feeds them and then resells them at higher prices in the local market. 

Being in this business for 12 years, he knows very well how to choose the animals, how to breed them and look after them. Thus, he gets up every morning in order to feed the animals and to look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and generate a stable and considerable income for his large family. 

Akpar is planning to enlarge the stock and to purchase more cattle. With this purpose, he requests 2,500 USD that he will spend for the purchase of young cattle and sheep. Akpar deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.          

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cattle and sheep for expanding the business.

loans.name: Evelyn Yazaira

texts.es:
Evelyn, tiene 28 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con su familia y administra una tienda donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad.
Actualmente quiere invertir en mercadería para el negocio, por lo tanto solicita un préstamo para comprarse pastas, condimentos, boquitas, pan, huevos, aceite, azúcar y demás productos que son necesarios para el negocio, ya que son productos que los clientes demandan.
Su objetivo es mantener el negocio bien surtido, ya que de él depende su hijo, por lo mismo quiere garantizase el bienestar del pequeño, manteniendo el negocio rentable.
texts.en: Evelyn, 28, has a six-year-old son; she’s a single mother.  She lives with her family and runs a general store where she stocks basic need items.  She wants to invest in merchandise for the store so is asking for a loan to buy pasta, condiments, snacks, bread, eggs, oil, sugar and other products that are needed for the store because they are products that customers demand.  Her goal is to keep the store well stocked because her son depends on it and she wants to keep it profitable because she wants to guarantee her little one’s wellbeing.

loans.use: Para comprarse pastas, condimentos, boquitas, pan, huevos, aceite, azúcar.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La señora virginio avive en una colonia que esta a media hora del pueblo y es un lugar muy bonito en donde celebran la fiesta de la virgen de Guadalupe el doce de diciembre  y es muy alegre, ella es casada con el señor Eusebio y con quien procreo dos hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad.

      Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de frutas y legumbres en donde  a un comenzar con esta actividad y desea que le baya bien ya que con ello cuenta para mejorar sus ingresos de su hogar.

     Quien lo inspiro a ello fue su familia que aun  que pequeña  desea darle lo más necesario para a un así también cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja de albañil y le va bien.

      Lo que más  desea es que con esta actividad pueda trabajar y así incrementar día con día su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Virginio lives in a rural area half an hour from the town.  It's a pretty place known for its Virgen de Guadalupe celebration every December.  Virginio and her husband, Sr. Eusebio, have two children, both still living at home.  

Virginio is applying for a loan to buy merchandise for her fruit and vegetable business.  It's a new business and she hopes that the extra income will help her family.

Virginio is starting the business to help her family.  She wants to help her husband, a construction worker, provide for their young family.  

Virginio wants the chance to work and contribute to her family's well-being.

loans.use: to stock her fruit and vegetable business.

loans.name: Damiana

texts.es:
Damiana  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Las Estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca”, ubicado en el Centro Poblado D. Chipana, distrito Pilcuyo, provincia El Collao, departamento D. Puno, tiene 68 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 7 hijos, todos independientes.  La señora no cuenta con estudios.
Junto con su esposo se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganados vacunos, ovinos y porcinos, hace un año que trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  su primer préstamo  fue por la suma D.  S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
Ahora  solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma D. S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra D. dos ovejas para su respectivo engorD. por tres meses.  Como muchas mujeres en Puno,  también cuenta que se dedica a la chacra, a la producción D. papa, cebada, avena, pastos y alfalfa, actividad que le genera algunos otros ingresos.
Su sueño es continuar con  el negocio y mejorar sus ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Damiana is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Estrellitas Unidas D. Titicaca” (The United Little Stars of Titicaca) which is located in the District of Pilcuyo, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 68 years old and has seven children, all of whom are independent. Sra. Damiana did not receive an education.

Together with her husband, Damiana buys and sells cattle, sheep, and pigs. She started working with Manuela Ramos one year ago. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 PEN and the money was invested in her business.

Now she is requesting a new loan in the amount of 500 PEN and will invest the money in the purchase of two sheep that she will fatten over the next three months. Like many women in Puno, Damiana also works on a farm. She grows potatoes, barley, oats, grasses, and alfalfa. This allows her to generate some extra income.

Her dream is to continue with her business and improve her earnings. What she likes most about the Communal Bank are the meetings and the punctuality.

loans.use: to buy two sheep for fattening.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 50 years old and married with three children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. For the past ten years, Rosita has been raising and selling livestock. She enjoys the good business return she has had from past deals and earns 2,000 PHP each month. Rosita joined GDMPC earlier this year.

Rosita is requesting a 2,000 PHP loan from GDMPC to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She hopes her loan will augment and improve the growth of her animals and improve her potential to sell at a higher rate. In the future, Rosita plans to expand her business to uplift her family's income and provide for day-to-day expenses. She plans to buy more livestock to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and suppplies

loans.name: Lalo Vitorino

texts.es:
Vitorino nació en la selva del Perú exactamente en la provincia de La Convención en la ciudad de Quillabamba, tiene 49 años de edad y tiene tres hijos. 

Actualmente, Vitorino vive en el Valle Sagrado de los Incas en la ciudad de Calca y donde realiza sus diferentes actividades económicas, él es carpintero y fabrica todo tipo de muebles de madera como por ejemplo puertas, carpetas, roperos, mesas, sillas, camas y muchas otras cosas más. 

En esta oportunidad Vitorino requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo madera, clavos, cola de carpintero y otras cosas más.

El Banco Comunal “Milenium III” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Vitorino was born in the Peruvian rainforest, in La Convención province, in the town of Quillabamba.  He is 49 years old and has three children.

Vitorino currently lives in the Sacred Valley of the Incas, in the city of Calca and this is where he carries out his business activities.  Vitorino is a carpenter.  He makes all kinds of wooden furniture such as doors, desks, wardrobes, tables, chairs, beds and many other items.  On this occasion, he needs a loan to buy materials such as wood, nails, wood glue, etc.  

The 'Milenium III' community bank meets once a month in the city of Calca, in Cusco department (Peru).  Cusco is well known for being a very touristy, commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world (Machu Picchu).

loans.use: to buy materials such as wood, nails, wood glue, etc.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq.  He is 33 years old, married and lives with his wife and two children.

Ali is an owner for mobile phone shop since 2006, repairing mobile phones and selling accessories and phones.  He has more than seven years experience in this field, and has a good reputation and he has a lot of customers passing by his shop.

He decided to apply for $2,400 loan in order to buy a computer, a generator and to make a showcases for his shop.  He is aiming to gain more profits to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to buy a computer, a generator and to make a showcases for his shop.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
Marleni, se dedica a vender verduras, vive con su familia, el negocio de Marleni es la venta de verduras tomates, rábanos, plátanos, papas, dichas verduras las compra en el mercado municipal, luego sale a visitar casa por casa a los clientes.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de verduras, ya que por falta de efectivo no puede en algunos días salir con la venta, al disponer de este fondo piensa invertirlo en güisquiles, repollo, papas, cebollas, con esto espera tener disponibilidad para mantener las ventas.
Las aspiraciones de Marleni son mejorar la vivienda, ser buen cliente con los pagos para contar con financiamientos que le permitan crecer.
texts.en:
Marleni sells vegetables. She lives with her family. Marleni's business is to sell vegetables such as tomatoes, radishes, bananas, potatoes which she buys at the municipal market and then sells house-to-house to her customers.

She is asking for a loan to buy vegetables as some days she can't go out to sell as she has no funds with which to buy the vegetables. On receiving the loan she is thinking of investing it in the purchase of güisquiles, cabbage, potatoes, onions. With this she hopes to be available to maintain her sales.

Marleni's aspirations are to improve her house, be a good member with regards her repayments so as to be able to count on financial backing that will allow her to grow.

loans.use: to buy güisquiles, cabbage, potatoes and onions for the business.

loans.name: Vanesa

texts.en:
Vanesa is 31 years old, married and has four children who attend school. Vanesa owns a computer shop in the village where her family lives. She established her business five years ago. She offers printing and encoding services especially for students. She usually earns a daily profit of 300 PHP, which is just enough to cover the family's daily expenses for meals and allowances. 

Vanesa is requesting for a loan for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy tarpaulins, colored papers and inks to use in her printing business. The loan will enable Vanesa to improve the services rendered to her customers.  In the future, she would like to make her family financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase tarpaulins, colored papers, and inks.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is widowed and blessed with three children. She describes herself as a hardworking businesswoman. She has been selling porridge for the last 20 years to support her family. She also does farming for more income. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She has requested a loan of 60,000 to buy ingredients such as maize flour, millet and sorghum.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as sorghum, millet and maize flour.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 46 years old and married, with 4 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rebecca is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rebecca has been raising pigs for 3 years and also earns additional income from her sari-sari store, motorcycle transport and vulcanizing (tire) shop businesses. She works tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business so she can secure her family's future.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Safargul

texts.ru: Сафаргул замужем. Она заботливая и трудолюбивая женщина. Более 4 лет она занимается купле- продажей разных видов посуды. Она имеет широкий ассортимент посуды, у неё в магазине можно найти набор европейской и национальной посуды. Её торговая точка находится на центральном рынке города, там, где много людей. Товар востребуемый. Сафаргул хочет увеличить ассортимент товара, и она хочет расширить ассортимент товара  и приобрести стеклянную посуду. С этой целью она запрашивает займ в размере 700$ США.
texts.en: Safargul is married. She is a caring and hard-working woman. For over four years, she has been working as a vendor of different types of dinnerware and drinkware. She has a wide assortment of goods. In her store there is a selection of European and national drinkware. Her vending facility is located at the central market of her town, where there always many people. Her goods are in demand. Safargul would like to expand and diversify her stock of goods by buying glassware. For this purpose she is requesting a loan in the amount of US $700,-.

loans.use: to buy glassware

loans.name: Kaneezan's Group

texts.en: Kaneezan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s grocery store. He will use the loan to buy items in bulk to sell to his customers, including spices, sugar and cooking oil. Her son is very experienced in his business, and Kanzeean believes that his loan will allow him to earn increased profits. Kaneezan helps support her family by sewing clothes for her neighbors and customers. She is 51 years, very active and fulfills her responsibilities very well. She has seven children, five daughters and two sons. She is teaching her daughters how to sew so that they can someday going into this business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, spices, cooking oil and other items for a grocery store.

loans.name: Sebit

texts.en:
Sebit is a 50-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has 5 children between the ages of 21 and 8. All of them go to school. 

Sebit runs a food stall business and he has been in this business for 7 years. He has 1 employee. Sebit heard about Finance Sudan from the loan officer word of mouth promotion done in the market. He is taking a loan of SDG 3000 to purchase items like wheat flour, cooking oil, salt, milk, sugar and many others. In addition to this business, Sebit has another source of income from his shop rent. 

In 5 years time, Sebit would like to have a better future like having a good house. 

His major challenges include the low income rate and high cost of goods.

Sebit says that he appreciates the help from Finance Sudan .

loans.use: to purchase items like wheat flour, cooking oil, salt, milk, sugar and many others

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy hardware materials to sell

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La señora Martha es empleada domestica y además vende mercadería según la temporada. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de variedad de mercadería (juguetes, chompas, etc.) y aprovechar las fiestas de fin de año. Martha es casada y tiene cuatro hijos  Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz, Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a kiva  y tambien la segunda vez que solicita un crédito de IMPRO.
texts.en: Martha is a domestic employee and also sells seasonal merchandise.  She needs the loan to buy a variety of merchandise (toys, sweaters, etc.) and take advantage of the end of year festivities.  Martha is married and has four children.  She lives in her own house located in the city of La Paz’s Irpavi II zone.  This is the second time she’s worked with Kiva and also the second time she’s asked for a loan from IMPRO.

loans.use: to buy toys and sweaters.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita works hard to support three children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 1800 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light-source that is waterproof during the rainy season.

Angelita is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase of solar lamp

loans.name: Haggai

texts.en:
Haggai A. is married and has 9 children. He and his wife also have more 4 relatives staying with them so they care for many.

Haggai started by cultivating rice for two years. He sold it and realized some profit which he used to start a retail shop business in Serere Trading Centre. This bussiness deals in the retail shop in the main village trading centre.

I (Moses Onyango, Kiva Country Director) did the stock taking in this shop, and the total amount of money in this shop both cash and in goods is 435,000 Ugandan shillings that is equivalent to $250.

Given a loan of $500, They plan to increase the stock in their shop so that even the Items that they use not to sell can be included in the stock.

Their shop is stratagically placed and they command a high number of customers. Being faithful people to all, I believe that their bussiness will prosper. Additionally Haggai attained business skills training with Village Enterprise Fund so he is capable of handling the loan money and refunding it well.

loans.use: Increasing retail store stock to include broader array of products

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a very active woman. Some years ago they started to have financial difficulties in their home, as her husband's salary was not enough to cover all the necessities of the home. This is when her parents left the city and she was left with their business to run, a grocery store. Luisa saw the opportunity and she, herself managed the business to solve their financial problems and this way help her husband. It has already been 3 years since all this happened and she still sees success in her business, that is now her property. She has managed to overcome many of their difficulties.

Luisa now needs a loan of $250 that will will put towards expanding the business, by purchasing greater quantities of merchandise, thereby reducing her costs. You can help her keep her business growing, and helping her husband. Do not hesitate, remember that Luisa and her family need you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Luisa es una mujer muy activa, hace algunos años comenzaron a tener problemas económicos en su casa, pues el sueldo de su esposo no alcanzaba a cubrir todas las necesidades de hogar. Es entonces cuando sus papas se fueron da la ciudad y dejaron el negocio propio que ellos tenían, una tienda de abarrotes, Luisa vio la oportunidad de continuar ella misma con el negocio y poder resolver así su problemas y ayudar a su esposo. Ya son 3 años de que esto sucedió y ella continua satisfactoriamente con el negocio, que ahora es de su propiedad y gracias a este ha logrado superar muchas de sus dificultades.

Ahora Luisa necesita de un crédito de $ 250 DLLS, mismos que utilizará para hacer crecer su negocio, comprando una mayor cantidad de mercancía, reduciendo así el costo. Tu puedes ayudarla a poder seguir creciendo y ayudar a su esposo, no lo dude más, recuerda que Luisa y su familia te necesitan.

loans.use: PURCAHSE MERCAHNDISE

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Mrs. Magdalene I. is 46 years old, married, with four children. She has been a LAPO client for over 4 years now. Magdalene lives in Benin City, Nigeria, where she owns a drinks store. She is requesting US$400 to further expand the business.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
H. Elvira Seyran kizi is head of a small IDP family that includes her son and herself. She is 35 years old. Animal husbandry is the only business and income source in the family. They have 12 sheep. However, it is very difficult to feed her family with the income from the small number of animals. So, they decided to purchase additional sheep to increase the family income and satisfy the basic family needs. 
She applied for credit to Agroinvest, where she requested 1100 USD for that purpose.

loans.use: Going to purchase additional sheep

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa C. V. is 20 years old and is married with two young children. She and her husband raise sheep to sell. With this loan she will buy 5 to 10 more sheep depending on the cost. They will be grazed in the highlands around her home where the rainy season turns the entire area into wonderful pastureland.

This is Teresa's first credit cycle with Friendship Bridge, and it's a little scary thinking about having to come up with the payments. She joined the program with the hopes to build toward having enough to provide for her family: to buy enough food, a house which does not leak in the rain, and to send her children to school when the time comes. At this time her health and her family's health are good and they have no problems. Her hope is that the lambs will grow and not get sick and she'll be successful with the loan.

Teresa is a member of the women's group Nueva Vision, or New Vision. Most of the women in her group, even the younger ones, cannot read, write, or speak Spanish. They primarily stay with their traditional ways and speak their native Ixil language. Until very recently, almost all the houses in this remote village were made of wood, a very poor building material for this area, but now most are of concrete block and adobe. The change is that many of the younger men are now working in another country and they send money home to their families, enabling the families to improve their housing.

Interviewed by Juana Cedillo in the Ixil language.
Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase and raise 5 lambs

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
PASCUALA is 35 years old, separated, with three children. She is an artisan. She embroiders napkins, tablecloths, shawls, cushions, and the blouses and skirts that the women of her community wear. She sells her products in the nearest town or in the city, and her customers are tourists who visit the area. She is part of the solidarity group called Libélula 2, along with Ms. Maria Sánchez Vázquez (artisan) and Ms. Pascuala Gómez Pérez (artisan). All of them will invest their loans in the purchase of thread and in that way increase their production. This will produce more earnings and a better economic condition for their family.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

PASCUALA tiene 35 años, separada, tres hijos. Ella es artesana, borda servilletas, manteles, chales, cojines, blusas y faldas que las mujeres de su comunidad utiliza; sus productos los vende en el pueblo mas cercano o en la ciudad, los clientes son turistas que visitan el lugar. Forma parte del grupo llamado Libélula 2 junto con doña Maria Sánchez Vázquez (artesana) y doña Pascuala Gómez Pérez (artesana). Ambas con sus préstamos invertirán en la compra de hilo y así aumentar la producción. Esto generara obtener mas ganancias y por lo tanto una mejor condición económica para su familia.

loans.use: HANDICRAFTS

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia is a native of the district of Nuñoa and is the only daughter of Margarita. When her mother got sick, she decided to put her business of selling garments aside to devote herself completely to the care of her dear beloved mother and to be by her side during her recovery. Unfortunately, all of this effort was in vain because her mother lost her life one month ago due to the very advanced stage of her illness. This caused her a lot of pain and suffering. Now after this regrettable event, Julia hopes to start anew and to start her business one more time. To secure her dreams in the company of her adorable goddaughter, she is requesting a loan which she will invest completely in the acquisition of a greater quantity of merchandise. This young woman is waiting for your selfless support to be able to keep moving forward and prosper in life.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Julia natural des distrito de Nuñoa, es la única hija de Margarita, desde que su madre enfermó decidió dejar a un lado su negocio de ventas de prendas de vestir, para consagrarse completamente al cuidado de su querida y entrañable madre y así junto a ella ayudarla a la recuperación de su salud; desafortunadamente todo ese esfuerzo fue en vano, ella perdió la vida hace un mes, por etapa muy avanzada de su enfermedad, este hecho le causó mucho sufrimiento y dolor.Ahora después de este lamentable suceso ella desea empezar de nuevo e iniciar su negocio una vez más. Para concretar sus deseos en compañía de su adorable ahijadita, ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlos completamente en la adquisición de mayor cantidad de mercadería.Esta joven en estos momentos espera por tu apoyo desinteresado para salir adelante y prosperar en la vida.

loans.use: Increase in capital to acquire a greater quantity of garments and to consolidate her life's small business.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: I live in Multan, a medium-sized city famous in Pakistan for its art work. I have four children: three boys and one girl. Thankfully all of my children attend a local school. My husband is an enthusiastic entrepreneur. He works very hard to provide for his family. By profession he is a rickshaw driver, and now his rickshaw needs maintenance. Please lend him $250 for this purpose.

loans.use: Repair rickshaw

loans.name: Total 2083(B) Group

texts.en:
Margret is 30 years old and married with three children. She sells charcoal for a living. She wants to use the extra business profits to renovate her house.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her clothing business.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela has belonged to the Capulí communal bank for 3 years. In her communal bank, she has learned to be responsible, how to educate her children, and how to save money.

Gabriela is married, is 28-years-old, and has 3 children. She sells honey and pollen, among other products. She makes her sales by working as a street vendor in the different markets. Gabriela also sells clothing with her husband.

Gabriela needs a loan of 3000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of honey, pollen, and children's clothing.

Gabriela's dreams are to have her own home, to grow her business, and to see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Gabriela pertenece al Banco Comunal Capulí hace 3 años, en su Banco Comunal aprendió a ser responsable, como educar a los hijos y a ahorrar.

Gabriela es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 3 hijos, Gabriela vende miel de abeja, polen entre otros productos, sus ventas lo realiza de manera ambulatoria en las diferentes ferias. Además Gabriela junto a su esposo venden ropa.

Gabriela necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de miel de abeja, polen, ropa de niños.

Los sueños de Gabriela son tener casa propia, que su negocio sea más grande y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Gabriela needs a loan of 3000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of honey, pollen, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Mauro

texts.es:
Alejandro dedicates 100% of his energy to his daily work in agriculture because it earns enough to sustain his beloved family. He grows a variety of vegetables that he sells in the markets of his city and nearby towns. There is strong demand and hundreds of households await his visits in order to stock up on the products of this working father. Alejandro is asking for a loan to improve the quality and quantity of his products.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

ALEJANDRO, otorga el 100% de su energía a su labor agrícola diaria, debido a que de ella obtiene el sustento diario para su amada familia. Cultiva diversos vegetales que comercializa en las ferias de su ciudad y en los pueblos aledaños a ella, tiene gran demanda y centenares de mas de casa esperan su visita para abastecerse de lo que este trabajador padre les ofrece.Desea mejorar la calidad y cantidad de sus productos y para este fin solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: Increased capital to improve the quality and quantity of his vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock of mobile phones and scratch cards.

loans.name: José Cesar

texts.es:
Don José C. rents out videogames for a living in the town of Chinandega in Nicaragua. He is the father of two school aged children, and it is his obligation to offer them the necessary conditions for their development within their society. It is very important to point out that he started his business 8 years ago and presently he has improved business and purchased videogames to be sold.

Today he needs economic resources to buy videogames, and therefore he has approached Ceprodel to obtain the loan needed to purchase these videogames to be offered to the clients that visit his business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

El caballero José C. se dedica a su negocio de alquiler de videojuegos en la ciudad de Chinandega en Nicaragua. Es padre de dos hijos en edades escolares cuya obligación es brindarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo en su localidad. Es de suma importancia destacar que el negocio lo inició desde hace 8 años y hoy en día lo ha mejorado y adquirido los videojuegos para ofrecerlos.

La necesidad que atraviesa hoy en día es que necesita el recurso económico para la compra de los videojuegos, por este motivo acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para la compra de estos videojuegos y así ofertarlos a los clientes que le visiten en su negocio de alquiler de videojuegos.

loans.use: Purchase videogames for rent.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
The economic possibilities of her family did not allow her to continue her primary education. Clara is 40 years old and for many years she has worked producing handicrafts. In addition to this work, she is investing with great expectations in a hen production business. This small but indispensable business is allowing her to live tranquilly and with the hope of improving her income. Clara’s dedicated mother is in charge of caring for and feeding their little animals so that they in a short period of time are able to reproduce and, in some cases, can provide them with eggs to sell wholesale. Clara’s wish is to acquire a greater quantity of hens to continue raising and then selling them.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer.

Las posibilidades económicas de su familia no le permitieron seguir su educación básica, doña Clara de 40 años durante muchos años se viene dedicando a la artesanía, adicionalmente a esta labor con mucha expectativa está incursionando en el negocio de producción de gallinas, este pequeño, pero indispensable negocio le está permitiendo vivir con tranquilidad y la esperanza de mejorar sus ingresos. La madre de Clara es quien con suma dedicación se encarga de cuidar y alimentar a sus animalitos, para que estos en muy corto tiempo logren reproducirse y en algunos casos puedan proveerles de huevos para comercializarlos al por mayor. El deseo de Clara es adquirir mayor cantidad de gallinas, para continuar con su crianza y venta posterior.

loans.use: To buy more hens to raise and re-sell.

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili is 28 years old. She is married with 1 child aged 2. She has been a clothes-seller since 2007. Every day, she works at her business.

Pili now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is 42 years old and married, with 7 children between 28 and 5 years old. She has been a snacks seller since 1995. Every day, she works from 7AM to 5PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Asma is now looking for a loan to expand her business by adding items to her current stock.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding items to her current stock.

loans.name: Lissette Mercedes

texts.es: Doña Lissette tiene 41 años de edad, es casada y habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Laureles Norte, tiene dos hermosos hijos de 12 y 15 años de edad, que están estudiando, su esposo se desempeña como abogado y esta pendiente del bienestar de su familia. Lissette tiene una pulpería y venta de variedades desde hace doce años, ella inició con fondos propios y con ayuda de su esposo. Para poder invertir en la pulpería comenzó con créditos y así ha permanecido por mucho tiempo. El uso de este préstamo será para el mismo objetivo, desea invertir en su pulpería, comprará granos básicos, y así poder satisfacer las demandas de sus clientes. A largo plazo es crecer más en las ventas,  así como dar estudios a sus hijos para que sean hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lissette, 41, is married and lives in a neighborhood of the capital, Managua, called Laureles Norte. She has two beautiful children 12 and 15 years old who are in school. Her husband is a lawyer and is devoted to the wellbeing of his family. Lissette has had a general store selling various items for 12 years, starting it with her own capital and with the help of her husband. In order to start the store she obtained loans, so it has lasted for a long time. She will use this loan in the same way, investing in her store, buying grains to satisfy her customer's requirements. Her long-term goal is to further increase her sales, in order to educate her sons so that they would be honorable men.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of grains for her store

loans.name: Huber

texts.es: Huber tiene 24 años de edad, por el momento está conviviendo con su pareja, de esa relación tienen 2 hijos. Desde que tuvo 11 años, Huber se dedica a la agricultura, y cuando llegó a tener su propia familia empezó a sembrar en grandes cantidades, productos como cítricos y plátanos, le agrada la actividad de la chacra, sobre todo sembrar diversos productos, pero lo que él siembra en mayor  cantidad son los frutos cítricos y cuando llega su temporada, de diciembre a marzo es cuando suben su precio, los demás meses cuestan menos, pero siempre le alcanza para solventar sus necesidades, lo difícil en los cítricos, es que se demoran en desarrollar de 3 a 5 años, por ello, siembra de modo alternado y diversos productos. Por ejemplo, de sus plantaciones de plátano, cosechará de aquí a 5 años. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. Con este dinero comprará pequeñas plantas de plátano, que luego trasplantará.
texts.en:
Huber is 24 and currently living with his partner and their 2 children. Since he was 11, Huber has worked in agriculture, and when he started his own family, he began to sow crops such as citrus fruit and bananas in larger quantities. Farming pleases him, above all to grow diverse crops, but what he grows the most are citrus fruits. The price goes up when they are in season from December to March, and is lower the rest of the year, but he always earns enough for his necessities. The hard part about citrus is that they take 3 to 5 years to develop, which is why he sows rotating crops and a variety of produce. For example, he will not harvest from his banana plantings until 5 years from now. This is the first time he has requested a loan from MFP.
