With this money he will buy banana seedlings to transplant.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of banana seedlings

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Mrs. Hun S., 30, lives in the Chroloung Commune in Kompong Tom Province. She raises pigs at her home, which she sells to the butcher after she has raised them for six months. She cares for a young child who is attending school. Her husband, Mr. Ven Sinat, 34, makes a living selling duck eggs. S. and her husband decided to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 Riel ($250) to purchase more food to fatten their poultry.

loans.use: to purchase more food for their poultry

loans.name: Ndèye Mame

texts.fr: Ndèye Mame S., 48 ans, mariée avec 09 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Peyrissac depuis 4 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter des sacs de pain de singe (fruit du baobab), du bissap, du sucre,  des haricots, des condiments, et de l’huile pour renforcer son activité de restauration. Ndèye Mame vends du jus, des glaces, des crèmes glacées et le petit déjeuner. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Ndèye Mame S., age 48, is married and has nine children to look after. She has been a member of the village association Boucotte Peyrissac for four and a half years. She wants to buy sacks of monkey bread (the fruit of the baobab tree), bissap (dried hibiscus flowers), sugar, beans, condiments, and oil for bolstering her catering business. Ndèye Mame sells juices, ice, ice cream, and breakfast foods. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries and provisions for selling breakfasts

loans.name: Dulce Maria

texts.es:
La señora Dulce Maria J. C. es casada vive con su esposo, ellos son un matrimonio joven y no tienen hijos, ella se dedica a vender zapatos y bolsas por catalogo desde hace 6 meses y su esposo trabaja como mesero en un restaurante y entre los ingresos de ellos 2 cubren los gastos del hogar.
La señora Dulce Maria está solicitando un préstamo para construir una barda al frente de su casa para que de esa manera si en un futuro ellos deciden tener hijos les puedan ofrecer un hogar seguro y ellos puedan vivir tranquilamente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dulce Maria J. C. is married and lives with her husband. They are a young married couple and do not have children. She has been selling shoes and purses by catalogue for the past 6 months. Her husband works as a waiter in a restaurant and between their two incomes, they cover their living expenses. Mrs. Dulce Maria is asking for a loan to build a wall in front of their house so that if, in the future they decide to have children, they can provide them a safe home where they can live in peace.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall in front of her house

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence A. recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya.

As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

Florence is 42 years old, married, and the mother of 5 children, who are all in school. She and her family live in the Nyalenda area of Kisumu.

Florence has had a business in Kisumu selling fruit since the year 2000. She initially was only selling ripe bananas, but now she sells pineapples, oranges, and mangoes as well. Florence purchases stock from Kibuye Market in town. She decided to start this business because she knew that it would be profitable enough to pay for her family’s upkeep.

She has applied for her first loan from K-MET – a loan of approximately $200. Florence will use the loan to buy products cheaply in bulk.

loans.use: To purchase fruit in bulk

loans.name: Paz

texts.es:
Paz trabaja como albañil y por las noches trabaja como transportista pues tiene su minibús que trabaja de trasporte publico inter-ciudad La Paz – es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo cubre la manutención de sus dos hijos y esposa. Vive en la casa de sus suegros ubicada en la zona Los Andes de la  Ciudad de El Alto.

El minibús con lo que cuenta está en mal estado mismo que lo esta vendiendo; Paz planea comprar otro minibús, el costo total será de $us 3,500; Paz tiene $us 2,500 y solicita un crédito por $us 1,000 para completar el total del dinero. De esa forma podrá continuar trabajando como transportista.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Mr. Paz A. works as a mason during the days, and in the evenings he drives a mini-bus carrying passengers between El Alto and La Paz. The bus is his main source of income, helping him provide for his wife and two children. He lives in a house owned by his in-laws, which is located in the Los Andes area of the city of El Alto. The mini-bus which he drives now is in very poor condition, and he is trying to sell it. He plans to buy a newer one, in better condition, which will cost him $3,500. He has saved up $2,500 towards the purchase, and is requesting a loan of $1,000 to complete the purchase amount. This will enable him to continue his transport business. This is the second loan he has requested from Impro. The first one was repaid on time, and for that reason they are offering him a second one.

Translated from Spanish by William Farren, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a mini-bus

loans.name: Punku - Paxi Group

texts.es:
Punku paxi, significa Puerta de la luna en lengua aymará, esta es  la denominación que adopta una asociación, que trabajan con la familia de Pro-Mujer hace mas de nueve años . Varios son los negocios de esta asociación, Abraham por ejemplo es chapista de autos, otras venden ropa para bebes, también tienen tiendas de consumo pero la mayoría son artesanas, realizan mantas con hermosos diseños tradicionales tejidos en telar, luego los venden a tiendas turisticas y tambien a pedido.
Necesitan mayores créditos para comprar materia prima. Generando mayores ingresos conseguirán mejorar su calidad de vida junto a la de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Punku paxi means The Moon's Door in the Aymará language and is the name that this association, that has worked with the Pro-Mujer family for 9 years, has adopted. The association has various businesses. Abraham, for example, is a auto body worker. Others sell baby clothing and other consumer items, but the majority are craftspeople; they make blankets with beautiful traditional designs woven in looms that are sold in souvenir shops as well as by request. They need work capital to purchase raw materials. By generating higher incomes they will improve their quality of life as well as that of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Bilikisu

texts.en: Bilikisu is 28 years old and married with 2 children. She sells foodstuffs and local gin.  She is a LAPO client. She is requesting a loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and local gin to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and local gin to sell

loans.name: Misael

texts.es:
Al señor Misael L. tiene poco que adquirió su vivienda pero le está haciendo falta un cuarto mas para sus hijos quienes están ya creciendo y necesitan su propio espacio en la casa. 
   Por tal motivo decidió construir un cuarto más en la parte de atrás de la vivienda pero no tiene el dinero necesario para comprar el material y pagar la mano de obra. Nos está nueva mente solicitando un préstamo para llevar acabo la construcción de la recamara de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Misael L. recently acquired his house, but still needs one more room for his children, who are growing and need their own space in their home.

For this reason, he has decided to build an addition on the back part of the house, but does not have the money necessary to purchase materials and pay workers. He has requested a loan to enable him to construct a room for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room on the first floor of his home

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina Y. is thirty-one years old. She is married and has given birth to one child, a son, who is currently in primary school. She lives with her child and husband in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase, a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Faustina is also a trader, trading in vegetables: onions, tomatoes, pepper, garden eggs, etc. She sells on a table in the market square. She procures her vegetables from farmers in the nearby communities at cost effective prices.

Faustina has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure vegetables in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best of education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Phạm Thị

texts.en:
H. Phạm Thị (416071595) is a 52-year-old woman living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has 2 adult children. To making a living, H. owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of food products in the local community. H. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. H. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. This will be the 6th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: used to purchase a transport vehicle

loans.name: Flor De Eucalipto Group

texts.es:
En el centro focal Alto Lima (El Alto-La Paz), se reúne la asociación “Flor De Eucalipto”, esta formado por doce mujeres,, ellas trabajan de manera responsable en sus actividades internas.
Existen diferentes negocios dentro el grupo, tales como: venta de ropa, producción de colchones y payasas (colchones de paja), venta de refrescos naturales, elaboración y venta de api con pasteles (api = mazamorra de  maíz), tejidos artesanales en lana de alpaca, también tienen tiendas de consumo. La mayoría de ellas ofrecen sus productos en puestos de la feria 16 de julio ubicado en la ciudad de El alto, 
Desean aumentar su producción y ventas para esto necesitan comprar mercadería y materia prima (compra de paja, fibra de alpaca,  ropa par invierno, harina y otros)
texts.en:
In the Alto Lima Community Center you will find the “Flor De Eucalipto” (Eucalyptus Flower) Association. This group is composed of twelve women, who work responsibly as they pursue their own activities.

The members are involved in different businesses like clothing sales, production of straw mattresses, soft drink sales, production and sales of cakes with api (corn porridge), handmade fabrics of alpaca wool, and other retail shops. Many of them sell their products at the “16 de Julio” (July 16th) market located in the city of El Alto.

They all wish to increase their production and sales. For this reason, they need to buy additional merchandise and raw materials (such as straw, alpaca fiber, winter clothing, flour, etc.).

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: market gardening

loans.name: Joseph Kwamah

texts.en: Joseph A. is married to two wives and has nine children. All his children are in school, with his first-born in college and last-born in primary school. Joseph has been repairing cars for the last four years in Naivasha town. Joseph heard about KADET through a friend and decided to join the micro-finance institution. This will be his first loan with KADET and he intends to use it to buy fencing materials to put a perimeter wall around his garage for security purposes. Joseph plans to grow his repair business in future and also to offer employment and training to other people who wish to venture into car mechanics. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy fencing materials to fence off his car repairs garage

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo L. is 44 years old, married with 2 school-age children, and resides in Purok Kapayas, Brgy. Malingin, Bago City, Negros Occidental, and he is one of the few male members of NWTF-Project Dungganon.

As he tells it, he was at first hesitant to join because he thought that NWTF-Project Dungganon offered its services exclusively to women, but then a member encouraged him to try his luck anyway, and he was able to become a member. He is very grateful that NWTF gave him a chance to prove that he could improve his business with the help of his first loan.

Alfredo sells a variety of breads and other delicacies to the community. He admits that being self-employed is very hard but he is confident that his dedication to his chosen field makes success inevitable.

He now plans to use his ninth loan from NWTF amounting to PHP 15,000 as rolling capital so that he can offer a wider variety of food products to sell to his loyal customers and ultimately improve the living conditions of his family.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business

loans.name: Cuestion De Fe Group

texts.es:
Virginia C. de 40 años, elabora pan desde hace 4 años, tiene su taller en su domicilio, donde tiene un pequeño horno y trabaja junto sus hijos. Todos los días se levanta a  las 3 de la mañana para embolsar su producto y llevar a diferentes pueblos  como Batallas, Vilaqui, Curva, en esta oportunidad necesita el préstamo para comprar azúcar.
Sandra M. de 21 años vende condimentos en la feria “16 de julio”, ella aprendió esta actividad  de su madre, viaja a Desaguadero  para comprar su mercadería  como el ají, comino y ajo.
Las demás integrantes también tienen su propio negocio como la venta de ropa, comida, costura de ropa y todas necesitan el préstamo para comprar materia prima (tela), insumos (azúcar, papa) y mercadería (faldas).

loans.use: COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA, MERCADERIA E INSUMOS

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: Guillermina O. D. E. resiD. en la capital del país en el municipio D. Soyapango. A sus 54 años D. edad Guillermina se encuentra feliz en su núcleo familiar que lo compone su esposo Don Pedro  y sus dos hijos, D. los cuales solo uno D. ellos trabaja y el otro estudia. Guillermina ha sido una madre ejemplar y responsable con su familia, ha balanceado el espacio entre tiempo y trabajo, ya son dieciséis años que lleva Guillermina al mando D. su negocio, donD. posee una venta D. pupusas y un equipo D. molino el cual es para uso comercial y personal.  El destino del crédito que solicita Guillermina lo utilizara para comprar insumos necesarios en su pupuseria.

loans.use: Compra de insumos para pupusas

loans.name: 5 De Junio Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal denominado  5 DE JUNIO, está conformado por trece señores que en su mayoría radican en la Zona Villa Dolores, una zona bastante humilde de la ciudad; la característica principal de sus casas, es que son de adobe en gran parte de ellas y tienen solo una planta. La directiva está conformada por Grover, Rosmery y Silveria;  las señoras componentes del grupo son en su mayoría costureras y tejedoras de mantas, tenderas, comideras y verduleras en un mercado que es altamente competitivo. Ellas necesitan el crédito para realizar compras de materia prima tales como telas, hilos y lanas; ellas están muy animadas para trabajar con Agrocapital y de forma verbal ellas solicitaron el crédito. Este grupo está emprendiendo su segundo ciclo, la mayoría de ellas se conocen entre sí, es un grupo de personas muy alegres y responsables.

loans.use: INCREMENTO DE CAPITAL DE TRABAJO

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester R. is a 50-year-old mother of five children. She lives in Runyenjes Embu, Kenya. She began selling clothing door-to-door in 1983 and has since expanded her business. She used the funds from her first loan to start her own shop. She currently rents the shop where she sells clothes-making materials, shoes, purses, ties, and other clothing items.

In addition, the central location of her shop and her many years of doing good business within the community have gained her a good reputation and a wide customer base. Her business has done quite well due to the added advantage of access to loan funds; she has combined the additional money with hard work and perseverance in order to increase her stock and materials and build a successful income-generating business.

Ester is proud of her accomplishments and that she is now able to contribute to paying household expenses. Ester received a loan in the amount of Kshs 20,000 to further expand her business.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Blanca Guadalupe

texts.es: Blanca Guadalupe L. de 34 años de edad, reside en Soyapango del departamento de San Salvador. Blanca es madre soltera vive con sus Josué de 14 años de edad y Gabriela de 6 años de edad. Con muchos esfuerzos Blanca ha adquirido su propia casa, ella maneja un negocio el cual le deja  excelentes ganancias, es una venta de comida que Blanca realiza por su experiencia y capacidades en la cocina, los clientes de Blanca manifiestan que disfrutan mucho de cada platillo que ella realiza. Ahora Blanca está solicitando de este crédito, ya que su clientela va aumentado y se ve la urgencia de producir mayor cantidad de platillos.
texts.en:
Blanca Guadalupe L. is 34 years old and lives in Soyapango in the department of San Salvador. Blanca is a single mother and lives with her two children Josué who is 14 and Gabriela who is 6. Through her efforts, Blanca has bought a house and she runs a business that generates good income. Her business is selling food and she is able to do so because of her experience and talents in the kitchen. Blanca's customers show that they really enjoy every dish that she makes. At this point, Blanca is requesting a loan as her customer base is growing and she feels the need to produce a larger quantity of dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to prepare food

loans.name: Paula Lileth

texts.es: Paula Lileth es casada tiene 3 hijos que están estudiando los 2 mayores le ayudan a atender una tienda de productos de consumo diario desde hace 5 años la cual la instalo debido a que la colonia donde ella habita no había ninguna tienda, ella inicio vendiendo frutas y verduras, las cuales con el tiempo le generaron ganancias y fue asi como decidió vender productos como café, arroz, frijol, etc., y otros artículos que la gente consume, ahora Paula tiene necesidad de un préstamo ya que desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para poder cumplir el sueño de ver a sus hijos graduados y con un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Paula Lileth is married and has three children who go to school. The two older ones help her in the store where she sells daily consumption products. Five years ago she set up the store because the community where she lives did not have a store. She started selling fruits and vegetables. In time they generated income. That is how she decided to sell products like coffee, rice, beans, and other items that people consume. Paula now needs a loan because she wants to keep investing in her business. She want to be able to fulfill her dream of seeing her children graduate with a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of daily consumption products

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida T. is from the village of Lagonglong. Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old. Adelaida is single, with one school-aged child. To make a living, Adelaida owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Adelaida has been engaged in her business for more than 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Adelaida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Adelaida is requesting a second loan from HSPFI.  This new loan of 8000 PHP will be used to invest in expanding the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to low-income households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is twenty-eight years old, married, and has one child who is in school. He lives with his wife and child in a rented apartment in a tourist attraction community in the central region of Ghana. The community is one of the coastal towns in Ghana where the major occupation is fishing.

Daniel is a trader. He trades in goods such as cement, paints, and other building materials. He sells in a store by the roadside in the community. Daniel procures his goods from Accra. He has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase his stock.

loans.use: To buy building materials to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 45 years old and has five children, two of whom are in school. Her husband is a cleaning agent. She has been selling fish for three years. She obtains the fish from Lake Victoria and sells them to Umoja residents. Previously, she was only selling second-hand clothing, which she still continues. She hopes to export fish in the future. Elizabeth describes herself as hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To buy fish and second-hand clothes

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en: Roberto G. is a 42-year old married man who lives in Barangay Maytubig, Isabela, Negros Occidental. He earns his living driving a passenger tricycle and selling chicken and pork barbecue as well as Ready-To-Wear (RTW) clothes. Roberto’s wife, Christina, helps in running the business. They have one child who is 2 months old. The couple is striving hard to provide their child with a good future. Roberto G. joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 with the hope that he would be able to improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of his loans from NWTF-PD, he has been able to increase their family income by engaging in chicken/pork barbecue sales, driving a passenger tricycle and selling RTW. Now he earns an average monthly income of 10,000 Philippine pesos from his business activities. Roberto is a member in good standing. His previous loan of Php 18,000 was used to maintain his tricycle and to add capital to his chicken/pork barbecue and RTW businesses, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now he is borrowing, for his seventh loan, the amount of Php 19,000, which he intends to use for tricycle maintenance and the chicken/pork barbecue and RTW businesses. Roberto is working hard to achieve his dreams and aspirations for his family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Maintenance for his motorcycle and additional working capital for his other businesses

loans.name: Cendana Indah (Group B)

texts.en:
Cendana Indah Group B is comprised of fifteen women from Kaliakah village near the town of Melaya in northwest Bali. These women manage various types of businesses ranging from shop traders, to cattle and pig farmers, to produce sellers. The group, which is led by a chairwoman and treasurer (pictured above) requested a loan of Rp. 9,999,990 which will be distributed to the group members according to their individual needs and business skills.

The chairwoman of the group is responsible for the borrowing of all the members and to share the money equally in accordance with their business needs. At the end of the loan period, the chairwoman and treasurer will collect the repayments from each member in a group meeting.

One of the members of the group is Ni Komang Karleni who has a business in the school cafeteria. Her portion of this loan is Rp. 350,000 which will be used to buy foods that are sold such as rice packets, fried noodles, chicken soup, porridge, various snack foods and soft drinks. Each day she begins selling at 6 a.m. Her clients are mostly school children, but also people from the area. Her efforts are in demand because her food is very good and cheap.

Ni Komang Karleni’s income per day is approximately Rp. 60,000. Her income goes towards capital for her shop, everyday needs, and personal savings. She was only educated through junior high school level so she wants her son to be able to attend school up to university level so he can improve his life.


Note to Kiva Lenders:  
This group uses a community lending model (commonly referred to as Village Banking) that is very common throughout Asia. In this model, a select number of group representatives will take out a large loan on behalf of their entire group (often an entire village). They will then distribute and manage the loan and collect repayments for the lender.

This is a common and efficient practice in the region, but it makes reporting on Kiva somewhat unusual. Unlike most other loans, Kiva’s partner, MUK, will be in contact primarily with the group leadership team who in turn will be overseeing the end borrowers. As such, journal updates likely will reflect the performance of the lending group rather than the individual end borrowers.
 
To learn more about Village Banking on Wikipedia, please click here.

loans.use: To buy foods that are sold in her business

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna P., is a rice grower from Norala, South Cotabato. She has five children, the eldest being 21 and helps her on the farm. Currently, she owns a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) farm and this is what she solely depends on for income to accommodate their daily needs.

The loan that she applied from Community Economic Ventures Inc., Myrna will use the money to buy farm supplies to grow her harvest.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin, de 25 años, es un joven carismático y con grandes aspiraciones, es soltero y vive con su hermano mayor en la bonita casa que construyó con sus propias manos. Sus padres viven en la chacra, lo que les facilita atender sus cultivos.

La curiosidad hizo que Edwin sea un experto en el oficio de la construcción a base de madera, actividad que le enseñó su tío y para perfeccionarse estudió en una institución técnica  especializada. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a construir casas, escuelas y elabora muebles de todo tipo. Paralelamente cultiva café y plátanos en sus terrenos propios, estas actividades son bastante rentables por lo que vive cómodamente, esperando encontrar una pareja para conformar su propia familia.
Lo que más le gusta es barnizar sus obras, pues es la fase final donde puede apreciar su labor lo cuál le llena de orgullo, con el transcurrir del tiempo piensa terminar de construir su casa, comprar más terrenos de cultivo y un camión con el que pueda trasladar sus productos hacia la capital (Lima), para percibir mejores utilidades e incluso ayudar a sus vecinos y llevar progreso a su localidad.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP, es conciente de que debe ser responsable y pagar puntualmente sus cuotas para no hacer quedar mal a su banco comunal, donde es muy apreciado. Con los mil quinientos soles que solicita comprará materiales de construcción como laca, bisagras, chapas, multiplacas y pintura para su trabajo.
texts.en:
Edwin is 25 years old and a charismatic young man with great aspirations. He is single and lives with his older brother in a beautiful house that he built with own hands. His parents live on a farm where they tend to their crops.

Edwin’s curiosity motivated him to become an expert in building things made of wood. His uncle taught him this trade and he later perfected his skills at a specialized technical institution. For the past five years, he has constructed houses, schools, and has built all types of furniture. At the same time, he grows coffee and bananas on his own land. These activities are profitable enough to allow him to live comfortably. He hopes to find a wife so that he can start his own family.

The part he enjoys most is varnishing his creations because it is the final stage when he can appreciate the work that fills him with pride. Over time he expects to finish the construction of his house, buy more land for farming, and acquire a truck so that he can transport his products to the capital of Lima. This will generate better profits as well as help his neighbors and bring progress to his community.

This is his second loan with MFP. Edwin is aware that he must be responsible and punctual with his payments so that his Communal Bank won’t look bad. The other members greatly appreciate him. With this loan of 1500 PEN, Edwin will purchase building materials such as lacquer, hinges, boards, multi-layered wood panels, and paint for his work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials for his work

loans.name: Kossi Richard

texts.en:
Kossi Richard A. is 44 years old. He is married, has two children and lives in the Agoé district of Lomé, Togo. Mr. A. runs a grocery store. He sells a variety of staple products as well as a local alcohol called sodabi. 

He began this business two years ago and is currently requesting his first loan from WAGES, a Kiva partner. He will use this loan to purchase four boxes of condensed milk, five sacks of sugar and six barrels of cooking oil. By keeping his shelves stocked, Mr. A. will be prepared for the ongoing demand of his customers.

loans.use: Purchase of condensed milk, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.es:
Miguelina es una madre de familia de 60 años de edad que vive junto a su hija, su yerno y sus nietos en el sector Simón Bolivar de la ciudad de Chiclayo, conocida como La Ciudad de la Amistad, es una zona altamente comercial, es capital de la ciudad de Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la venta de almuerzos en los exteriores del centro comercial Aguas Verdes, el cual se encuentra ubicado cerca al Mercado Modelo, en toda la zona se concentra bastante comercio formal e informal. Ella prepara almuerzos todos los dias y los lleva al lugar en donde los vende a los comerciantes de la zona, Miguelina es bastante conocida  y todo lo que lleva a diario lo vende completamente. Los ingresos que percibe los utiliza para sustentar sus gastos personales y ayudar al sostenimiento familiar.

Miguelina desea ampliar su negocio para poder satisfacer la demanda diaria que acude a su puesto para proveerse de alimentos, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de de insumos para seguir preparando mas platos de comida y así lograr su objetivo.

Miguelina es una mujer que gusta mucho de mantenerse activa y ganarse su propio sustento, su mayor anhelo es instalar un restaurante en un local mas grande y asi ampliar aun mas la cobertura de su atención. Las personas que la conocen la consideran una mujer bastante responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Miguelina, age 60, lives with her daughter, her son-in-law, and her grandchildren in the Simón Bolivar sector of the city of Chiclayo. It is known as the City of Friendship, and it is a highly commercial area. It is the capital of the city of Lambayeque. For over five years she has been selling lunches outside of the Aguas Verdes (Green Waters) commercial center. It is located close to the Mercado Modelo (Model Market). There is a lot of formal and informal commerce concentrated in the entire area. She prepares lunches everyday and takes them to the place where she sells them to the merchants in the area. Miguelina is well know, and she sells everything that she takes to sell daily. She uses the income that she gets to pay for her personal expenses and to help support the family. Miguelina wants to expand her business in order to be able to meet the daily demand for food at her stand. That is why she is requesting, for the first time, a loan for 1,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternantiva. She plans on using it to buy supplies to keep preparing more food and achieve her objective. Miguelina is a woman who really likes to stay active and earn her own living. Her biggest desire is to set up a restaurant in a larger place and be able to wait on more people. The people who know her consider her to be very responsible and hard-working.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to make food and expand her business

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Tungalag B., 48, lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband have their own plot of land with a house and yard where they are currently living. They have five sons who are grown up and live separately from them. Her husband, Munhtur, operates a transportation business with a micro-bus which belongs to someone else.  He earns 15,000 MNT per day. 


Tungalag runs a women's clothing business at Narantuul, the biggest market in Mongolia. She purchases a variety of women's clothing once or twice a month. In addition, she purchases high quality clothing twice a year from Beijing.  She has been planning to expand her business and to operate in a big trading center. Tungalag has gained valuable experience in previous years and she would like to purchase her own car in the future. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase women's clothing, especially shirts, from Beijing.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Anarkul's Group

texts.en: Human life is full of unhappy occasions and events. Not everything goes smoothly and happens the way we want it. However, life itself is a great source of relaxation for people who possess imagination and creativity. Nobody is obliged to suffer and be an outsider. Anarkul T., the leader of this group, had faced quite a big ordeal when she divorced her husband as she still had to provide a living for her two children and her daughter was very little at that moment. However, Anarkul decided to accept things as they were and just keep going. Five years ago, right after her divorce, she made a decision to come to the capital and she started her own business. It was not that easy since she had a little child to take care of. She remembered her old skill of making traditional blankets and pillows. She started selling blankets, pillows and other hand made articles, and over the past years she has managed to provide for herself a stable income. She has big plans of opening a factory to produce blankets and pillows. She believes that this factory would at least provide some women with jobs. Now Anarkul needs this loan to invest money in producing blankets and pillows, to purchase wadding and for quilting. Anarkul’s partners: Meerim I., 29, is married and has a son. Her husband works as a policeman. Meerim works for the net marketing company Oriflame. Meerim and her husband need a loan to buy two calves to raise. Anara B., 54, is a mother of three children. She sells detergents and soft drinks and manages to earn around $200. Her husband is a farmer. Their children help Anara work in a shop. Anara hopes to obtain this loan and invest it in increasing the turnover and assortment of goods for sale. Darika K., 47, is a widow. She is the mother of three children. Her son works as a salesman and helps Darika to provide for the family. Darika sells different kinds of consumer’s goods. Now she needs a loan to purchase paints and make some repairs at home. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy materials needed for production

loans.name: Monika

texts.en:
Monika M. is currently in the business of selling beans and pulses at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of rice to sell. Monika is 34 years old and married; her husband is a driver. She has 2 children, who both attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to stock bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Sope Cheikhna Cheikh Sadibou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE CHEIKHNA CHEIKH SADIBOU est un des groupes de solidarité du Banc Villageois de RANDOULENE SUD, il est composé de 09 femmes toutes issues du même quartier. Elles sont toutes mariées et mères d'au moins de 03 enfants. Elles sont âgées entre 25 et 50 ans et se sont organisées par proximité et par affinité. Le groupe est créé depuis un an, les membres Kodé L. et Monique D. viennent faire leur adhésion et ont reçu leur premier prêt. Elles développent des activités diverses, à savoir le petit commerce d'effets vestimentaires, de produits cosmétiques, de produits halieutiques, de chaussures. Déguène D. n’a pas était prise en photo, elle était à l’enterrement d’un parent

Madame Khady G., responsable du groupe est âgée de 29 ans, elle est divorcée et vit avec ses deux enfants (un garçon et une fille) elle a adopté volontairement 05 enfants qui sont dans des situations très difficiles. Depuis 2002 elle développe des activités diverses de petit commerce, elle vend de l’encens, des savons, du parfum  etc.  Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité afin de réaliser plus de profits et de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels et ceux de ses enfants tout en renforçant son niveau d’épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sope Cheikhna Cheikh Sadibou is one of the community groups of the Randoulene Sud loan group, it is made up of 09 women all from the same neighbourhood. They are all married and mother to at least 03 children. They are between 25 and 50 years old and are organised by proximity and by affinity. The group was created one year ago, the members Kodé L. and Monique D. have joined the group and have received their first loan. They develop various activities, such as small businesses in clothing, cosmetics, fishing products and shoes. Déguène D. is not present in the photograph for she was attending a famiL. funeral. Mrs Khady G., the head of the group is 29 years old, she is divorced, and she lives with her two children (a boy and a girl) she has also benevolentL. adopted 05 children who are in great difficulty. Since 2002 she has been developing various activities in small businesses, she sells incense, soap, perfume etc. Her new loan will allow her to enhance her activity in order to increase her income and cope with her personal needs and those of her children while at the same time increasing her savings.

Translated from French by Barbara Belli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve the group's financial self sufficiency

loans.name: Tafaimaa

texts.en:
Tafaimaa V. is 48 and married with 3 children, ages 12 - 21.  She owns a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community.  She has many years of experience in this business. Tafaimaa  needs a loan of 1,500 WST to purchase new items to expand her product offering.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or $104 per week) to improve her business.

In 2006, Tafaimaa joined SPBD.  This is her 5th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Tafaimaa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD:

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: Roselyn J. is from the village of Liong, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 33 years old. Roselyn is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Roselyn sells seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Roselyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Roselyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roselyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Roselyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Isatu.  She is married and has 2 children, aged 18 and 16. She has 7 additional dependents, some of whom are school-going children.  In 2002, Isatu established pure water, soft drinks, and ladies' and men's wear businesses. She began her business because she was sure that by doing so she could be helpful in solving domestic problems and also establish strong customer relations for possible expansion of her business. 

 Working 6 days a week and 9 hours a day, Isatu earns about Le 1,685,400 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL.   She requires a loan in order to expand her business by buying additional stock.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 252,810 SLL.  

In the future, Isatu plans to sells goods that always match the season.  Isatu moves around a lot in order to sell her goods.  She sells to all categories of people but the majority are youth.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es: El señor Victor Hugo vive en la zona del Barrio Braniff, él junto a su esposa viven en la casa de sus familiares, él hace 3 años que se dedica al servicio de transporte urbano que realiza en su vagonta mientras que su esposa la Sra. Yaquelin se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos y con esos ingresos ayuda a la economia de su hogar, ellos tiene dos hijos que asisten al colegio. Son personas trabajadoras y responsables, ellos necesitan el crédito para comenzar a construir su casa en un terreno que ellos tienen y necesitan para la compra de cemento, loza, techo, pintura, para estar ya independendientes y poder brindarles mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
Víctor Hugo lives in the Braniff neighborhood with his wife in a relative’s house. For the last three years he has provided urban transportation services in his car while his wife Jaquelin sells cosmetics. Both their incomes help support the family. They have two children going to school. They are hard working, responsible people and need financing to start building their house on a lot they own. They need to buy cement, tile, roofing materials and paint so that they can live independently and provide better conditions for their family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Crecer Group

texts.es: Pedro (presidente del grupo) tiene 43 años D. edad y 2 años trabajando con Edaprospo ,y la señora Clelia (tesorera) tiene 58 años y 9 años trabajando con Edaprospo, ambos son parte del grupo “Crecer” el cual ya lleva 9 años desD. que se fundó, en la última oportunidad fue conformada por 10 personas, además el grupo se formo por la amistad y ganas D. progresar D. los vecinos D. la zona y el nombre fue idea D. la señora Clelia por la idea D. crecimiento no solo en el sentido económico, sino como personas. El Sr. Pedro ah trabajado por 8 años haciendo transporte privado, la Sra. Clelia trabaja ya 10 años en la venta D. comidas, además D. poner una librería la cual está implementando poco a poco, sus ingresos le sirve para mantenerse y pagar el tratamiento D. su columna, espera prontamente construir y mejorar su casa e implementar su librería. Ambos están felices por la ayuda que reciben D. Edaprospo que les brinda un capital para su trabajo y esperan que se les aumente su negocio y la capacidad D. crédito que les brinda Edaprospo.
texts.en:
Pedro, group President, is 43 years old. He has been collaborating with Edaprospo for two years. Clelia, 58, is group Treasurer and she’s been working with Edaprospo for 9 years. Both are part of the “Crecer” (To Grow) group which was founded 9 years ago. During its previous cycle it had 10 members. The group formed thanks to the wish several neighbors had to strengthen their friendship and prosper together. The name for the group was Clelia’s idea because the idea was to grow not only economically but as persons too Pedro has worked in private transport for 8 years and Clelia has sold prepared meals for 10 years in addition to starting a bookstore that she’s been equipping bit by bit. Her income helps her support herself and pay for her back treatments. She hopes to build and improve her house and stock her bookstore. Both are happy for the help they receive from Edaprospo which provides them with capital for their work and they hope their business will grow as well as their credit capacity from Edaprospo.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products and ingredients.

loans.name: Reinaldo

texts.es:
El señor Reinaldo tiene 64 años de edad, es separado, tiene una hija ya mayor de edad e independiente a él, vive en el barrio denominado Sportivo de la ciudad de Itá.
 Hace poco mas de 2 años volvió de la República de Argentina, donde había viajado para realizar diversos tipos de trabajo como empleado y de esa forma pudo contar con un capital para invertir en un negocio, actualmente posee un puesto comercial en el mercado municipal de la ciudad hace 1 año, allí realiza la venta de diversos artículos como ser bazar, regalos, juguetes, bijouterie y artículos de  santería. 
 Solicita el préstamo en esta ocasión para surtir sus artículos de juguetería con la compra de camioncitos, pelotas, muñecas, mochilas y otros juguetes.
texts.en:
Reinaldo is 64 years old, separated and has a grown-up daughter who lives independently. He lives in the Sportivo district of the city of Itá. He returned from Argentina just over 2 years ago, having travelled there to do various jobs and earn enough capital to invest in a business. He has been running a stall in the city's municipal market for a year now, and sells various items such as hardware, gifts, toys, jewellery and religious merchandise. He is now requesting a loan to expand his stock of toys. He wants to buy toy trucks, balls, dolls, rucksacks and other toys.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy toys, gifts, jewellery, religious merchandise etc.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua C. is married and has three children. She has been through junior high school. Ekua sells toothbrushes, Pepsodent, body creams and other items by moving from one area to another at Abura. Her husband is an office clerk.  Ekua uses her income to help her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Ekua will use the loan to purchase more of her goods for sale.  Ekua plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business.

loans.use: purchase more of her goods for sale

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma T. is a married woman who lives in Zone 1, Brgy. PinucoT., Patun-an, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store and peanut-butter making. Her husband, Joel T., who is 50 years old, works as a loan officer to earn his living. They have two children who are 13 and 16 years old respectively. 

Erma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Erma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 12,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,400, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her seventh loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000, which she intends to use to purchase products for her general store and rice to resell so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. 

Erma T. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending page on Kiva to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Purchase more stock of goods to sell

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen B. is a 42-year-old mother of three children.She is industrious and committed to helping her husband. The hardship she is experiencing today is her inspiration to continue her membership and be able to get higher loans in the future.

Allen joined first Kiva field partner, ASHI attracted by ASHI's lower interest rates and range of loans for business, education, and home repair. Prior to ASHI, Allen had no access to capital to support her entrepreneurial dreams. Allen hopes her ventures will flourish so she can provide long term financial stability for her family.

Allen applied for this loan to engage in a buying and selling of RTW (ready-to-wear-clothes), rice, dry goods and others. She wants to save more money to finance the education of her three children who are already in school. The oldest child is a first year college student and the other two are in elementary school. She promises her group mates to do  good performance to be able to achieve her dreams through the support of ASHI and KIVA.

Allen's one hope and dream is to alleviate her family from poverty. Allen is very pleased to be a Kiva borrower and says thank you for helping fund her business endeavor.

loans.use: To engage in buying and selling business such as RTW (ready-to-wear-clothes), rice, dry goods and others.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela, de 40 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Jorge de 40 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Marion de 14 y Jorge de 7 años, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. En la ciudad de San Francisco Graciela tiene su tienda de abarrotes, ella se siente muy feliz con su negocio, ya que le es muy rentable y está muy bien ubicada, justo en la calle principal de la ciudad. Desde las 5 y 30 de la mañana abre su tienda y se dispone a vender los productos que tiene en stock, esta actividad la realiza hasta las 10 de la noche que es la hora cuando cierra su tienda. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender y es muy buena haciéndolo, ya que siempre sus clientes salen muy contentos de su tienda, lleva 4 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su bodega, sin poder salir a la calle a realizar otras actividades. En adelante, espera mejorar su tienda y hacerla crecer, para así poder atender mejor a sus clientes. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, espera ser puntual en sus pagos, ya que no desea perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida y respetada. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Graciela is 40 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own home together with her husband, 40 year-old Jorge, and her two beloved children, Marion who is 14 and Jorge who is 7.  Her children are the main motivation behind her hard work.

Graciela has a grocery store in the town of San Francisco.  She is very happy with her business since it is very profitable and very well located, in the main street in town.  She opens her store at 5.30am and starts to get ready to sell the products which she has in stock.  She does this until 10.00pm which is when she closes her store.  What she most likes about her work is selling and she is very good at doing this since her customers always leave her store very happy.  She has been in this business for 4 years and considers the most difficult bit of her work to be the fact that she has to stay in her store all day long without being able to go out and do other things.  In the future, she is hoping to improve her store and make it grow so that she can better serve her customers.

This is Graciela's fifth loan with MFP.  She hopes to be punctual with her repayments since she doesn't want to inconvenience the other members of her community bank who all like her and respect her.  She will use the 1,000 nuevos soles she is requesting to buy more products so that she can improve her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy products to stock her store

loans.name: Gisela

texts.es: Gisela, de 30 años, vive al lado de su esposo Walter de 25 años, que es minero y de sus 2 pequeños hijos, juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Hace más de 2 años, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la comercialización de ropa, sabanas, colchas, zapatos y zapatillas. Ella compra una vez al mes en un gran emporio comercial de la ciudad y trae por pedidos diferentes tipo de prendas; y luego sus ocasionales clientes le pagan al crédito. Le gusta mucho su negocio pues es tranquilo y le permite atender a sus pequeños hijos; además le genera considerables ganancias que le permiten ayudar a su esposo en los constantes gastos del hogar. Lo que no le gusta es que algunos clientes se retrasan en el pago puntual de sus deudas, pues se estanca su capital, pero al final le cancelan con intereses. Tiene muchos planes para el futuro como el de instalar un puesto de venta de ropa en el mercado de su zona, pero sabe que con mucho esfuerzo lo logrará. Es el  segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Gisela tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería en ropa y zapatillas que necesita para ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes; además necesita abastecerse por campaña navideña.
texts.en: Gisela, 30, lives with Walter, her husband of 25 years, who is a miner and with their 2 small children, and together they work hard every day to get ahead. For more than 2 years, this enterprising woman has sold clothes, sheets, bedspreads, and shoes. She buys once a month at a big commercial center in the city and she brings back on order different types of garments; and then her customers pay her on credit. She really likes her business as it is peaceful and it allows her to look after her small children; in additional it generates a considerable profit which enables her to help her husband with the constant household expenses. What she doesn't like is that some customers fall behind in paying their debts, which then ties up her capital, but in the end they are settled with interest. She has a lot of plans for the future like setting up a stall selling clothes at the market in her area, and she knows that with a lot of effort she will succeed. This is the second loan that she has had with MFP and she promises to pay her installments on time as she doesn't want to give a bad impression to the people who have made this support possible which allows her to keep working in search of progress. Gisela plans to use the requested loan to purchase clothing and shoes which she needs to offer the best to her customers; in addition she needs to stock up for the Christmas campaign.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Leonid

texts.en:
Leonid is married with two grown children. He is a market entrepreneur from the town of Berdyansk in the south of Ukraine. Leonid sells small retail items, i.e. sockets, drills, extension cords, etc., in one of the local markets of his hometown. He is always friendly with his customers. Leonid’s prices are average and affordable for most of his clients. Leonid has been in this trade for 15 years.  

Leonid is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to increase the selection of retail items he offers for sale in his kiosk. One of his business plans is to buy another vending facility and open one more location to sell his merchandise. The current loan will bring Leonid one step closer to making his business a successful venture, bringing him and his family much-needed stable income.

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more items like sardines, milk, eggs, butter, bath soap, toothpaste, and toiletries

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
el sr. Juan Francisco G. F. tiene 47 años de edad, su negocio siempre a sido la venta de leña, pero el año pasado empezo a cultivar cafe y platanos y este negocio le estara dando los frutos para este año, tambien vende lacteos.
Juan es un sr. emprendedor y muy luchador, se a esforzado mucho para sacar adelante a su familia.
nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que sus cultivos estan floreciendo y piensa que este año tendra una produccion de cafe y platanos.
el credito lo utilizara para siembra de cafe en una nueva parcela, tambien comprara leña y lacteos.
Juan es una persona responsable y de buena conducta moral.
su meta es poder hacer que crezca su pequeña finca de cafe para tener buenas ganancias en un futuro.
texts.en:
Juan Francisco G. F. is 47 years old. He has always worked selling firewood, but last year he started growing coffee and bananas, which he will be harvesting this year. He also sells dairy products.
Juan is a motivated, diligent man who has worked hard to improve his family's lives.
He told us that he's very happy that his plantings are flowering, and he thinks that this year he will be able to harvest coffee and bananas.
He will use the loan to plant coffee on a new plot of land, as well as buying wood and dairy products.
Juan is an upright, responsible person.
His goal is to be able to expand his small coffee farm to have greater earnings in the future.

loans.use: Purchase firewood and dairy products

loans.name: Zita

texts.en:
Zita S. is from the village of Sta. Ana, Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 56 years old. Zita is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Zita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, and toothpaste in the local community. Zita has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Zita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Zita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Zita is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This loan will be Zita's fourth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tohirjon

texts.en:
Tohirjon runs a transportation services business in his hometown of Tursunzade, Tajikistan. He is married and has one child. His transportation services are always in demand, which helps Tohirjon make good money and run his business efficiently. Tohirjon has been in this trade for six years. He seeks a loan of $2,000 USD to replace his car with a new one. He is hoping to continue running this business as it brings good income for him and for his family. Tohirjon is an experienced technician and knows a lot about vehicles. He used to sell cars in the local car market but decided to quit and launch his own small venture. Tohirjon is happy to have this business as it feeds his family and helps him to survive in this challenging economic environment.
 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase a new car

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene pertenece al banco comunal “Los Solidarios” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

Marlene, tiene 31años de edad y tiene un hijo,ella nació en la ciudad de Urubamba y actualmente vive en la misma ciudad. Marlene trabaja en una empresa privada llamada “Cerámicas Seminario” donde se dedican a la elaboración de artesanía como por ejemplo cerámica artísticos, decorativos, utilitarios, joyería, murales, esculturas y entre otros. Ya son 12 años que trabaja y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su labor.  

Marlene en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal con el dinero desea hacer mantenimiento de su casa.
texts.en:
Marlene belongs to Asociación Arariwa's communal bank called “Los Solidarios”. She is grateful for the oppurtunity that is offered through this channel and is committed to complying with her repayment schedule.

Marlene is 31 years old and has a child. She was born in the city of Urubamba and continues to live there. Marlene works for a private business called “Cerámicas Seminario” where she works on the manufacturing of artesenal products, such as artistic ceramics, decorative certamics, utilitarian ceramics, jewelry, murals, sculptures, and others. She has worked there for 12 years and it is going well thanks to the determination she brings to her work.  

Marlene is requesting this loan for personal use to maintain her home.

loans.use: To maintain her home

loans.name: Yi

texts.en: Yi T., aged 31, is a fisherman. He usually fishes for eight hours a day in and around the river in Kompong Cham province. He catches around 10 kilos of fish each day and sells them in bulk to his customers who are retail sellers in the market. His wife’s name is Sothea; she is 25 and earns a living by growing rice crops on her own farmland. The couple is blessed with two young children who are enrolled in school. Yi T. will use his loan to repair his house, which is getting old and broken. Yi T. and his wife are pictured in the photo.

loans.use: to repair his house, which is getting old and broken

loans.name: Noraly Aymet

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Noraly Aymet; ella tiene 27 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de cuyes y también la socia trabaja en un hotel, la socia los hace engordar y crecer a los cuyes y luego los vende en las distintas ferias que se realizan en la provincia de Urubamba, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de crianza de cuyes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para los cuyes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "Santa Rosita de Ayllupampa". it is located in the district of Urubamba, belonging to the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco. 

Her name is Noraly Aymet. He is 27 years old and she is married common-law. She has 1 child. She alternates her daily activities with her guinea pig livestock business and she also works in a hotel. She fattens and raises the guinea pigs and later she sells them at the different fairs that happen in the province of Urubamba. She wants to expand and improve her guinea pig business. She requests a loan to purchase feed for guinea pigs.

She is happy to have a loan and she is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to purchase feed for guinea pigs

loans.name: Ma Dolores

texts.es: La señora Dolores es originaria de la población de Zitacuaro ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa y esta pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para surtir su tienda, con el préstamo ella comprara leche, suavizantes de tela, jabón, chiles enlatados, maicena, pan, sabritas, crema, sopas etc. Ella tiene con su negocio aproximadamente 15 años y dice que puso eses negocio porque antes cerca de su casa no habían tiendas cercanas y a todos les agarraba lejos las tiendas por eso ella decidió poner una. Doña Dolores surte sus productos en diferentes tiendas de su población donde le den buenos precios para así poder ganarles algo, ella esta casada con el señor Ignacio el cual es comerciante y tubo 4 hijos ya todos casados. La meta que tiene doña Dolores con su negocio es meter unas maquinitas para que los niños de su colonia se diviertan y comprar dulces y algo de juguetería para tener bien surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dolores is from the town of Zitacuaro.  She has a grocery store in her home and is requesting a loan to buy milk, fabric softener, soap, canned peppers, cornstarch, bread, snacks, cream, soups, etc.  She has been in business for about 15 years and claims she started it because there were no stores in her neighborhood.

Doña Dolores buys her products at other stores in town where she can get good prices.  She is married to Mr. Ignacio, who is a merchant, and they have four children who are all married.

Her goal is to install little candy and toy dispensers so the children in her neighborhood can buy sweets and toys, which will help her business.

loans.use: To invest in her grocery store

loans.name: Top

texts.en:
Tending her rice-planting business is part of 53-year-old Top N.’s daily routine. Rice is an essential product vital to Cambodian people. Top N. has learned this business from her grandmother and she has been very widely known in this sector since before she was married. Her husband, Ma Thoeun, assists her with the farm work and he appears in the photograph with Top N..
In addition to the rice business, the family also sells some cows to generate extra profit. The couple has three children, two of whom are married. All of the children are still unemployed and they help on the farm. Top N. will use her loan as capital to purchase additional cows to sell.

loans.use: to purchase additional cows to sell.

loans.name: Mapatano Group

texts.fr: Leader du groupe d’affaire « Mapatano » est entrepreneur, âgée de 52 ans, mariée, mère de 9 enfants dont certains étudient et d’autres ont leurs propres foyers.Son mari est un chauffeur de direction auprès d’une entreprise privée.La cliente est vendeuse de denrées alimentaires au marché sectoriel Nyabushongo.Il ya 20 ans révolus qu’elle exerce cette activité. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 8 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’acheter 2 chèvres pour son petit élevage et le reste sera injecté dans son business habituel de vente de denrées alimentaires. En plus,elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et construire une seconde maison pour le locataire.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Mapatano» est majoritairement féminins composé de 28 membres et des 3 autres collègues du marche qui ont voulu participer dans l’ambiance à la photo de souvenir.
texts.en:
The leader of the business group “Mapatano” is an entrepreneur who is 52 years old, married, and the mother of nine children. Some of her children are in school, and others have their own homes. Her husband is a management chauffeur for a private company. Our client sells foodstuffs at the sector market Nyabushongo. She has been in this business for twenty years. However, she has just completed eight loan cycles with Hekima. 

This new loan must be enough for her to buy two goats for her livestock farm, and the rest will be reinvested in her usual business selling grocery items. In addition, she has the ambition to educate her children and to build a second house to rent out. 

Our client thanks Hekima for its actions in favor of poor women excluded from traditional banks. It is appropriate to note that this 28-member business group “Mapatano” is composed mostly of women plus three colleagues from the marketplace who wanted to be part of this souvenir photo.

loans.use: to buy two goats and more

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa  es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo” ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia  El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 62 años de edad, está casada y tiene siete hijos independientes, no cuenta con estudios.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace siete años, su préstamo anterior de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió en su negocio de venta al por menor de carne y productos derivados, también vende productos de la región.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de  S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles comprará cinco ovejas para su respectivo engorde, dos arrobas de papa y chuño.  Nos cuenta que en el negocio la ayudan sus hijos.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y así tener mayores ingresos.
Lo que le  gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the “3 de Mayo” (May 3) communal bank located in Ilave District, El Collao Province and Puno Department.  She is 62 years old, married and has seven independent children.  She never went to school.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last 7 years.  Her previous loan was for 300 new soles that she used for her meat and meat byproducts retail business; she also sells regional goods.

She will use this new, 1500 new sol, loan to buy five sheep to fatten up and two arrobas (1 arroba= 12.5Kg) of potatoes and chuño (freeze dried, dehydrated potato).  She tells us that her children help her with the business.  Her dream is to improve the business to earn higher income.  What she likes about the communal bank is the ease of loan.

loans.use: to buy five sheep to fatten up and two arrobas of potato and chuño.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly, de 40 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Cayo de 53 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Erick de 17 y Brian de 16 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Todos los días Nelly se levanta muy temprano para abrir su tienda de abarrotes, aproximadamente a las 6 de la mañana comienza con sus ventas diarias, ya que la gente que vive por su barrio sale a trabajar muy temprano. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y persuasiva, lo cual ha hecho que tenga más clientes que la competencia.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse tan temprano y no dedicarle mucho tiempo a sus hijos. Este será el décimo primer crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable y siempre esta pendiente de los acuerdos a los que lleguen en el grupo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Nelly, 40, is a very unassuming, hard working woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Cayo, 53, and their two beloved sons:  Erick, 17 and Brian 16 who she wants to provide a better quality of life for.

Nelly rises very early every day to open her grocery store.  Around 6am she starts her daily sales because the people who live in her neighborhood start out for work very early.  She is a very cheerful and persuasive seller which has led to her having more customers than the competition.

What she enjoys the most about her work is chatting with her customers.  She’s been in this business for two years and considers the most difficult part of it having to get up early and not having much time to spend with her children.

This is the 11th loan with MFP.  She has always been very punctual with her installment payments and is always watchful of the agreements reached in her group.  She will use the requested 3000 new soles to buy more products to better stock her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more stock items for her store.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
