Maïmounatou est mère de deux enfants Idriss âgé de 8ans en classe CE1 et Awèni âgée de 4 ans. Douée en restauration, elle prépare du riz, du haricot et du voandzou qu'elle vend dans une boutique. Compte tenu de la clientèle grandissante; elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son activité.

loans.use:
Purchase of 2 sacks of rice, one sack of voandzou (a type of groundnut), and one sack of dried beans

Achat de 2 sacs de riz, d'un sac de voandzou et d'un sac de haricot

loans.name: Marcelline

texts.fr: Née à Cotonou le 11 Janvier 1969 au sud du BENIN et d'ethnie Goun, dame L. Marcelline est mariée à monsieur BAKARI Mamadou, peintre automobile de profession et exerçant à Cotonou. Elle voyage régulièrement sur le GHANA, un pays de la sous région pour l'achat des ustensiles de cuisine, de plastiques, de glacières et de tissus qu'elle livre au détaillant à Cotonou. Il s'agit pour elle d'une activité bien rentable mais nécessitant beaucoup de moyens financiers. Elle vient demander ce prêt pour renforcer son fonds de roulement afin de satisfaire au mieux ses clients.
texts.en:
Born on January 11, 1969 in Cotonou, southern Benin, Mrs. Marcelline L. is from the Goun ethnic group and is married to Mr. Mamadou Bakari, a car painter by trade who works in Cotonou. She travels regularly to Ghana, a country in the West African sub-region, to buy cooking utensils, plastic containers, iceboxes and cloth, which she supplies to retailers in Cotonou. This is a very profitable business for her but requires considerable financial resources. She is requesting this loan in order to strengthen her working capital so that she can best satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 iceboxes, 3 dozen saucepans, 2 dozen plastic buckets and 15 pieces of cloth.

loans.name: Mwatum's Sisi Kwa Sisi Group

texts.en:
Mwatum B. is 30 years old and married with two children aged 10 and 14. She has been a food vendor since 2003. Every day, she works from 7am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Mwatum now hopes for a loan to buy more food items to improve her business. She will share this loan with her group members, who also have businesses dealing with shop ownership, home utensils sales, tailoring, firewood and charcoal sales, and bites sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items to improve her business.

loans.name: Nem

texts.en: Nem N., 43, is married and lives with two of her three children in the Kampong Cham province. Working a farm together with her husband, Morm Vin typically makes US$1 each day. Besides farming her husband also works in construction. Her family is also supported by two of the children who work in the garment factory. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Nem N. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$400 to purchase palm leaves to sell, a purchase that she believes can bring an increase to her daily income. Poor people take the palm leaves to build the roof cages for their animals like pigs or cows.

loans.use: Nem would like to purchase palm leaves to sell.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith tiene 21 años, convive con su pareja y sus tres hijos Noemí de 6, Yuri de 4 y Roni de 2. Es una joven madre que trabaja muy duro para brindarles a sus hijos un mejor futuro, es así que desde hace 6 años incursionó en el negocio de la venta de combustible con ayuda de su pareja. A Edith se le hace muy gratificante su trabajo, ya que los 6 años de experiencia le han dado ganas de crecer y seguir progresando,  siendo este un negocio muy rentable, ya que tiene muchos clientes, los cuales se han hecho asiduos a su pequeño puesto ambulatorio, lo único complicado es tener que estar constantemente inhalando el olor del combustible que algunas veces llega a marearla, pero estos inconvenientes son mínimos, sabiendo Edith sobrellevarlos. Este es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma y es muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más combustible para poder vender y aumentar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Edith is 21 years old, and lives with her partner and three children: Noemí who is 6 years old, Yuri who is 4, and Roni, 2 years of age. She is a young mother who works very hard to provide a brighter future for her children. It’s for this reason that, six years ago, she started in the business of selling combustible/fuel with the help of her partner. Her work is very gratifying for Edith given that the six years of experience has made her want to grow her enterprise and continue to progress. It is a very profitable business, and she has many customers who have made themselves regulars at her small ambulatory post. The only complication is that she has to constantly inhale the fuel fumes that, at times, make her dizzy. But these inconveniences are minimal, and Edith knows how to endure them. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is very punctual with the payments. With the funds sought, she will buy more fuel to sell and increase her income.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of combustible/fuel that she sells.

loans.name: Taye

texts.en: Taye O. sells children's clothes and shoes. She is 30 years old and married with 3 children. She sells her goods in the streets in Benin City, and she sees this method as the best way of getting more customers. She is happy because her sales will increase during the festive season. She needs this loan to purchase more clothes and shoes to sell. She says thank you to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more  clothes and shoes  to sell

loans.name: Darwin

texts.es: Darwin tiene 32 años, vive con su conviviente y sus tres hijos quienes son su mayor inspiración de seguir trabajando arduamente. Se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace 10 años, y gracias a su buena administración del dinero ahora es propietario de un motocarro, el cual le ayuda a fortalecer la economía de su hogar. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es el trato directo que tiene con sus pasajeros, además le es rentable porque él mismo es el chofer y no tiene que pagar un sueldo adicional. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, demostrando ser un cliente puntual en sus cuotas de pago. Con el dinero solicitado comprará repuestos para mandar a reparar su motocarro.
texts.en:
Darwin is 32 years old, lives with his common-law partner and his 3 children who are his main inspiration to continue working hard. He has been transporting passengers for 10 years and due to his sound money management he now owns a motocar which helps to increase his household income. What he enjoys most about his work is the direct contact he has with his passengers. His business is profitable because he himself is the driver and there is no need to pay an additional salary. This is his 3rd loan with MFP. He has proven himself to be punctual in his loan repayments. He will use the loan to buy spare parts to repair his motocar.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his motocar

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 64 años, es viuda, vive con sus hijos Joel de 25 años y Justina de 35 años, la cual vive con su pareja. Se dedica a la venta de ropa que trae desde la ciudad de Lima para vender en la ciudad de Puno desde hace un año, tiempo en el cual sus ventas han mejorado de sobremanera debido a la variedad de prendas que trae Carmen son muy cotizadas en las “Galerías Plaza” que es donde está ubicado su stand. A Carmen siempre le ha gustado el comercio, después de que quedó viuda se ha dedicado íntegramente a este para olvidar sus penas, poniéndole mucho empeño en sacarlo adelante, lo más difícil es el batallar sola frente a todos los problemas que se le presentan, ya que sus hijos son mayores y viven sus propias vidas y aunque su apoyo es incondicional, no es lo mismo que compartirlo con tu pareja a la cual ella extraña mucho. Carmen se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma y promete ser muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de ropa para vender en al ciudad de Puno.
texts.en:
Carmen is 64 years old, is a widow, and lives with her children Joel, 25, and Justina, 35, who lives with her husband. She sells clothing that she brings from the city of Lima in order to sell in the city of Puno. She has been doing this for a year, in which time her sales have improved exceedingly, due to the variety of clothes that Carmen offers being very popular in the "Plaza Galeria" that is her stand is in. Carmen has always liked retail, and after she became a widow she has been wholly dedicated to it, in order to forget her grief, making her very determined to get ahead. The most difficult thing is to face all of the problems that face her alone, since her chlidren are older and live their own lives. And although their support is unconditional, it's just not the same as sharing it with your husband, whom she misses a lot. Carmen meets you with her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and promises to be very punctual with her payments. With the loan money she will buy a larger quantity of clothes to sell in the city of Puno.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing amount of merchandise

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline A. O. recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya.

As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

Caroline is 31 years old, married, and has 4 children; 3 are in school, and the fourth is still too young to attend. She lives with her family in the small village of Dunga on the outskirts of Kisumu.

Caroline used to manage a children’s orphanage in Kisumu and was offered a post to manage another orphanage in Nairobi; however, when they discovered she was pregnant she was dismissed. She now has a shop in Dunga, where she sells foodstuffs and small household goods.

Caroline’s husband used to have a small business selling secondhand shoes at the bus station in Kisumu, but during the post-election violence his business was destroyed. Caroline now provides the family’s income while her husband continues to look for more permanent work beyond the small jobs he does currently.

Along with running a shop, Caroline teaches reading and writing to adults. She has been teaching for 3 years. There are 50 adults enrolled in her class, but daily attendance varies between 5 to 10 people, as schedules do not allow students to attend daily.

Caroline was interested in joining K-MET in order to learn about health education that she may pass on to her adult students. She would like to be able to teach them about family planning and nutrition, as well as the reading and writing.

Caroline has applied for her first loan from K-MET, in the amount of approximately $275. She will use the loan to purchase more stock for her shop: foodstuffs and household goods like bleach.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs and household goods

loans.name: Abdoulaye Abasse

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est marié à une dame qui est revendeuse, il n’a pas d’enfant, avec son épouse, il habite le quartier  d’agoè atsanvé. Il a ouvert  une  cafeteria qu’il a appelé « LA JOIE », c’est avec le revenu issu de cette activité qu’il arrive à prendre à charge sa femme.le stock de produits de premières nécessités rentrant dans la cuisson est pratiquement épuisé. Il est client de wages, il sollicite donc un crédit pour l’achat  de 20 plateaux d’œufs, 10 bidons d’huile, des tomates et des pâtes.
texts.en:
This gentleman is married to a woman who is a reseller, he doesn't have children and lives in the Agoè Atsanvé neighborhood with her spouse. He opened a cafeteria called "La Joie" (The Joy), whose profits enable him to provide for her wife. He's running out of stock of the essential ingredients he needs to cook. Being a client of Kiva's partner WAGES, he's seeking a loan to buy 20 boxes of eggs, 10 cans of oil, tomatoes and pasta.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy eggs, oil, tomatoes and pasta

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen A. is single with one child and has received an education through senior high school.  Ellen sells bags, materials and weaves for hair, and has done so since 2007, in Cape Coast.  

She uses her income to pay for utility bills and rent.  Ellen will use the loan to purchase more goods for selling.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Ellen plans to pay for school fees.

loans.use: Purchase more goods for selling.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: La señora Rosa M. tiene la edad  de 38 años, habita en la Francia número uno, junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus  hijos y apoyarlos en sus estudios , doña Rosa desde hace dos años trabaja como agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas que atacan al cultivo , ya que estos carecen de insumos por falta de financiamiento , ella inicio la actividad agrícola con ayuda de sus amigos que le regalaron los hijos de piña y sus propios esfuerzo , los planes hacia un futuro es poder expandir mas cultivo .El financiamiento obtenido lo va invertir en la comprar de fertilizantes  e insumos para que la producción de piña sea de buena calidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa M. is 38 years old. She lives in France number one, next to her husband, who works to help her with the home expenses. Their plans with respect to their family is to improve their children's living conditions and support them in their schooling. Mrs. Rosa has been working in agriculture for two years. Her biggest difficulty is dealing with plagues that attack her crops because she doesn't have the necessary inputs due to lack of financing. She started her farming activities with the help of her friends, who gave her pineapple seeds as a gift and also due to her own efforts. Her future plans include expanding her crops. Rosa will use this loan to invest it into purchasing fertilizers and inputs to improve her pineapple crops' quality.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and inputs for her pineapple crops

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im H. is 48 and married with two young children living at home. They live in the Kampong Cham province. She works in a grocery store, typically making $11 each day. Her husband, Bech Haiy, is a construction worker and typically makes about $2 each day. Im H. would like a loan of $1000 to purchase more grocery items to meet her clients' demands.

(Both Im H. and her husband were not available so their daughter is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To purchase more grocerie items.

loans.name: Together As One Group

texts.en:
This is Confort C., Cecilia C., and Hawa M.. They call their group Together as One. They are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, a small town twenty miles from Freetown. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT. Each of them is requesting Le 500,000. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, both in terms of size and quality. Consequently they can make better a profit and improve on their standards of living.

Confort (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group. She is forty-six years old. She was born in Koya, about twelve miles from Waterloo. She is married to a teacher and they have five children. One of their children is in college and the rest are in secondary schools. Confort sells market food like palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), pepper, rice, and many more items in Waterloo market. She has been a businesswoman for more than fourteen years.

loans.use: To expand her business selling food in the market.

loans.name: Hoàng Thị

texts.en:
S. Hoàng Thị (1301020017) is a 49-year-old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has four adult children. To make a living, S. owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising water buffalo for sale. S. has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2002, S. joined Kiva partner, TYM Fund, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. S. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This loan was used to build shelter for her livestock. S. is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be her seventh from TYM Fund. S. plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
La señora Ruth, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Flor Azangarina II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Azangaro, Provincia de Azangaro, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 28 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, es madre de 02 hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria completa,  vive en el Barrio Lisandro Luna.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles,  el cual utilizó para la compra de útiles de escritorio. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, comprará útiles de escritorio como cuadernos, papel, lapicero, fólderes, etc. 

Su mayor sueño es poder ampliar su tienda y continuar trabajando para darles educación a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y la facilidad para obtener préstamos con bajos intereses.
texts.en:
Ruth belongs to the community bank “Flor Azangarina II” (Azangarine Flower II), which is located in the Azangaro district of Azangaro province, in the department of Puno. She is 28-years old, has a live-in partner and is the mother of 2 children. Ruth has completed secondary education and currently lives in the neighborhood of Lisandro Luna. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 2 years. Her first loan was for 500 PEN, which she used to buy office/school supplies. With this loan of 800 PEN, Ruth will buy office supplies such as notebooks, papers, pens, folders, etc. Her biggest dream is to be able to expand her store and continue working so that she can provide her children with a good education. Ruth likes to save and be able to take out loans with low interest.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of office supplies: notebooks, paper, pens, folders, etc.

loans.name: Hazell Maria

texts.es: Hazell María F. M. tiene la edad de 35 años. Es madre soltera. Tiene 35 años y 2 hijos. Hezell se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras. Hace más de 5 años, que su negocio da inicio. Por lo que anteriormente solo su marido, laboraba como docente en dos turnos primaria y secundaria, ya que solamente así ayudaría a mantener sus hijos. Es por cuenta propia que Hezell decide ayudarle a su esposo y comienza con la elaboración de frutas y verduras en su vivienda. Pero con mucho esfuerzo logra salir adelante obteniendo clientes fijos. El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de papaya, sandias, mangos, naranjas y aguacate. Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Hazell María F. M. is 35 years old. She is a single mother with 2 children. Hazell sells fruits and vegetables. It has been more than 5 years since her started her business. Before, only her husband worked; he was a teacher, working in two shifts in primary and secondary school, and this was the only way he would help to take care of the children. Because of this, Hazell decided to help her husband and began selling fruits and vegetables from her home. With a lot of effort, she has succeeded in going forward and has fixed clients. This loan will be used as capital for her business so that she can buy papaya, watermelon, mangoes, oranges, and avocadoes. Her biggest dream is for her children to complete their education.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for her business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is happily married with one kid and she is 32 years old. Grace sells provisions and foodstuffs. She lives in Lagos and she has been in the business for the past two years. Grace has been borrowing from LAPO for the past two years and she is requesting a loan of N150,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She thanks all KIVA lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Reynelda

texts.es: Reynelda A. Vda. D. G. D. 60 años D. edad vive en el departamento D. Ahuachapán. Reynelda  es una mujer viuda y vive solamente con sus dos hijos ya mayores D. edad y empledos. Reynelda posee un negocio en su casa el cual es el medio D. sustento económico en su vida, ella trabaja en su negocio todos los días es una tienda surtida con productos  D. consumo, Reynelda quiere comprar nueva mercadería que le ayuD. a incrementar sus margen D. ventas, por medio D. este crédito solicitado.
texts.en:
Reynelda A. Vda. D. G. is 60 years old and lives in the district of Ahuachapán. Reynelda is a widow and lives with her two adult children who are employed. She operates a business from home which generates income for her living expenses. She works every day from her store stocked with consumer products. Reynelda is requesting a loan in order to buy new merchandise so that she can increase her sales margins.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more inventory for her store

loans.name: 038-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Luân T. Thị, a 43-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hóa, is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 38 (38 - Quảng Hưng).

Married with two school-aged children, Luân operates a family member's business venture raising cattle for sale. Luân has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 1000000 VND a month.

In 2005, Luân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 3079800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women that was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell, she is now requesting a new loan of 6000000 VND which will be used to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell. The loan will be her seventh from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, and Luân plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. P. Thị Út is a 55-year-old man who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support his business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. 2. T. Thị Tấn is a 64-year-old man who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support his business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. 3. Lê Thị Minh is a 43-year-old woman who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. 4. P. Thị Dược is a 36-year-old woman who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food. 5. T. Thị Oanh is a 44-year-old woman who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Luân T. Thị (71) là 43 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hóa. Luân là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 38 (38 - Quảng Hưng). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán. Luân thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 20 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Luân kiếm được khoảng 1,000,000 VND. Vào 2005, Luân đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Luân đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 7th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. P. Thị Út (24) là 55 tuổi nam. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. T. Thị Tấn (10) là 64 tuổi nam. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. Lê Thị Minh (89) là 43 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. 4. P. Thị Dược (25) là 36 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 5. T. Thị Oanh (88) là 44 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Paulina es casada, tiene 37 años y 4 hijos, Paulina junto a su esposo tienen una panadería en su casa, el horno es artesanal, sus productos los reparte por mayor a las tiendas, para lo cual tienen un mototaxi. Además Paulina tiene una bodega en su casa y también vende leña.
Paulina necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña.
Paulina sueña con comprar un terreno para construir su casa, comprar un carro para transportar sus productos y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Para la compra de leña.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene  es socia del Bancomunal  Mar del Plata, es casada y un hijo de 23 años. Que estudia y trabaja. 
Marlene se dedicaba a cuidar una niña en casa de unos señores, pero la familia se fue a otro país y ella se quedo sin trabajo, entonces ella tuvo la idea de vender hamburguesas en la calle, así estuvo por tres años, con los ahorros ella decidió alquilar un local pequeño y puso una jugueria, ella atiende todo el día con su mama.
En Finca ella aprendió a ser responsable con los pagos, aprendió a no endeudarse.
Marlene necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para surtir su jugueria.
El sueño que tiene Marlene es que su negocio crezca y contratar un personal para que le ayude.
texts.en:
Marlene is a member of the Communal Bank “Mar del Plata” (Sea of Silver). She is married and has a 23 year old son who works and attends school.

Marlene previously worked as a caretaker for a little girl at a private residence, but the family moved to another country and she was without a job. She then had the idea to sell hamburgers as a street vendor and was engaged in that business for three years. Using her savings, she decided to rent a small vending space and opened a juice bar. She attends to her current business all day with the help of her mother.

As a client of FINCA, Marlene learned how to be responsible with her payments and not accumulate too much debt. She needs a loan of 1000 soles to restock her juice bar. Marlene hopes that her business will continue to grow and that she can hire another employee to help her.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory & supplies for her juice bar

loans.name: Dennys Maradiaga

texts.en:
Dennys sells fruit and vegetables to his customers. He is requesting a loan so he can buy vegetables for his store in bulk. Buying in bulk helps him save money and offer better prices to his customers. He started his vegetable business 6 years ago with a loan from a different micro-finance institution. His vegetables are displayed in baskets in the El Bisne Market in Chinandega.

"Receiving loans from CEPRODEL has helped me a lot," said Dennys. It helped him expand his business and now he is better able to handle requests for vegetables from restaurants. Dennys is 37 years old. He is married with 3 children. All three of his children are currently in school.

loans.use: To buy vegetables in  bulk

loans.name: Hamidou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Hamidou Bagayogo est un homme marié de cinquante neuf ans, vivant dans un foyer monogame avec  ses neuf  enfants et son épouse à Sélingué situé à 140 kilomètres de Bamako (la capitale du Mali) relevant de la troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Hamidou est un militaire à la retraite qui a rejoint sa terre natale, après l’armée. Il œuvre dans les activités stockage commercialisation depuis bientôt quatre ans. 
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, il décide de collaborer avec le programme crédit de  Soro Yiriwaso. Monsieur B. est  à son premier prêt individuel  avec l’institution et compte l’utiliser pour acheter, 600  kilogrammes de maïs, 500  kilogrammes d’arachide et 350  kilogrammes de haricot. Il s’approvisionne une fois par quinzaine  auprès des producteurs  pour stocker et revendre pendant une période où le prix des céréales est un peu élevé. Il vend aux marchés de Sélingué et de Dalabala, aux consommateurs et aux détaillants.
Il espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen trimestriel de 130. 000 FCFA qui servira à payer l’échéance du prêt et subvenir aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Mr Hamidou Bagayogo is a married man with 9 children, he lives in a monogamous family with his nine children and his wife in Sélingué, which is located 140 kilometers from Bamako (the capital of Mali), part of the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. Hamidou is a retired military office, who returned to his birthplace after the army. He has been working in the business of commercial storage for the past four years. Having researched financial resources to assist his business, he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. Mr. B. is taking his first individual loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He will use it to purchase 600 kilograms of corn, 500 kilograms of peanuts and 350 kilograms of beans. He supplies himself once every two weeks with the produce to stock and resell during the period of time when the price of the grains is slightly elevated. He sells in the markets of Sélingué and Dalabala, to consumers and retailers. He hopes to earn an average quarterly profit of 130,000 FCFA, which he will use to repay his loan and to provide for his family expenditures.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase grains

loans.name: Elise

texts.fr: A. Elise est née en 1957 à Allada, dans le département de l’Atlantique au Bénin. Elise réside depuis près de 50 ans à Ahito à Allada. C’est une veuve et mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. En plus de ses enfants, Elise a un autre enfant à charge. Elise supporte seule les charges de la famille. Elise n’a pas été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Elise vend des condiments de sauce (tomates fraîches, piments, oignons, tomate en boîte, gingembre, etc.), du gombo à son domicile et au marché de Allada. C’est à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin que Elise s’approvisionne. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Elise sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé afin d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et son chiffre d’affaire surtout en période de fêtes de fin d’année.
texts.en:
Elise A. was born in Allada, in the Atlantic Department of Bénin in 1957, and has lived nearly all her life in Ahito, in Allada. She is a widow, mother of four, who also supports a fifth child. Elise never attended school, but all of her children are educated. To provide for her household, Elise sells sauces and condiments (fresh tomato, pepper, onion, canned tomatoes, ginger, etc.) and gumbo at her home and also at the market in Allada. She purchases her goods in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. She is a long-time client of ALIDé, who has successfully repaid her loans. She is requesting a third loan to increase her working capital to increase sales during the year-end holidays.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stock of fresh tomatoes, peppers and onions.

loans.name: Sothear

texts.en:
Mrs. Sothear Y. lives in Phnom Lun Tas village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 2.5-hectare (6.25-acre) piece of land on which she cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a pig breeder.

Since her pig-breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets, pig feed, and medicine to care for them. Her husband, Mr. Mak Kunthea Ro, owns a rice mill machine. This couple has a child who is just four years old.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets, pig feed, and medicine to care for them

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 30-year-old married woman with a 3-year-old daughter and a 10-year-old son who attends school.

Florence owns “Flomax Auto Spares”, which sells spare parts and accessories. She has been in the business for two years. Previously, she worked in a salon. Florence wants to use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more spare parts.

Through being a member of Faulu, Florence has learned to manage her business more professionally and has improved her customer service skills and her record keeping. She hopes to establish a boutique someday to improve her income enough to purchase a plot on which to build a house. Florence describes herself as committed and hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to two children who are both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community.

Sandra works hard to help her husband provide for the family. She is a hairdresser by profession. Sandra works in a shop by the roadside in her community. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy artificial hair, pomade, and other working materials to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy artificial hair, etc. for her business

loans.name: Women Of Peace Group

texts.en: Oretha N. is the leader of group of five borrowers called Women of Peace. She is unmarried with two children, a daughter age 21 and a son age 14. Oretha's daughter is a high school senior and her son is in the third grade. Oretha herself is a high school graduate. Oretha does not get financial support for her children from their father. She also cares for her mother. Oretha's business is the sale of foodstuffs such as flour, sugar, butter, beans and rice. She sells from a table at the Red Light Market, Liberia's largest market on the outskirts of the capital, Monrovia. Before she sold foodstuffs, Oretha specialized in selling fresh fish, but changed her product line because the profit from selling fish was too small. Oretha plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 25,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy flour and sugar for resale. She hopes her business will improve and that one day, she'll be able to open a proper storefront at the Red Light Market. Oretha credits her success in business so far to being a good saleswoman who talks to her customers well. Oretha wants to help her children continue their education. Her daughter is set on going to the University of Liberia and her son says he wants to grow up to be a doctor. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Oretha is the one holding the sign. Despite the group's name -- Women of Peace -- there is one male member, Joseph S.. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy flour and sugar for resale

loans.name: Gulduzi Group

texts.en:
This is Gulduzi group which has three members: Waisuldin, Naze Gul and Waroky Bib who each have a different business.

Waisuldin is the group leader. He is 22 years old and is married with three children: two sons and one daughter. He is a tailor and has a sewing machine but it is too old and currently is not working properly. He wants to buy a new sewing machine as this is the only business which, through its income, supports his family.

The second member of this group is Naze Gul. She is a embroiderer and wants to buy cloth and other necessary things. Through her income she supports her husband and children.

The last member of this group is Waroky Bibi who runs a business making quilts. She wants to buy cotton, cloth and other essential materials.

Therefore they together have requested a group loan of 30,000 Afghani to expand their businesses and complete the requirements of their families. They are thankful for all the Kiva lenders and AFSG. Because of these loans they can improve their lives, have better health, and can buy good quality food.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: 45-year-old Rosalinda I. is dreaming to increase her harvest. Currently, she tills a one-hectare rice field but needs additional money to buy all the farming necessities. Rosalinda is from Norala, South Cotabato. The income in her business will go directly to the needs of her family. She would like to apply for a loan of PHP 15,000 at Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy additional fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Ana Silvia

texts.es: Ana Silvia G. D. M. D. 43 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ana posee una tienda D. productos perecederos en los cuales comercializa alimentos y productos D. primera necesidad para el hogar. Por medio D. este negocio, es como Ana ha salido a delante, junto a su familia, ya que es la forma en la que pueD. invertir en los gastos del hogar junto a su esposo quien también trabaja muy arduamente por salir adelantes. Ana solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. productos, tales como: huevos, pan, verduras, detergentes y otros más. Todo lo mencionado anteriormente es con el deseo D. poder seguir adelante con su negocio y D. esta manera mejorar en gran manera la economía D. su familiar. Ana posee una D. las tiendas más fuertes del lugar, por lo cual debe esforzarse más y salir adelantes para lograr mayores ventas.
texts.en:
Ana Silvia G. D. M. is 43 years old and resides in the Department of La Libertad. There she lives with her husband and their two dependent children who are in school. Ana manages a store where she sells perishable food products and basic necessities. Through this business, she has been able to get ahead with her family. Ana is able to cover the household expenses together with her husband who also works very hard so that they can succeed.

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy products in large quantities such as eggs, bread, vegetables, detergents, and other items. Above all, she has the desire to move forward in her business so that she can improve her family’s finances. Ana has one of the most successful stores in the area, so she must work harder in order to achieve better sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic necessity products

loans.name: Douglas Manuel

texts.es:
Este joven se llama Douglas Manuel B. Cano, tiene 41años de edad, casado, Obrero, él trabaja para una empresa donde se elaboran rones, en esta empresa tiene siete de laborar, su esposa es Ama de Casa, tiene tres hijos, dos mujeres y un varón que es el menor, la mayor ya saco sus estudios técnicos, la otra mujercita está en escuela secundaria y el menor en escuela primaria.

Con nuestra institución ha obtenido la cantidad de cuatro créditos, los que le han servido para realizar mejoras en su vivienda y este último para compra de utensilios y electrodomésticos para él hogar, vale mencionar que en los cuatro créditos otorgados anteriormente, este joven  ha sido muy responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
This young man is Douglas Manuel B. Cano. He's a 41-year-old, married, laborer. He has been employed at a rum distillery for the past seven years. His wife is a housewife; they have three children, two girls and one boy, who is the youngest. His oldest daughter has finished a technical career while his middle daughter is still in secondary school and their son is in elementary school. He has had four loans with our institution that he's used to make home improvements. This last loan will be used to buy utensils and home appliances. It's worth mentioning that this young man has been very responsible with his obligations related to his previous four loans.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy utensils and home appliances (A bed and a stove)

loans.name: Ignacia's Group

texts.en:
Ignacia M. is from the village of Rizalina. She is 63 years old. Ignacia is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Ignacia is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Ignacia owns & operates a business selling food, primarily snacks & other delicacies, that she sells in the local community. Ignacia has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ignacia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ignacia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Ignacia is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Ignacia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Tièssiri de l’association Siguidialé, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Dioïla  préfecture de Dioîla, région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage et font le commerce de condiments alimentaires, de tissus, des fruits et beaucoup d’autres articles divers.
Ces femmes du groupe Tièssiri sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Minata Traoré qui est du groupe, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des pagnes wax et d’autres tissus à la mode.
Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Dioïla et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35.000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Tièssiri group (part of the Siguidialé association) are all married. On average, they are 37 year-old and have three children; they all live in traditional extended families in the city of Dioïla of Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got to know each other through their families or as neighbors. They sell condiments, cloth, fruits and many other miscellaneous items. This is the first solidarity loan for these women from the Tièssiri group. Minata Traoré, one of the group members, intends to use her loan to purchase "pagnes wax" (bright West-African cloth) and other fashionable textiles. She purchases her inventory from Bamako and retails locally on the Dioïla market and in neighboring fairs, accepting cash or credit from a clientele made of both women and men. She expects to make an average monthly benefit of 35,000 CFA francs, which will mainly be used for the daily expenses of her family, the remainder being reinvested in her trade activities.

Translated from French by Charlotte Buecheler, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing purchase

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 30 years old and is married with one five-year-old child who is in school.

James runs a business selling clothes in Nairobi where he sells ladies’ used clothes. He has been in this business for five years and he refers to his business environment as conducive. He employs one person and desires to grow his business and start importing clothes.

James has requested a loan of Kes 80,000 to add to his stock of ladies’ clothes. In Faulu Kenya, he has learnt and developed a savings culture. He describes himself as hardworking and committed.

loans.use: To add to his stock of ladies' clothes

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos vive en casa propia que esta ubicada en la zona central de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos.
El señor Carlos se dedica a la venta al por mayor de artículos de ferretería, fontanería y calefacción. Su puesto lo tiene en alquiler.
El crédito solicitado es para aumentar su capital de trabajo para poder traer más mercadería  y así poder tener más ingresos para la familia 
Esta es la séptima ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in his own home, located in the central zone of the city of La Paz, with his wife and four children. Carlos dedicates himself to selling hardware, plumbing and heating supplies. He works from a rented site. The loan he is requesting is to augment his working capital, in order to carry more merchandise. This would help him increase his earnings to support his family. This is his seventh loan request, and the financial analysis conducted qualifies him favorably for access to credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more products for his hardware store, where he sells a variety of products related to his trade.

loans.name: Ever

texts.es: Ever tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero. Reside en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la hermosa selva cusqueña, donde tiene una casa alquilada, a base de madera. Ever tiene un motocarro, donde hace servicio de transporte público. En un inicio le fue muy difícil levantarse, ya que viene de una familia muy humilde y desde entonces aprendió a luchar para sobresalir en la vida. Es así que hace 4 años empezó a trabajar en una empresa de transporte, ofreciendo el servicio de chofer y de las ganancias que obtenía lo ahorraba. Ahora tiene su propio motocarro, por lo que piensa adquirir otro igual y con el tiempo forma su propio microempresa de transporte. Por lo general trabaja desde las 6:00 de la mañana hasta las 11:00 de la noche y su ruta diaria son las localidades de Quimbiri y San Francisco. Sus planes a futuro es adquirir un terreno propio, para que pueda construir su casa a base de material noble. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con sus obligaciones de pago, además se siente satisfecho con su grupo comunal, por el buen clima cordial que existe. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará un motocarro de segunda mano, con la finalidad de satisfacer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ever is 23 years old and unmarried. He lives in Quimbiri which is located in the beautiful rainforest around Cusco in a rented wooden house. Ever owns a motorbike taxi which he uses to transport the public. At the beginning it was very difficult for him to make his mark in the world as he comes from a humble background. But over time he learned how to get ahead. Four years ago he began working for a transportation company as a driver, and he started saving money from his earnings. Now he owns his own motorbike taxi and is thinking of buying another and starting his own small transportation business. Generally he works from 6am to 11pm, transporting people around Quimbiri and San Francisco. In the future he would like to buy a piece of land and build a good solid house. This is Ever’s third loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he is sure to make his repayments as promised. He is happy with his community group and the friendly atmosphere that they provide. With the loan he will buy a secondhand motorbike and provide his customers with good service.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a secondhand motorbike

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en: D. Nguyễn Thị (20211030052) is a 41-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. D. is the group leader of this four-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Phù Lưu nhóm 09 (Nhóm 09). D. is married and has three adult children. She operates a family member's business making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. D. has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month. In 2009, D. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings. D. is now requesting a new loan of 7,392,000 VND which will be used to purchase tools and other equipment to expand the business. This loan will be her 2nd from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. Trần Thị K. (0) is a 28-year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her furniture-making business. 2. Nguyễn Thị B. (0) is a 43-year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her furniture-making business. 3. Nguyễn Thị H. (0) is a 28-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her furniture-making business. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** D. Nguyễn Thị (20211030052) là 41 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. D. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Phù Lưu nhóm 09 (Nhóm 09). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán trang thiết bị gia dụng thông thường cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. D. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, D. kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND. Vào 2009, D. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. D. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Trần Thị K. (0) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất. 2. Nguyễn Thị B. (0) là 43 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất. 3. Nguyễn Thị H. (0) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase tools and other equipment to expand the business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy G. N. is forty years old, married and has three children aged between the ages of nineteen years old and fifteen years old. Her business is located at Murera Juja a very busy market at Thika. She operates a hardware store in which she has been selling pipes, bicycle spare parts and other items. She has been selling to the local people for the last five years.

She has provided employment to one person. She says that this business is profitable, and the major challenge she has is insecurity in the area. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 70,000 to buy more pipes and bicycle spare parts to meet the demand of her customers. She sees herself having many hardware items to sell in the future. She wants to be a market leader in this kind of business. She describes herself as very hard-working.

loans.use: Pipes, bicycle spare parts.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa nació en la ciudad de Urubamba que se encuentra ubicado a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad del Cusco y actualmente, Rosa vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con su esposo y sus hijos. Hace 25 años Rosa que se dedica a la venta de helados “Donofrio”. Actualmente, Rosa tiene una puesto de venta en el mercado “Molino”, que esta modestamente equipado con congeladoras y neveras. La pueden encontrar los sábados y domingos en su puesto de venta, desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, pero los días particulares se encuentra un ayudante. Rosa y su esposo también llevan y venden helados en las ferias que se realizan en la ciudad del Cusco. Actualmente, su esposo se encuentra en la feria de “Cocla” en la ciudad de Quillabamba provincia de la Convención departamento del Cusco. Ya varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

Con su próximo préstamo, Rosa que espera recibir S/. 1500 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para alquilar otro puesto de venta en el mercado molino de la ciudad del Cusco.  

En el año 1994 se abrió el banco comunal “Señor de Torrechayoc”, pero Rosa es una de las fundadoras del banco comunal y le va muy bien. Los socios pusieron de nombre “Señor de Torrechayoc” a su banco comunal en homenaje al patrón jurado de la ciudad de Urubamba pues todos los socios le tienen fe.
texts.en:
Rosa was born in the city of Urubamba, located 70 minutes from the city of Cusco. Today Rosa lives in Cusco together with her husband and their children. For the past 25 years Rosa has been selling Donofrio frozen treats. She has a stand in the Molino market that is modestly equipped with freezers and ice-cream servers. She is there on Saturdays and Sundays from 9 am to 5pm but on weekends she has hired help to run the stand. Rosa and her husband also go to the various fairs in Cusco. Her husband has gone to the Cocla fair in the city of Quillabamba. She has been running her business for many years now and she has found success thanks to the hard work she has invested. The loan requested is in the amount of S/.1500 nuevos soles. She would like to invest the loan funds to rent another stand in the Molino market in Cusco. In 1994 the community bank named The Man of Torrechayo was established and Rosa was one of the founding members. The members were all religious so they named the community bank after the patron saint of the city of Urubamba.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To rent another stand in the Molino market.

loans.name: Foday Y.

texts.en: Foday is married and has 12 dependents. He trades in cosmetics and hair products in Makeni. Foday has 8 years of experience in the trading business and needs a loan of 4,500,000 SLL to buy additional cosmetics and hair products. He hopes to use the proceeds of the loan to educate his children and to buy a car for transportation. He thanks you for supporting him.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and hair products for resale

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia A. is from Cataggamam Nuevo, Tuguegarao City. She is 38 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Cresencia owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling clothing to local community members. Cresencia has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Cresencia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI, and is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Cresencia’s 10th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix M. is from the village of D'ban Calamba Misamis Occidental. He is 38 years old. Felix is single. To make a living, Felix owns and operates a service based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from motorcycle transport services in the local community. Felix has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Felix joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felix is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Felix from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Altyn's Group

texts.en:
Altyn C. is the group’s leader. She is 42 and married. Her family has two children: the daughter is a student, and the son earns money by working as a bartender. Today Altyn is engaged in her own business: she is trading in neighboring villages. Fifteen years ago, because she lives near the road, she began to sell foodstuffs, petroleum, etc. With her profits she has managed to increase her stock of cattle. Altyn hopes to put her loan into developing her business. In the future she intends to build a house on a lot in Bishkek. Also, she wants to help indigent families.

Mairamkul A., 40, is married. Her spouse makes his living by working as a school watchman. The family has three children: the eldest daughter is a seamstress, and the other two daughters are at school. The main source of income is from harvesting potatoes. She plans to use her loan for supplies and necessities. In the future, the family wants to increase their stock of cattle.

Jumabubu T. is the treasurer of the group. She is 56 and married. Her husband is a pensioner. The couple has nine children, all of whom, except the youngest one, live separately from their parents. The family business consists of cattle breeding and sales. Out of the profits they have managed to arrange their children’s weddings. The purpose of the loan is to purchase livestock. In the future Jumabubu intents to increase their stock of cattle and to improve her family's wealth.

Chynara A., 22, is married. She lives together with her parents. Her mother raises money by making national hardware. As well as helping her mother, Chynara works in Bishkek (her salary is 5000 soms per month). The purpose of the loan is to pay for her study (Chynara studies by correspondence). In the future she is planning to graduate from university and find a job in order to support her parents.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our lending team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda C. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Rhoda is married and has nine adult children. To make a living, Rhoda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rhoda has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rhoda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rhoda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Rhoda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Rhoda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina W. is from the village of Brgy. Ibung, Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 56 years old. Rosalina is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosalina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice. Rosalina has been engaged in rice cultivation for over 37 years and earns approximately 40000 PHP per harvest.

In 2009, Rosalina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Rosalina is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rosalina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Carlos Valentín

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a sus padres en el caserío Imperial del distrito de Olmos, una zona rural que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra situada a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, el cría aves de corral y ovejas en corrales situados cerca a su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre se encuentran recorriendo la zona donde reside, con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades el se encarga de solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar a sus padres con el mantenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Carlos desea ampliar su negocio comprando más animales de modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo.

El es un joven muy responsable y que siempre está buscando la manera de sacar adelante su negocio, su mayor anhelo es poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Carlos is 25-years-old, single, and lives together with his parents in the village of Imperial in the Olmos district, a rural area that is part of the Lambayeque province and this is located two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo.

He works raising and selling young animals.  He raises poultry and sheep in corrals located close to his house.  When these reach a good size he offers them for sale to buyers who are always passing through the area where he lives.  With the income he receives from these activities, he pays his personal expenses and supports his parents with the maintenance of the family expenses.

Carlos would like to expand his business by buying more animals so that he can increase his sales and see increased profits.  This is why he has found it convenient to request a loan of 1500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa that will allow him to achieve his goal.

He is a very responsible young man who is always looking for ways to move his business forward and his biggest hope is to be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase of animals to expand business raising and selling them.

loans.name: Hasifa

texts.en:
Hasifa B. is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala south region of Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Hasifa has a business of stone quarrying, which she has had for over 10 years.         

To help expand her business, Hasifa has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to employ more people.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Hasifa hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Hasifa hopes to own a stone quarrying market.

loans.use: To employ workers

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es: Cesar Meléndez  es el propietario del  almacén de ropa X Treme Wear, él es casado y tiene dos hijos en las edades de  4 y 6 años; inició vendiendo ropa por encargo entre sus amigos y familiares, después de quedar sin empleo, hace tres años, desde ese momento su negocio ha cambiado su vida porque le generó mayor autonomía y mejores ingresos para el bienestar familiar. Su sueño es convertirlo en un gran almacén, pero en su propio local y bien ubicado en el centro de Barranquilla, pero su gran desafío es el recurso financiero para ello. Este es el propósito de su credikiva que es el primer financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él comprará prendas de vestir para caballeros, entre suéteres y jeans, porque su experiencia le dice que es lo que mas salida tienen la temporada de Diciembre y Enero.  Los indicadores financieros del negocio son los siguientes: Margen de utilidad 46%, margen de contribución 54% y utilidad operativa 25%. Cesar es un hombre muy trabajador que toda la comunidad del barrio la Paz y por eso ha logrado posicionar su negocio, él es además un excelente miembro de familia, que tiene como propósito mejorar diariamente sus ingresos, mediante el trabajo constante, para sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Cesar Meléndez owns the clothing store X Treme Wear, he is married with two children aged 4 and 6.  He began selling clothing on commission to his friends and family after becoming unemployed three years ago.  Since then his business has changed his life because it allowed him more autonomy and better income for the wellbeing of his family. His dream is to have a large store on its own premises and well situated in the center of Barranquilla, but the big challenge is the financial resources to do so. 

This is the purpose for his credikiva, which is the first funding that he will receive from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With it he will buy men's clothing, including sweaters and jeans, because his experience tells him that is what most popular during the December and January period. The financial indicators of his business are as follows: 46% profit margin, 54% contribution margin and 25% operating income. 

Cesar is a hardworking man known by the whole community of the Paz neighborhood, which is why he has achieved this position with his business.  He is also an excellent family member, whose purpose is to improve their income on a daily basis through hard work, so his family can get ahead.

loans.use: To buy men's clothing, including sweaters and jeans.

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.es:
Pelagia es socia del Banco Comunal Ladrilleros de Compañía, tiene 45 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. 
Se dedica la fabricación de ladrillos en la comunidad de compañía. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de leña y carbón para el quemado de ladrillos, aprendió de ésta actividad desde niña, pues sus padres se dedicaban a éste trabajo, ahora la practica con sus esposo, los ladrillos que produce los vende a la ferreterías de Ayacucho o a veces los clientes le compran en su comunidad.
Le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal porque se practica mucho el compañerismo, le enseñan los valores y dan créditos.
Su sueño es que su negocio crezca.
texts.en: Pelagia is a member of the Ladrilleros de Compañía [Bricklayers of Compañía] Community Bank. She is 45, married, and has 2 children. She makes bricks in the Compañía community. She will invest the requested loan in the purchase of firewood and coal for brick burning. She learned this work as a child, as her parents did it. She now does this work with her husband. She sells their bricks in the Ayacucho markets, or sometimes to customers who buy them in the community. She enjoys her Community Bank meetings because they practice fellowship, teach values and give loans. Her dream is for her business to grow.

loans.use: the purchase of firewood and coal

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 49 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo José de 55 años y de su pequeña hija, juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde hace 1 año, esta emprendedora mujer instaló en su casa una tienda de venta de helados de una marca reconocida, ahí vende con la ayuda de su pequeña hija durante todo el día. Además durante los fines de semana vende cervezas y llega a comercializar por pedido a las propias casas de sus clientes, con este negocio obtiene regulares ganancias que le permiten ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar para brindarle a su familia una buena calidad de vida. Dice que le gusta mucho trabajar pues se entretiene bastante y no descuida las labores de su hogar, además tiene muchos planes para el futuro como el de ampliar su negocio para aumentar sus ganancias, y así espera salir adelante. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. María tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de helados, y también varias cajas de cervezas pues necesita abastecerse para el verano, ya que estos productos tienen bastante salida.
texts.en: Maria is 49 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Jose who is 55 years old and their young daughter. Together they work hard every day to get ahead. A year ago, this enterprising woman set up a shop in her home selling a well known ice cream. She sells all day with the help of her young daughter. On the weekends she also sells beer and she takes orders and delivers to her customer's homes.
